loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Ruth es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hija, Ruth tiene una tienda en una galería alquilada ubicada en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende ropa de damas, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Ruth necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sacos y ternos.
Los sueños de Ruth son tener una tienda en la ciudad de Lima, comprar su casa y brindarle todo lo mejor para su hija.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Pure Live Community Bank. She is 28 years old, has one daughter and lives with her partner. Ruth has a women's clothing store in a shopping center located at the central market in the city of Ayacucho. She gets her products from the city of Lima. Ruth is requesting a loan of 750 soles, which she plans to use for the purchase of sports jackets and suits. Her dreams are to have a store in Lima, buy a home and provide the best for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sports coats and suits

loans.name: Iimad

texts.en:
Iimad is a 36 year old man, who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their three children. Iimad has been working as a van taxi driver for five years. His clients can be any passengers. Iimad decided to go into this business because he wanted to be independent. 

He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is the first time that Iimad has requested a loan.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Karimjon

texts.en:
A. Karimjon is in the livestock business. He breeds livestock, with which he provides sustenance for his humble home. Karimjon is married with 4 children. It is important to note that since he started his business, he has acquired an abundance of experience due to his great dedication and the knowledge he has acquired, breeding his animals. The reason why Karimjon looks for support to IMON International is that he needs to purchase livestock so he may sell it and in that way, continue with his arduous work with cattle in his sector.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. <> But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Married with two children who are both in school, Adiza S. is a 35-year-old trader. She lives in her husband's family house in the central part of Ghana. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty, and for this reason she is very serious about her business. She trades in cereals like maize. She started this business ten years ago, and she has a strong customer base whom she supplies with the foodstuffs. She takes delivery from the farmers at Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and this has helped to cut out the middleman and increase profits. Through this Adiza has been very resourceful to her family. She uses some of the cereals to prepare fante kenkey. Fante kenkey is enjoyed by many people in Ghana. Fante kenkey is prepared from milled grains served hot with pepper and fish. She is constrained by funds but needs to buy more maize, so she is requesting a loan which will assist her to make business headway. Adiza belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’. She sells the fante kenkey by the roadside in her community where she lives.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: bolstering his working capital

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Rosa es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en el distrito de Acosvinchos en donde vende abarrotes, este negocio esta administrado por su prima. Además Rosa tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde también brinda servicio de fotocopias, los días sábados y domingos viaja a la feria de Acosvinchos en donde compra cereales.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo y cereales.
Rosa sueña con techar el tercer piso de su casa, surtir con mas productos sus negocios y comprar un carro para alquilar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Virgen de Cocharcas community bank. Rosa, 36, is in a common law marriage and has four children. Rosa has a store in the Acosvinchos district where she sells groceries. Her cousin runs the business. Rosa also has a grocery store in her house in the city of Ayacucho. She also offers photocopy services in the store. On Saturdays and Sundays she travels to the Acosvinchos fair to buy cereal. Rosa needs a loan for 2,100 PEN to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and cereal. Rosa dreams of putting a roof on the third floor of her house, stocking her business with more products, and buying a car to rent to others.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, and cereal

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
Hamzah is a 48 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their seven children. Hamzah has owned a grocery store for two years. He also sells fruits and vegetables. Hamzah requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his second cycle and he has always on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work by diversifying his merchandise. Hamzah is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties He decided on doing his business because of his financial situation. In the future, he plans on starting a new business in livestock.

loans.use: Hamzah will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa Dembélé, 42 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants en charge. Elle s’active dans la vente de mil. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter le mil en gros  pour le revendre au détail. Elle veut renforcer son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa Dembélé, 42, is married and raising 6 children. She sells millet. The loan that she is requesting will permit her to buy millet wholesale to re-sell retail. She wants to strengthen her business and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of cereals

loans.name: Esperanza 2006 Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal “Esperanza 2006” es parte del Centro Focal “Los Andes”, con aproximadamente 4 años de vida una de las integrantes es Elena M., que necesita el préstamo para comprar chamarras y así incrementar su mercadería, actualmente comercializa su producto en la feria “16 de Julio” pero ella tiene el objetivo de abrir otro punto de  venta. Al igual que Elena las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de plástico, arroz, fideo, material escolar y otros y necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
The Communal Group "Esperanza 2006" is part of the Los Andes Focal Center and has been together for about 4 years. One of the members is Elena M. who needs a loan in order to buy jackets and thereby increase her available merchandise. Currently she sells her products at the July 16th Market but she has the goal of opening another sales location. Just like Elena, the other members of the Communal Group have their own businesses like selling plastics, rice, noodles, school materials and other items. They need a loan in order to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy E. is 43 years old and she is married with six children. She sells provisions and drinks.

Mercy hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sophos Meas Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophos M. leads a loan group with 22 members, all of whom live in Boeng KrU. Leu village in Kandal province. The members of this group will use their loans for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sophos M. is a farmer who grows rice for a living. She faces a problem because she does not have oxen to do the plowing. That is why she has decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer who has two oxen to plow her rice field. She will use the balance of her portion of the loan to buy more fertilizer to make her field more productive. Her husband, Mr. Oem Voek, helps her farm. Mrs. Sophos M. is 37 years old, and she and her husband have five children, four of whom attend the local school while the fifth is still an infant. All the members of this loan group are shown here.

Six people in this group have end-of-term loans and are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. This type of loan allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her rice field, and buy fertilizer to make her field more productive.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica Y. is from the village of Centro Napu,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Jessica is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessica owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jessica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in retailing business( Sari-Sari Store ). This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Jessica from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in retailing business( Sari-Sari Store )

loans.name: Phebe

texts.en: Phebe is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She sells crates of eggs in wholesale and retail to her customers. The demand for her crates of eggs is high and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more crates of eggs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice U. is 28 years old ,single and she takes care of one person
She lives in Nyarugenge district,Kigali province ,capital of Rwanda.
She has an experience of two years in business of clothes  and employs one person in her business;starting everyday from 6h00 AM to 5h00 PM.

Before this business she was not able to get all needs in her life.
With this  loan requested in Vision Finance Company she plans to expand her business and save the money  in order to change her life forever.

loans.use: Clothes sales

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Reth H. is the group leader of six members who all live in PU. Phnum village in TaK. province. She is a drink seller. Her husband, Mr. KhU. Khim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he uses a motorbike with cart to transport passengers. This couple has five children. One of them is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, one is a seller and the others attend the local school. Now Mrs. Reth H. needs some money to buy more drinks, glasses and vegetables to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living with this loan.

loans.use: To buy drinks, glasses and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: María Dina Magdalena

texts.es: María Dina Magdalena R. de 47 años de edad reside en Tecoluca en el departamento de San Vicente. María vive con su esposo y su hija de 11 años de edad estudiante de básica, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora apoya a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor de granos básicos, hace cinco años María se dedica a su negocio el cual se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, donde vende refrescos, antojitos, tortillas y verduras; ahora solicita de un crédito para comprar leña, maíz y otros productos de los cuales ofrece.
texts.en:
María Dina Magdalena R., 47, lives in Tecoluca in the San Vicente department. María lives with her husband and their 11 year old daughter. Their daughter attends elementary school. María is a very hard-working woman. She helps her husband. He is a farmer and grows basic grains. María has worked for five years in her business, which is located in her home. She sells soft drinks, appetizers or snacks, tortillas, and vegetables. She is now asking for a loan to buy wood, corn, and other products that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Jureta

texts.en:
Jureta O. is from the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 56 years old. Jureta is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Jureta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jureta has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jureta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jureta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jureta is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the only loan taken out by Jureta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.es: Las 5 señoras de San Juan La laguna viendo sus necesidad para surtir las ventas para este fin de año y quiere incrementar sus mercaderia para compertir en la compra y venta de ropa tipica ya que ellas lo vienen realizando por 5 años atras y ellas quieren que le se apoyen para esta necesidad ya que tienen la mentalidad de superar y darles lo mejor para sus hijos y apoyararles en sus estudios por lo tanT. suplican para poder ayudarles en este sentido, ya que en el lugar donde se encuentra es un lugar muy pobre y que les a costado salir avante, y ellas mismas bordan a mano y como tambien fabrican las blusas para mujeres,
texts.en:
The five women that form the San Juan La Laguna group see the need T. provide their sales numbers for the end of year and would like T. increase their merchandise so they can compete in the buying and selling of traditional clothing. They have been selling for five years and they would like your support as they have the intention of overcoming obstacles and doing what is best for their children. They support their children with their studies and so they beg T. be able T. help in this regard as they live in a very poor place. The women also embroider by hand and make blouses for women.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise of traditional clothing

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard runs a furniture business at Malanga market in Namable. He is a married father of four schoolgoing children. He sells all types of furniture and fittings including beds, chairs and coffee tables. This has been Bernard's only source of income for the last 19 years. He needs a loan to buy stock of materials to make more furniture in readiness for the Christmas season when demand is high.

loans.use: Buy stock of materials

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye S. est un homme très dynamique qui habite dans la localité de  Ouakam et qui évolue  dans le domaine de l’aviculture depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle a démarré  cet activité  grâce  au conseil d’un ami qui avait vu que c’était un domaine très  rentable. Ce  qui le passionne le plus dans son activité  c’est l’adaptation du local aux conditions de vie des sujets et le respect des normes sanitaires. Monsieur S. est marie et père  de 2 enfants. Il  sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs destines a l’achat de poussins et d’aliment. Son  objectif est d’accroitre la production.
. Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique  apprécié.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye S. is a very dynamic man who lives in Ouakam and who has worked in aviculture (bird-raising) for over 10 years. He entered this field thanks to the advice of a friend who told him that it was a profitable area. The thing that inspires him the most about his work is the adaptation of the birds' habitat to the living conditions and hygiene standards that they require. Mr. S. is a married father of two. He is seeking a 500 000 frs credit in order to purchase chicks and food, with the aim of increasing his output. As part of its ongoing aim of actively engaging in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC utilises lenders' support in order to assist communities in lucrative, revenue-generating business ventures. This contributes to socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment

loans.name: Dominga Leisla

texts.es:
La señora Dominga Leisla S. con gran ahínco se dedica a la actividad de pulpería atendiéndola en el departamento de León donde oferta gran variedad de productos a sus clientes entre los que se encuentran comestibles y productos varios.
Sus inicios fueron muy duros hace 15 años ya que vendía pocos productos en una mesa de madera pero hoy en día ha logrado surtir los productos y ha salido adelante gracias a sus esfuerzos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de los productos para la pulpería entre los que se encuentran los comestibles y los productos personales. Ella espera ser beneficiada con su crédito para continuar con su actividad de pulpería y así beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Dominga Leisla S. works with great enthusiasm at her grocery store in the department of León. She offers a great variety of products to her customers, including food items and general merchandise. Things were very difficult in the beginning, 15 years ago. She sold just a few products from a wooden table. Today, she has managed to increase her inventory and has made success due to her efforts. With this loan, Dominga will buy products for the store, such as food and personal care products. She hopes she will be granted this loan to continue her grocery business and provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products for general store

loans.name: Dopé

texts.en: Dopé M. is 27 years old and sells a variety of grocery products in Lomé, Togo. She works in the Grand Marché, a popular, high-traffic area where she is able to serve many customers. Ms. M. began this business in 2007, and is asking for a loan from Kiva partner, WAGES, to restock her store. Specifically, she will purchase laundry detergent, rice, bottled water, cooking oil, condensed milk and tomato paste. Ms. M. is single and does not have children.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grocery supplies

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas N. is currently in the business of selling greens and fruits in the market and is requesting a loan to buy cows to sell. Thomas is 47 years old and is widowed. She has three children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build houses for rental purposes. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe es una persona trabajadora y esforzada ya que en su actividad diaria ella destaza y vende la carne de res en su casa y sale a las ventas a entregar el producto además que su sacrificio vale la pena porque le ha permitido ser el sostén de su hogar desde hace 10 años .
Este crédito será utilizado para la compra de dos vacas para posteriormente destazarla con lo cual le permite a ella mantener a su familia la cual le ayudan a vender el producto ella en la actualidad tiene dos hijos que le ayudan en el negocio
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a hard-working woman who puts daily effort into her butchering. She sells beef from home and also goes out door-to-door to sell her product. Her daily sacrifice is worth it because it has made it possible for her to support her household for the last 10 years. She will use this loan to buy two cows for future butchering, which permits her to support her family, who help her sell the meat. She has two children that help her with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two cows.

loans.name: Ramula

texts.en:
Ramula is 35 years old and is married to a driver. She has three children aged 17, 15 and 10 years. Both she and her husband contribute to the family welfare.

Ramula is a fishmonger operating in the central market in Masindi, Uganda. She has been a fishmonger for fifteen years and now hopes to become a large-scale supplier of fish.

Ramula got to know about HOFOKAM through friends who advised her to seek credit to bridge the finance gap in her business and in the family welfare. This is her second loan from HOFOKAM and she will use the funds to pay school fees for her two sons in high school.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her two sons in high school

loans.name: Sokuntheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokuntheary C., 30, and her husband, Mr. Phally San, 36, live along National Road Number One, about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1999 and have four children: one daughter and three sons. Two of their children are in school and another one is still too young.

Sokuntheary has been a nail artist for five years. She cuts and paints toenails and fingernails. Her husband has been a soldier for fifteen years.

Sokuntheary has a motorbike that she uses for commuting but it is old and breaks down often, which costs her a lot of money to make repairs. This means that she can not manage her income to support her family.

Facing this, Sokuntheary is requesting her first loan in the amount of $600 to purchase the new motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Mary Saint

texts.en:
Mary Saint G. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran Lanao Del Sur. She is twenty-seven years old. Mary Saint is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Saint owns and operates a fruit stand. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling variety of fruit in the local community. Mary Saint has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Saint joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Saint has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Mary Saint is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Mary Saint's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying grocery items

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla A. is 48 years old and has been selling cloth and dress making supplies at her boutique since 2008. She is married to another entrepreneur, and they have 2 children. She has a very nice shop that is frequented by all the people in her community. Abla has requested her first microloan from WAGES of 300,000 CFA to purchase more products. She plans to purchase 2 cartons of sewing materials.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in her store

loans.name: Nakyesa Widows And Aids Patients Group, Kayunga

texts.en:
In a certain town in Kayunga called Nakyesa hangs the tale of a certain 45-year-old man who has gained quite a reputation for being a stickler for hard work in his charcoal-selling business. For a decade, M. David, a happily married, sturdy and affable gentleman, has blazed an enterprising trail not only for himself, but also for his fellow upstart business colleagues.

David has been testimony to the fact that, with a strong sense of determination, one’s plans cannot be thrown out of gear. His business has also benefitted a lot from his strong pro-activeness and robust customer relationship skills. As a result, he has established for himself a firm niche in the local market.

David’s dream is to open up other outlets in surrounding villages and parishes so as to solidify his financial base. Given his large-scale distribution transactions over these years of operating, he anticipates this will come to pass.

In a week, as a result of his diligence, David makes profits totaling up to 60,000 shillings and he is upbeat that, with this loan, his financial prospects for the future are bright. He wants to buy more bags of charcoal.

With this business, all David’s five children have basked in the glow of a good education and the family’s welfare has also improved a great deal.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina S. is currently in the business of knitting and selling table and chair sets and is requesting a loan to stock more knitting needles and thread.  Celina is 47 years old and is widowed.   She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a sewing machine to facilitate her work.  

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more knitting needles and thread

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Teng S., 40, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is a farmer and grows rice for an income of USD 0.3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3.5 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 33 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Christopher provides motorcycle or habal-habal transportation services to local community members. Christopher has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Christopher joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Christopher is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will also be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Christopher from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: San Roque González Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	Este comité se denomina San Roque González y se encuentra trabajando dentro del cuarto ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
Todas las se señoras son activas y muy trabajadoras y se ayudan mutuamente para seguir adelante con el grupo y aumentar la línea de crédito en el siguiente ciclo.

Una de las integrantes es la señora Marciana quien se dedica al comercio de productos de uso domésticos. 
Esta actividad lo viene realizando  hace varios años y la administración completa se encuentra a su manejo. 
Ella se encuentra satisfecha con su actividad porque ayuda con los ingresos para muchos gastos de la familia. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su negocio como fideos, lácteos, panificados, aceites, y otros.
texts.en:
This committee is named San Roque González and is currently working within its fourth loan cycle with the Entrepreneurial Women's Committee Program. All the women are energetic and very hardworking. They all help each other to keep progressing with the group and in order to increase the line of credit for the next cycle. One of the members is Marciana who sells household products. She has been in business for several years and is completely in charge of its management. She feels satisfied to have her business because it helps provide income for her family’s many expenses. She is seeking the loan for the purchase of merchandise for her business including beans, dairy products, baked goods and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy products, milk, sugar, beans, herbs, fruit, vegetables, eggs, meat, flour, soft drinks, oil etc.

loans.name: Aramatou

texts.fr:
Madame ARAMATOU K. est mariée et  mère de 5 enfants (2garçons et 3 filles). Elle est née le 16 Mars 1979 à KADIOLO une  préfecture de la 3eme région administrative du Mali.  Elle vit chez de son mari avec leurs enfants à KADIOLO quartier Tagouasso.
Elle fait le commerce de  tubercules, de fruits et légumes etc depuis 9 ans. Elle possède un hangars  au marché de KADIOLO où elle vend ses articles. 
Elle se fait aider par une de ses nièces. 
Elle est à son deuxième prêt  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 1 tonne d’ignames et 1 tonne de bananes plantains. Elle s’approvisionne  en Côte d'Ivoire qui un  pays frontalier du Mali.
Elle vend au comptant ou à crédit (sur commande et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et faire l’objet d’épargne car elle  ambitionne construire une maison à usage d’habitation à KADIOLO ville.
texts.en:
Mrs Armatou K. is married and mother of 5 (2 boys and 3 girls). She was born on 16 March, 1979 at Kadiolo, a prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. She lives with her husband and 5 children in the Tagousso district of Kadiolo. She has been in the business of selling tubers, fruit and vegetables for 9 years. She has a stall at the Kadiolo market where she sells her products. She is assisted by one of her nieces. This is her second loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She intends to use her loan to buy 1 tonne of yams and 1 tonne of plantain bananas. She sources her products from Ivory Coast, a country bordering Mali. She sells to a clientele of both men and women, accepting cash or credit for orders or retail purchases. She envisages making a monthly profit of 80.000CFA which she will use to increase her business activity and to put aside in savings as she hopes to one day build a house to live in at Kadiolo

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat  de fruits

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 26 años, vive con sus hijos y su madre en casa de sus progenitores. Desde hace 11 años posee una tienda, negocio principal que tiene y del cual se dedica todos los días. Desde entonces atiende todas las mañanas, mientras que su madre la ayuda en la atención hacía los clientes. Su trabajo consiste en administrar su tienda y procurar tener la cantidad de mercadería disponible para abastecerse y realizar los pedidos de nueva mercadería a sus proveedores, de esta manera ha logrado que su tienda se mantenga estable. Por tal motivo desea seguir incrementando su mercadería y tener una tienda más amplia. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, menestras y productos enlatados.
texts.en:
Isabel, 26, lives with her children and her mother in her parents' home. For 11 years she has had a store; this is her main business where she works every day. Over this time she has attended to the store every morning, while her mother helps her to serve the customers. Her work consists of managing the store and procuring the merchandise in sufficient quantities to keep the store stocked, ordering new merchandise from her suppliers. In this way, she has managed to keep her business stable. To continue to have a successful business, she wants to increase her merchandise, and have a bigger store. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is very content to know that she has financial support, since she has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is pleased to be a member of her communal bank because all of the members are cooperative and responsible people. She would like to thank those persons who will originate the loan she is seeking, which will help her to make progress with her business. With the loan she requests, she will invest in groceries such as: rice, sugar, beans and canned goods.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans and canned goods

loans.name: Luis Alfonso Diaz

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alfonso Díaz se dedica a Reparación de Electrodomésticos en su propia casa de habitación, habita en el barrio Guadalupe de la radio somos 1/2c abajo el mismo realiza sus trabajos de reparación.

El señor Alfonso Díaz es casado tiene tres hijos pero ninguno depende de  el todos son independientes, lleva ya 17 créditos  y los solicita para compra de repuestos para realizar sus reparaciones, es muy puntual con sus obligaciones.
texts.en: Luis Alfonso Díaz makes a living repairing household appliances out of his home in Guadalupe barrio. He is married and has three children, all of whom are full grown and independent. He has already received 17 loans and is requesting another to purchase parts in order to make his repairs. He is very punctual with his payments.

loans.use: Purchase parts

loans.name: Gulshan's Group

texts.en:
Gulshan belongs to a city called Gujranwala, which is famous for its dairy industry in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house. She moved to Gujranwala after her marriage many years ago. Her husband, W., operates his grocery shop in the market. Through the shop he fills the orders of his customers by selling required daily use items. 

Gulshan also contributes to her family financially with her sewing business. She sews clothes at her home. She mainly receives orders from her neighbors and earns well after completing the orders on time. Due to the quality of her work, she receives regular orders. 

She is the mother of four sons and a daughter. Her three elder sons and her daughter work to financially support the family. Her eldest son has a utensil-selling business. The next son drives a rickshaw, providing transport services to his passengers. The third son works in a factory for a monthly wage. Her daughter is involved in the sewing business.
 
Gulshan has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s grocery shop. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries such as cooking oil, rice, soaps, spices, etc. in bulk quantities for selling at his shop. She is hopeful that her husband, who has vast experience in his business, will surely be able to improve his store with the help of this investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old single man living with his parents. He is from Lebanon.  He has been running an IT/computer repair shop since 2003. He works with computers in addition to his full-time education studies at the university. His father is the main income provider of his family but his income is an important source of support for his father. With his loan request of $1200 from Kiva's partner organization Ameen s.a.l., he will purchase new tools and accessories for his business in order to improve his business level. He will buy them from a wholesaler at a good price. He estimates his business will grow about 15% in the coming year. In the future, he is looking to open a computer accessories shop.

loans.use: Purchase new tools and accessories for computer business

loans.name: Antony Kamau

texts.en:
AntonyN. is 36 years-old and married to Anjerica Wanjiku.  He is the father of two children ages two and eight years old.  Antony works in a furniture shop as a carpenter and he has been in this type of business for the last three years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend twenty thousand to buy lumber and carpentry equipment and the other ten thousand to buy and replace his work tools.  With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to reinvest in other businesses and do farming.

His dream is to become the best carpenter in town and be able to provide for all of his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase lumber, tools and equipment for his furniture and carpentry business.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia lives in Kasur, a small city in Pakistan known for its leather industry, in a three-room brick house with her family in the Chaki Piaray Lal area. She is 45 and has three sons, all of whom are involved in different businesses and contribute financially to the family. Her husband operates a business selling floor tiles. He runs a shop in the market, earning income by selling different colored and designed tiles to customers. Nowadays, tiles are in high demand as people like to cover their floors with tiles rather than with marble, etc.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her clothes selling business, which she started fifteen years ago. She purchases clothes from Lahore’s wholesale market, Ichra and Shahalmi, and sells them to her local area clients on profit. With the loan, she will buy different varieties of clothes in bulk in order to increase her sales. She is hopeful that a loan investment will put her business in a better position and that she will be able to make more money by offering more variety to her clients. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. She has maintained good credit behavior in her previous loan years.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.en:
Rustamjon is married with two children. He sells men’s clothing in the local central market of his region. This market is always busy with clients. He offers a nice selection of merchandise for sale and arranges it beautifully in his kiosk, which attracts many potential customers. He has been in this trade for many years.

Rustamjon is requesting a loan of $2500 to increase the range of goods for selling. One of his business plans is to open a second vending facility and hire a sales person to work as a market vendor in the same market. With increased sales and profits, Rustamjon will be able to open an additional vending facility and improve his family's standard of living.  

                                                                  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Luchando Todas  Juntas Group

texts.es:
En todos estos años han vivido muchas experiencias como grupo, que las ha formado para seguir trabajando solidariamente entre todas.
 Si bien siempre se presentan dificultas, ellas encuentran la forma de salir adelante y seguir obteniendo el crédito con la Fundación. 
Las señoras se dedican a la venta de mercaderías varias de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes, por ejemplo, carne, aceite, harina, etc., otras venden ropas, tienen despensa, venta de comidas y otros. 
La directora general Elva Benítez, está casada con Silvio Fernández, quienes viven entre 6 personas en su vivienda y trabajan 2 (ella y su marido). 
 
La señora Elba, vende mercaderías como carne, y otros alimentos de primera necesidad de acuerdo a lo que le solicitan sus clientes. 
Ella dice que su estrategia para vender más es el poco margen de ganancia que le recarga a sus productos además del excelente trato con las personas. 

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne.
texts.en:
Over the years, this group has lived through many experiences which has pushed them as a group to continue working supportively together.

Whilst there are always difficulties, the women find ways to get ahead and to continue obtaining loans from Fundación Paraguaya.

The ladies work selling various merchandise to fill their customers' orders.  Some sell meat, oil, flour, etc.., others sell clothes, run a grocery store or sell meals.

The head of this group, Elva Benítez, is married to Silvio Fernández.  They live with 6 people in their home and 2 of them work (her and her husband).

Elva sells merchandise such as meat and other essential food products according to what her customers ask for.  She says that her strategy for selling more is to place only a small profit margin on the price she charges for her products.  She also provides excellent customer service.

Elva is requesting her loan to buy meat.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo N. is from the village of Mangga. He is 43 years old. Rodolfo is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodolfo owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over 23 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Rodolfo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rodolfo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Felix Manuel

texts.es: Félix se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace 20 años, es un padre muy responsable el siempre está preocupado por proporcionarle a sus hijos y familia lo más necesario. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos en Fundación pues han sido de gran ayuda a su negocio. Todos los días tiene que alistarse temprano para ir a comprar las diferentes frutas y verduras que ofrece a su negocio. El decide realizar este crédito para la compra de naranjas, bananos, sandias, repollos, cebollas, tomares entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Félix has worked selling fruits and vegetables for 20 years. He is a responsible father, always concerned with providing the necessities for his family. This is not the first time he has taken out a loan with Fundación Leon 2000; they have been a great help in developing his business.

Every day, Félix gets up early to purchase the various fruits and vegetables that he offers his customers. He will use this loan to purchase oranges, bananas, watermelons, cabbages, onions, tomatoes, and more.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Sober Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sober” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standards of living. 

The leader of this group is Tenneh C.. Tenneh is 35 years old. She was born in Freetown but she is currently residing in Kabala with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is a businessman and 3 of her children are attending primary school. Her eldest child is in secondary school. For 18 years now, Tenneh has been selling cooked rice, meat and vegetables. With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients – palm-oil, rice, fish, tomatoes, etc. at wholesale prices, in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients (palm-oil, rice, fish, tomatoes, etc.) at wholesale in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma nació en la ciudad de Chinchero y tiene 28 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella es una mujer humilde que saca adelante a su familia pues a lo que se dedica es a la venta de mana de forma ambulatoria. Vilma pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Victoria” donde se préstamo dinero pero en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más maíz para elaborar mana.
texts.en: Vilma, 28, is from the Peruvian town of Chinchero.  She and her husband have two children.  She is a modest woman who supports her family by working as a street vendor, selling a maize-based snack that is common in the area.  Vilma belongs to the Nueva Victoria community bank and will use this loan to buy the supplies she needs for her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for snack business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca sells RTW clothes and slippers to her community. She is also an Avon dealer. Francisca's husband is a fisherman. She helps him by selling his catch to the market. Francisca works hard to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

Francisca is 43 years old, married, and has 5 children. Her oldest child is 21 years old. Francisca wishes for her children to succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds for his farm

loans.name: Luzmila Luz

texts.es:
Luzmila es socia del  Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno.  Tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos (2 independientes).  Luzmila cuenta con grado de instrucción secundaria. 
La señora se dedica a la venta de polos,  trabaja  con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años.  Su primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio, ella tiene una boutique.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 400.00 nuevo soles, comprará polos y todo tipo de prendas de vestir para niños.  Debido a que tiene un hijo pequeño, se turnan con su hija quien la apoya en el negocio.
Su sueño es agrandar y crecer en el negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el bajo interés.
En la foto se muestra con su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the Communal Bank “Dulce Amanecer” (Sweet Dawn) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 52 years old, married, and has four children (two of whom are independent). Luzmila has a high school education.

She sells polo shirts. Luzmila has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 500 PEN and used for her boutique business.

With this new loan of 400 PEN, she will buy polo shirts and all types of children’s clothing. Since she has a young son, Luzmila takes turns with her daughter in managing the business. Her dream is to expand and grow her business. The things she enjoys about her Communal Bank are the convenience of the loans and the low interest rates.

In the photograph, Luzmila appears with her young son.

loans.use: to purchase polo shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La señora Faustina es socia del banco comunal Las Mujeres Del Puerto II, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años y es madre soltera de 3 hijos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas, realiza sus ventas en una zonas muy alejada a su casa. Ella sale a vender junto a sus hijos porque no tiene con quien dejarlos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles comprará 5 paquetes de gaseosas guaraná, 4 paquetes de agua, 5 paquetes de gaseosa pepsi, 1 caja de galleta, 1 bolsa de caramelo, 1 bolsa de biscochos.
A pesar de lo lejos que esta su negocio, todos los días tiene que estar ahí porque tiene que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Faustina es una mujer muy sacrificadas y trabaja honradamente para poder darles a sus hijos un buen futuro y enseñarles que las cosas se ganan con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
texts.en:
Sra. Faustina is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Mujeres Del Puerto II” (The Women of the Port II) which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 39 years old and a single mother of three children.

Faustina sells beverages in areas that are far from her home. She brings her children with her while she sells because she has does not have anybody to look after them. With her new loan of 1800 PEN, she will buy five packs of guarana flavored sodas, four packs of water, five packs of Pepsi Cola, one box of cookies, one bag of candy, and one bag of sponge cakes.

Despite having to travel far for her business, Faustina continues to work every day because wants very much for her children to move forward. She has made many sacrifices and has worked honorably in order to provide them a good future. Faustina has also taught them that things are earned through hard work and sacrifice.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, water, cookies, and other snacks.

loans.name: Niakk Jarinu Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 10 juillet 2002. Il est composé de 06 femmes habitent dans le même quartier. Elle s'activent dans le petit commerce et ont chacune une étale au marché.

Madame MAMA qui est à gauche de la photo levant la main et le responsable. Elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est marié et mère de neuf enfants. Elle a en charge de deux autres enfants confié par ses voisines.

Elle fait de la restauration, spécialement la vente de petit déjeuner au marché. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années.

Ce nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter assez de condiments pour son activité de vente de petit déjeuné 

Avec les bénéfices générés par son activité elle soutint son mari dans la prise en charge de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on July 10, 2002. It is made up of six women who live in the same neighborhood. They are petty traders and each has a stall in the open-air market. 

Mrs. MAMA who is on the left in the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 39, married, and the mother of nine children. She is also raising two other children who were confided to her by neighbor women. 

She sells cooked food, especially breakfasts, at the open-air market. She has been in this business for several years. 

This new loan will allow her to buy enough condiments for her breakfast-selling business. With the profit generated by her business, she helps her husband support their family while also putting more aside in savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments used to prepare breakfasts for sale.

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan (pictured here), 38, is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Phalla, 33, is a lotus farmer and does construction work when he is free.  Sokhan is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help her husband to purchase a water pump, seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his lotus farm.

They do not yet have children. They live in a village along national road number two, approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: To help her husband to purchase a water pump, seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his lotus farm.

loans.name: Joao Miguel

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 2 filhos de 04 e 08 anos de idade destes o mais velho vai a Escola. Frequenta o ensino superior  especialidade de engenheria electronica na Universidade Eduardo Mondlane. Vive com a sua familia numa casa cedida pelos serviços, de vez enquanto tem enviado algum valor aos pais para algumas despesas de casa.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo afim de dar continuidade com os seus estudos, onde mais tarde foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatorio em 1983. pertence ao Ministerio da defesa e ainda continua como efectivo, onde recebe um salario mensal de 16.680.00mt por mês que depois de aplicar nas suas despesas familiares o remanescente deposita na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
ja teve emprestimos no banco Millenium BIM e pagou sem dificuldades. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos e colegas que tambem são clientes desta instituição e este e os seu segundo emprestimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, cimento, ferro, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O emprestimo anterior foi de 16.000.00mt para a habitaçao.
No futuro gostaria de ver a sua obra concluida na sua quinta para poder criar animais de pequeno porte e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Joao was born in Inhambane, Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has two children, ages 4 and 8. The elder child goes to school. Joao studies electronic engineering at Eduardo Mondlane University. He lives with his family in military housing, and sometimes he sends his parents some money for household expenses.

To continue his studies, he left Inhambane to move to Maputo, where he later began obligatory military service in 1983. Joao worked for the Ministry of Defense and is still working there, where he receives a monthly salary of 16,680 meticais per month. After paying his household expenses, he deposits the rest in his bank account (at BIM).

He has already had loans from Millennium BIM Bank, and he paid them off without problems. Joao learned about Hluvuku through friends and coworkers who are also customers of this institution. This 20,000 meticais loan is his second loan, and he intends to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, cement, iron, beams and other items) to continue construction on his house. The earlier loan was for 16,000 meticais and was for housing.

In the future, Joao would like to see construction on his farm finished so he can raise small animals, and to do this he intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, cement, iron, beams, etc.).

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Vutha (pictured above) is 29 years old and her husband, Chanroeun, is 27 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about twenty kilometers away. They have been married since 2006 and have two young sons. 

Vutha is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a motorcycle repairman. He hopes to buy additional motorbike spare parts to better respond to his customer’s needs. So, Vutha is asking for her first loan in the amount of $600 to assist her husband with the purchases.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband’s motorcycle repairing business.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, he has operated a retail shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Santa dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and kerosene for sale. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es: La señora Leoncia  tiene 53 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, la mayoría de los cuales ya son mayores de edad. La señora ella se dedica a una pulpería.  La ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 9 años, en la búsqueda de fuentes alternativas de ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Ella empezó vendiendo muy poco, ahora posee una clientela bien establecida, además que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una manera muy humilde. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de granos básicos, leche, pan, enlatados, sopas y detergentes.
texts.en:
Sra. Leoncia is 53 years old, married, and has five children. Most of them are already grown. Leoncia manages a store that is located in her modest home. She started this business nine years ago because she was looking for alternative sources of income to support her family. Leoncia started out selling very little, but now she has a well-established customer base. In addition, she has always enjoyed working and earning her livelihood in a humble manner.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of basic grains, milk, bread, canned goods, soups, and detergents.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, milk, bread, canned goods, soups, and detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant turístico, ella preparar desayunos, almuerzos y cenas y también prepara platos típicos como cuy al horno, pollo al horno, tallarines entre otros platos típicos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, al socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la atención de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne, verduras y arroz al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Sayhua 3” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 30 years old, single, and has one child. The member divides her time between her daily activities and managing a tourist restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. She also prepares traditional dishes such as oven-roasted guinea pig, baked chicken, Peruvian noodles, and other foods. The member works between the hours of 8am and 7pm. Through her business, she is able to help her child move forward. She wants to expand and improve her restaurant, so she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for cooking such as chicken, meat, vegetables, and rice in bulk.

The member is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Gulzada's Group

texts.en: Gulzada is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband, she brings up three sons and two daughters. The youngest son and the younger daughter study at school and the other children are married and live separately with their families. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 12,000 soms, Gulzada started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening them, she earns about 3,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Gulzada wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she wishes to open her own grocery store. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Vicente Anastacio

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de agua, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Vicente desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vacas), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  Recientemente ha adquirido una mototaxi de segunda mano para trabajar en ella en sus ratos libres y así obtener otro ingreso extra para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y para brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi que ha adquirido, con ambos ingresos podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Vicente es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades de estudio.
texts.en:
Vicente, age 49, lives with his wife and children in his own house.  The only service the house has is water.  It is located in a rural zone in the Lambayeque department.  The business activities in the zone are farming, livestock, and tourism.

Vicente has been raising and selling cattle for several years.  His corral is in the part outside of his house.  He feeds them balanced feed and natural fodder.  He does this in order to have good milk production.  He sells the milk to the people living in the area.  He has fixed customers because of the good quality of the milk he has.  His income covers his family obligations.

He recently acquired a second hand “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle).  He did this to work with his mototax during his free time and to get an extra income for his house.

He has requested a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan is to buy balanced feed and to provide maintenance on the mototaxi that he has acquired.  With both incomes he will be able to pay for his loan and improve the quality of life for his family.

Vicente is a hard-working and responsible person.  The only thing he wants is for his children to have educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his cows and to provide maintenance on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Jerlito

texts.en:
Jerlito is a 42-year-old farmer from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is still single and hopes to have his own family someday. 

Jerlito primarily grows rice crops to sell. Aside from farming, he also has a tricycle transport business. Jerlito works hard to save for his future and to support his family financially. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and tricycle spare parts and gasoline. He hopes to improve his living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and tricycle spare parts and gasoline.

loans.name: Ana Milagro

texts.es: Ana,nuevamente esta solicitando préstamo,  lo necesita para fortalecer su negocio y comprar; leña y maíz, por el cual tendrá producto para poder seguir aumentando en su negocio, ademas de encontrar un mejor precio por la compra mayoritaria, Estos prestamo le han ayudado, ha logrado aumentar en numero de clientes y sus ganancias han sido mayores, ya que con el prestamo, consigue el maiz a un mejor precio.
texts.en: Ana is again applying for a loan which she needs in order to strengthen her business and buy firewood and corn. In this way she will have the products necessary for her to continue growing her business, as well as obtain a better price by buying in bulk. These loans have helped her. She has managed to increase the number of customers and her income as with the loan she can buy the corn at a better price.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a concrete side wall to finish the work he is doing in phases.

loans.name: Neema-Kimara Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her early 30s is married with two children who are still going to school. She has been running three different types of businesses. She has a grocery store, sells charcoal and has a motor cycle for five years now. She works from 6 a.m to 6 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 6th motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania given in the middle of the main loan that motivate borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their  loans smoothly to receive half amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. She used he previous loans to open charcoal business, bought a pikipiki (motorcycle)for transport business, built rooms for renting and household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wishes for a loan to go upcountry and buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to still build rooms for renting.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Neema-Kimara" which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To go upcountry and buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Berta, vive con su esposo y una hija, ella administra una tienda donD. ofrece productos D. primera necesidad, este negocio lo aprendió a manejar por la misma necesidad D. tener una entrada D. dinero en su propia casa, lleva 7 años en él, y ha venido mejorando.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. zapatos, sandalias, pólvora, ropa, esta compra le servirá para surtir el negocio, ofreciendo nuevos productos y que sean D. uso para los clientes, ya que no solo encontraran comestibles, sino también accesorios para vestir.
La aspiración D. Berta es mantener el negocio bien surtido, generar más ganancias a través D. los productos y sobre todo vivir dignamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha lives with her husband and a daughter.  She runs a store where she sells basic staple items.  She learned how to run it because she needed to have a source of income at home.  She’s had it for seven years and has been steadily improving.

She is asking for a loan to buy shoes, sandals, powder and clothes.  This purchase will help her stock the store having new items that are useful for her customers because they won’t just find foodstuffs but also clothing accessories.

Bertha hopes to keep the store well-stocked to generate higher profits through the products and, above all, to live with dignity with her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, powder and clothes.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 44 years old and married with 3 children.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to resell in her sari-sari store.

Evangeline has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns income from a welding shop.

Evangeline aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has work in the transport industry in the town of Naivasha for the last four years. He is 27 years old and single.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to repair his motorbike so as to keep his business on course and generate cash to buy a new motorcycle. 

In the future, Simon hopes to buy a car and start a taxi business.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: La Sra. Martina, es  una persona  trabajadora  y  muy  responsable, ella  tiene una  tienda  de  abarrotes en  su  domicilio el  cual le  ha permitido  sacar  adelante  a  su   hijo brindándole  la oportunidad  de  estudiar, es  por  ello   que  necesita  de  nuestra   ayuda  para construir   el  techo  de  madera  en su  casa para de esta  manera  extender  su negocio  y  contar  con la posibilidad  de  hacerlo crecer, agradece el  apoyo  brindado para  la realización de  proyecto.
texts.en: Señora Martina is a hard-working and very responsible person.  She has a grocery store in her home, which allows her to move her son ahead in life, providing him the opportunity to attend school.  It is for this reason that she needs our help, to put a wooden roof on her home so that she can extend her business space and have the possibility to grow her business.  She is grateful for the support being provided for realizing this plan.

loans.use: to make her business larger by building a new wooden roof.

loans.name: Sour

texts.en:
Sour, 33, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Sour raises pigs and her husband is a chef for wedding parties. 

Sour is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase fertilizer and grow rice on her plot of farmland. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to send her children to a good school. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and grow rice.

loans.name: C14001 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Dativa is 29 years old and has three children between the ages of 3 and 8 years. She also takes care of three additional dependents. She sells local drinks from 7 am until 6 pm every day, and she has four years of experience. She currently employs three people to help her. She is the leader of the group called "14001 TWITEZIMBERE" in the local language. She is a first person from the left in the photo.

Dativa has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make local drinks to sell. With any profit, she will save money for her future and pay school fees for all of the children who live with her.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make local drinks to sell.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
