Melodina is from Dalapang Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Melodina is married and has six children. 

To make a living, Melodina plants and harvests corn for sale. She has been in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Melodina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melodina is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosalin

texts.en:
Rosalin is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Rosalin has a shop that sells coconuts for copra and green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

Rosalin has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en: Erastus has been renting a motorcycle for micro-business work for three years. He is married with two children and lives in a heavily populated suburb of Kisumu City. Erastus has committed to provide transport to CHWs targeting youth groups and patients. Erastus says owning the bike is great but supporting his community is greater. Ersatus should also be able to grow his business and provide for his family. He belongs to a business association and hopes to encourage many more members to join in supporting the CHW work in Kisumu City

loans.use: To Purchase Motorcycle to Support Community Health Workers and for Motorcycle Taxi

loans.name: Zula

texts.en: Zula lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and three of her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house and her family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food. She sells used clothes on a door-to-door basis. She has been in this business for the last nine years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major business challenge is the rainy season which hinders her movement. Her goals and aspirations are to get a permanent business premise where her customers can find her.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Mrs. G. has 20 years of experience in the grocery store sector. She sells cans of food , dairy products and bread. This business was initiated for her parents at this time she is single and she take care of her parents they are older. \"My store is the only source of income, and I would like a loan to grow my business. I would like to buy a freezer for the chicken sale and to acquire shelves to place the merchandise\" I ´m Asking for a loan of 1.500.00 dlls and I will payback in 12 months.

Español

La Sra. G. cuenta ya con la experiencia de más de 20 años en el ramo de la tienda de abarrotes, vende lateria en general, refrescos, leche y pan. Este negocio lo iniciaron sus padres; es soltera y actualmente sus padres están bajo su cuidado; “Mi tienda es la única fuente de ingresos y quisiera un crédito para hacerla crecer, me gustaría comprar un congelador para la venta de pollo y adquirir anaqueles para colocar las mercancías” Solicita apoyo por 1.500.00 dlls. y paga en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: Ventas de abarrotes

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Sister Comfort sells pineapples to processing companies and individuals for consumption. She buys by the truckload from the farm and later sells retail to her customers. She wants to provide more companies with pineapples. She is seeking for a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to enable her buy and supply to her customers.

loans.use: To buy pineapples by the truck

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel F. is a rice farmer in Salitre. He has been rice farming in the sector his entire life. He is also one of the main leaders of the rural associations there. He is hoping he can receive the loan in order to invest in his lands and buy feed for his livestock. F. is proud to receive these loans and be part of a communal bank he helped form. He is pictured with a tractor he rented to work his lands.

All of the members of the Buena Suerte de Salitre Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Buena Suerte Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas, known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy), with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture, which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season on the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provide services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices, and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Invest in rice farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Felix would like to invest in more chickens and feed.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria E. is 60 years of age, married with eight (8) children. She sells native pottery and firewood. She has been a leader in a union for the past 8 years and hails from urban sector of Benin City, Nigeria. She has been in this business since 1985 & she is seeking a $400 loan to buy more firewood and clay and to improve her turnover.

loans.use: To buy firewood and clay to make native pots for sale

loans.name: Rugiye

texts.en:
Rugiya A. is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Gubadli region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan.  She is 57 years old and a mother of 3 children.  She began her business with $300 in 2004. At first, she was selling children's clothing and earning little money. This money was enough for only some of her family's basic needs. She had difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school etc. 
 
She is busy with mobile industry goods, retail trade. She wants to improve her business and increase the number of her clients . Rugiye needs  $800 to expand her business, to open an area of private trade to sell her wholesale goods in the central market. She hopes to eventually  expand her business.
She thinks that this will improve the living conditions of his family. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business, to sell her wholesale goods to private customers

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys A. is a 40 year old single parent, has 4 children, and hails from Okoko in Lagos, Nigeria. She sells drinks and local gin (Ogogoro). She has been with LAPO as a leader of a union for the past 2 years and has also being in business since 1997.  She is requesting for a loan of $800 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and local gin (Ogogoro)

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoeun S. O., age 41, is a housewife. Her husband is a traveling construction foreman, who earns about $6 each day. She has six children; two are employed at a hotel, two are students, and the rest are married and live separately.

She requests a loan of $600 in order to purchase a fence around her house and build a clean toilet. She would use any remaining funds to purchase more construction tools for her husband’s business.

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies and build a fence and toilet at her home

loans.name: Herni

texts.en: Herni, 33, is the mother of 2 children.  She has a grocery store in front of her house. Since joined MBK her store has been doing so well that she now earns $30 a day. Her husband, A., works at construction site as a coolie and earns irregular income. So now she is asking for a loan of $100 to expand her business and will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Salelavalu Uta Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
Most of the farms in Salelavalu Uta are planted with taro, bananas, vegetables and fruits. The men do most of the labor on the farm but during harvest time they are joined by the women to harvest the crops and sell them in the neighboring Salelologa market. When the other women in the village learned that a certain group of women already were a part of SPBD's program, they asked for more information and got excited to join.

Faamelea's group is convinced that they have to constantly save some of their earnings on a weekly basis. This is so they will be able to afford things in the future without resorting to borrowing. They are so glad that SPBD not only provides loans but also accepts savings deposits , even as little as one tala (about USD 0.40). As shown in the picture, they are proudly displaying the savings accounts passbooks they have recently acquired with SPBD. The small business loans help them improve their farms and will eventually provide them with higher earnings and of course, higher savings deposits for these hardworking ladies.

loans.use: To purchase farm equipment, agricultural supplies (fertilizers, pesticides, weed killers) and pay for additional farm labor

loans.name: Bih

texts.en:
Born in 1957, Elisabeth was forced to get married at 15. She married a man who was five times older than her because her parents were unable to pay her fees and carter for her basic needs. While in her marital house, she successfully gave birth to ten children four of which are below the age of fifteen. She is faced with several problems like the inability to carter for her family, and unable to pay school fees for her children. The fact that she needed business capital, and worst of all the loss of her first son's death and living in an incomplete house made her join GHAPE. She has successfully obtained and repaid loans from GHAPE three times.

Given a new loan, she plans to buy rice, beans, salt and seedlings for retail. She thinks her business will succeed because she has been doing this business for so long. She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be done on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, salt and seedlings.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Mrs. Khem K., 54, is married with four children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while two others are working as construction workers. The youngest child is attending school. Mrs. Khem K. is a subsistence farmer in the Trapaing Taloung Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She already obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding. In her plantation business, she had dough which made her crop not very productive during that period. In March 2008, her husband died of a liver disease. This, aside being a source of great sorrow, made the household economics decline. For all of these reasons, Mrs. Khem K. asked for a loan again to buy one more cow to use as a draft animal in order to plow her rice field.

loans.use: To buy a cow to work on the rice field as a draft animal.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
For many years Rebeca, along with her beloved husband, has manufactured coffins for the eternal rest of their clients´ family members. Thanks to their excellent finishing work and the materials they use, production has improved and market demand has increased. They would like to start offering funeral services in addition to the coffins, and for this reason are requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Rebeca, en compañía de su amado esposo hace mucho se dedica a fabricar ataúdes para el descanso eterno de los familiares de sus clientes. Gracias a los excelentes acabados y a los materiales que utilizan para este fin han mejorado su producción y se ha incrementado la demanda en el mercado. Tienen deseos de implementar los servicios funerarios además de los ataúdes y a esta razón atiende su solicitud.

loans.use: Start up business to offer funeral services.

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en:
Teyyub I. is a 51 year old trader who keeps his store in a small village. He has lived and worked in the Saatli Region since 1990. Teyyub is married and has 3 children.

The store is his main source of income. Teyyub has thus applied for a $1000 USD loan in order to diversify and purchase more inventory.

loans.use: To diversify and purchase more inventory

loans.name: David Lucio

texts.es:
David is 23 years old, and lives in his mother's house with his wife and 1 year old daughter. David is a farmer, and since his marriage he has demonstrated that in spite of his youth he can support his family with hard work and dedication. Because of this, he is always in the fields, growing potatoes. David leaves early in the morning to water the fields, then fertilizes and fumigates the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables David to purchase goods for his home. However the most trying feature of this work is dealing with the changes in climate, which can damage the crops. Because of this, farmers like David must buy products that help protect the crops from shifts in the weather. David is motivated by his desire to offer his family a better quality of life. This time, he would like to invest in the purchase of supplies to protect his crops, so as to have a better harvest and sell his crops outside of his hometown.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

David tiene 23 años, vive en la casa de su madre, junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de 1 año. Es agricultor, desde que se casó demostró que a pesar de ser joven puede solventar a su familia a base de esfuerzo y dedicación, por ello, siempre está en sus terrenos de cultivos sembrando papa, en lo que ocupa gran parte del día, desde la madrugada sale a regar sus terrenos para luego dedicarse al abono o a la fumigación. Esta actividad le ha dado grandes satisfacciones, como adquirir implementos para su hogar.Sin embargo, lo más duro, es enfrentarse a los cambios de clima, ya que pueden perjudicar su trabajo, para ello debe afrontarlo con la compra de productos que ayuden a proteger los cultivos. Para David, el motivo de su empeño es ofrecer a su familia una mejora calidad de vida. Esta vez, quiere invertir una suma de dinero en la compra de insumos que protejan su producción, para una mejor cosecha y lograr comercializar sus productos fuera de su ciudad.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to protect his crops from pests and shifts in the weather.

loans.name: Mafunda

texts.en:
Mafunda is 49 years old. She is married with 8 children between the ages of 32 and 7 years old. She has been a charcoal and bites seller since 1998. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mafunda is now requesting a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
La pulpería Los Ángeles es el nombre del negocio el cual atiende con mucha amabilidad la señora Martha C. F. en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

La señora Martha es madre soltera y con dos hijos a su cargo el cual hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez brindándole las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. La razón por la cual hoy en dia ella acude a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar su mercadería a sus proveedores y de esta manera suplir su pulpería de productos para ofertatrlos.
texts.en:
Los Ángeles [Angels] Convenience Store is the name of the business Martha C. F. runs out of her home in the Ciudad Sandino district of Managua. Martha is a single mother of two children. Her income is the only source of support for her children as she provides what they need to grow. She has turned to Ceprodel for a loan, which she will use to purchase merchandise from her suppliers and, in this way, stock her store with products for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for sale

loans.name: Karima

texts.en: Karima is married and has three children.  In order to support her family, she travels over 150 miles each week to purchase shoes in bulk, which she resells in the market near her home at retail prices.  Although the distance is not too far, the roads are very bad and it takes two days to pick up the shoes and return back to her town.  In order to save time and travel expenses, Karima is requesting a loan of $1200, which will be used to purchase greater quantities of shoes on each trip to her supplier.

loans.use: To purchase greater quantities of shoes.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita P. has been an active member of Paglaum-MPC for almost four years and is one of the pioneering members of Paglaum Development Program for Landless People. She has been living with her common-law husband Mr. David Quicoy for almost 10 years with her five children. She has a salted anchovies business - commonly known as "GINAMOS" - which has provided them with their daily needs. She's considered to be the bread winner of the family since her husband has no income.  They also have a garden near their house which provides a good harvest and helps support the family with their daily expenses.  Mrs. Pastarano hopes to purchase a decent house one day and fulfill her dreams of sending her children to school in the future.

She has a successfully paid back nine loans from PMPC and regularly contributes to her savings while building capital with PMPC. She's now planning to apply for her 10th loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to purchase more "Ginamos" and fertilizer for her garden. Mrs. Rosita P. is considered to be a Member in Good Standing of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has passed the credit evaluation for the approval of PHP 20,000.

loans.use: Purchase salted anchovies ( Ginamos) for sale and fertilizer for her garden

loans.name: Pascaline Dédé

texts.fr:
Aged of 46 years, Mrs. Pascaline Dédé H. is married and is mother of three (03) children. Endowed with a good morality, she has for main activity the management of a haberdashery. Considering the profitability of this activity, she would like to increase her business to buy surfilage and press buttons machinery to best satisfy her clientele.  
The profit drew from this project will serve to provide to her family's needs the especially her children schooling she wishes highly that to accomplish.
texts.en:
Aged of 46 years, Mrs. Pascaline Dédé H. is married and is mother of three (03) children. Endowed with a good morality, she has for main activity the management of a haberdashery. Considering the profitability of this activity, she would like to increase her business to buy surfilage and press buttons machinery to best satisfy her clientele. The profit drew from this project will serve to provide to her family's needs the especially her children schooling she wishes highly that to accomplish.

Translated from French by SaveThese Loans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat d'un presse bouton et d'articles de mercerie

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy P., 58, and her husband, Mr. Sok Men, 66, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  They have been married for 16 years and have two daughters.  One of their children is a garment factory worker and the other one attends school.

Sophy is a housewife and takes care of her children.  Sok has been a pedicab driver for ten years.  He drives in Phnom Penh and has revenue of about $3 a day.  Sophy is requesting a loan for $500 to dig a well to use for the family and to purchase a cow for raising.

loans.use: To dig a well to use for the family and to purchase a cow for raising.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana V., 46, raises piglets for a living. She has 4 children, two are married, and one is in high school while one is at home. Her husband is a rice grower. This helps contribute to their family income.

In 1994, Rosana started her pig business. Until now this keeps her busy all the time because she enjoys taking care of her pigs. Her profit from raising hogs enables her to buy food for the family. CEVI helped her to get stared in her business. Because of her loan, she is able to raise her children well.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for the pigs. In this way, she can have them grow and sell them at quality prices.

CEVI helps Rosana sustains her pig business. Through credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI provides to all its clients like Rosana, more and more are able to grow their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Yasmeen Bashir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is 56 years old, married, and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan city is famous for its sweetmeat. Her husband, B. A., has been a school teacher for 15 years. Yasmeen baji is the mother of four sons. Her eldest son is a truck driver. Her second son has a leather-selling business. Her third son works in a factory, and her youngest son has a milk-selling business. Yasmeen baji feels proud when she sees her sons establishing their own businesses. Yasmeen baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan for her youngest son whose name is Iqbal. Iqbal wants to expand his milk-selling business by buying another buffalo. 

Yasmeen baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks to sell. Suraiya A. baji wants a loan to buy a truck for her loading business. Salma baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell. Another Salma baji wants a loan to buy shoes to sell. One more Salma baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.en:
D. Sadriddin is 30 years old. He is married with two children. Sadriddin has worked as a barber for many years. He is very talented and maybe that’s why he has so many clients. Also he doesn’t charge much for his services. Now he wants to borrow money so he can buy newer instruments for hair cutting. This way Sadriddin thinks he can offer better service for his clients and in that way, earn more and improve his family's standard of living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing higher tech instruments for barbering

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi T. is 26 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Currently, three of her children are in school. Her husband works with her. They are a very humble family who want to invest in their children's future by providing them with education.

Esi lives at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She sells food in the community market, including items such as cooking oil, tinned tomatoes, and bags of rice. She says that these items sell very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Ghana. Esi deals directly with the wholesalers, instead of retailers who would sell to her at higher prices.

With her eight years of experience in her business, she wants to add other foods, such as maize and eggs, that are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible the help of loan assistance.

Therefore, she wants a loan to buy more raw materials such as rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, flour and margarine, among others. She is convinced that the loan will help her to increase her stock in the event of a price hike. She also believes this will help her save more for her children's education.

She says she would be grateful for your assistance. Esi belongs to a village bank called "Otease," which means "He lives."

loans.use: To buy food, such as cooking oil, rice, spices and tinned tomatoes

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Balimaya  est  constitué de quatre femmes  mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali, dans des foyers monogames. 
Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles et augmenter leurs revenus. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de pagnes wax, de condiments et de produits de beauté. 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter  50 pièces de pagnes wax, 60 paniers de condiments  et 60 cartons de produits de beauté.
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et en république de Côte D’ivoire pays frontalier du Mali. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville et souvent de façon ambulante dans les domiciles à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant, en détail et à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider leur mari, à entretenir les enfants  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Balimaya ambitionnent agrandir et diversifier leurs activités.
texts.en:
Balimaya is composed of four married women who average 33 years of age and 3 children each. They live in monogamous households in Médine, a district in Sikasso City, third administrative region of Mali. They are on their seventh collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and to increase their revenues.

The group members do a diversity of work, including the sale of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), condiments, and beauty products. With this loan, they intend to buy fifty bolts of Wax pagnes, sixty baskets of condiments, and sixty boxes of beauty products. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire, a country bordering Mali. The merchandise is sold retail to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted, at grand marketplace of Sikasso City and while going home-to-home.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 27,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for helping their husbands to care for the children, and the other portion will be invested in business. The women of the group have the ambition to expand and diversify their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy articles

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es:
La señora Marnith, pertenece al Banco Comunal ”Huicungo”, vive en el Jr. Arica  s/n, Distrito de Huicungo, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 46 años, 06 hijos, dos aun dependen de ella y son quienes también le ayudan en el negocio 

Con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de juanes  y anticuchos, acondicionando  en la  vereda  de su casa sus mesitas y sillitas para atender a sus comensales, desde sus inicio las ventas fueron buenas gracias a su buena sazón y amable trato a sus clientes, es así que con su 1er prestamo de S/. 300.00 hace realidad este viejo anhelo por lo que hasta hoy continúa con el mismo negocio. 
Con el préstamo de S/. 3000.00, comprará arroz en sacos, gallinas criollas y huevos en javas, ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de los riquísimos juanes (platos típicos de la zona), también hojas de bijao para envolverlos y leña en tercios para cocinarlos, así mismo comprara carne de ganado vacuno para venderlos en kilos, además que le servirá como insumo para la preparación de los anticuchos y así satisfacer el exigente pedido de su clientela. 

Su permanencia a este grupo le ha permitido desarrollar su seguridad e independencia.  
Nos manifiesta su gran agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como persona y como empresaria
texts.en:
Marnith belongs to the “Huicungo” communal bank. She lives on Arica Street, in the Huicungo district, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the department of San Martín. She lives with her common-law husband, she is 46 years old, and has 6 children, two of whom still depend on her and they help her in her business. With the goal of increasing her income, she got the idea to open a small business selling juanes (a traditional dish made with rice, eggs, and chicken wrapped in a banana leaf) and kebabs. She fixed up the sidewalk in front of her house with tables and chairs so she could tend to her customers. From the beginning sales were good because of her good cooking and her friendly treatment of her customers. This is how with her first loan of 300.00 PEN she was able to turn her dream into reality and to this day she continues with the same business. With this loan of 3,000.00 PEN she will buy sacks of rice and also chicken and eggs, which are necessary ingredients for making the delicious juanes (a typical food of the area). She will also buy biajo leaves (similar to banana leaves) for wrapping the juanes and firewood for cooking them. She will also purchase beef to sell by the kilo. The beef will also serve as an ingredient in the kebabs and help to satisfy the demanding orders of her customers. Her participation in this group has allowed her to develop her security and independence. She has expressed to her us her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a person and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy beef for making kebabs

loans.name: Apostolico - Group 1

texts.en:
Amancia E. lives with her husband. Her children, who range in age from 23 to 40, no longer live with her or support her financially. She started selling clothes in her area in order to generate some income. She will start her sixth loan cycle with Esperanza International. The other group members not only appointed her to be the group coordinator because she is the eldest, but also because she is an example of hard work and diligence.

Amancia will use her loan to purchase some new, fresh summer clothing to sell, including women's apparel, in anticipation of Mother's Day. She hopes her business will continue succeeding as it has thanks to her five previous loans. She would also like to set up a space in her house or in a market where she can sell her merchandise without becoming exhausted.

Please help us to continue supporting Amancia and her friends with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To invest in new clothing to renew her inventory

loans.name: By God In Power Ii Group

texts.en:
Here are Mariatu B., Isatu C., and Sin K.. They are local entrepreneurs based in Waterloo small-town, twenty miles away from Freetown. They named their group By God in Power. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva in Partnership with Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make a better profit, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Mariatu B. (right) is the leader of this group. Mariatu is now thirty-one years of age, she was born in Kamakwe town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a welder and the two of them have two children who are still in primary school. Mariatu sells toys, raincoats, umbrellas and sneakers. She has been a businesswoman for eight years now. With this loan, she will be able to add more goods to her business, makes better profit, and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 02 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (4to grado). Vive en la Comunidad de Chinchero Sector Nueva Alianza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de lanas para la confección de Artesanías.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1300.00 Nuevos soles, para comprar lana de alpaca para elaborar chompas y lana acrílica para elaborar títeres de dedo, gorros, guantes y mantas.

Su mayor  deseo es seguir trabajando y vender sus productos al por mayor.

A ella le gustan la forma de trabajo y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Community Bank "Cajas Reales" located in the Chucuito district in Puno. She is 48 years old and she is married. She is mother of 2. She has a grade 10 education, and she lives in the Chinchero sector of Nueva Alianza.

She has been with Maneula Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) since the inception of the program. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles and the funds were invested in the purchase of wool for use in her crafts.

She now requires a loan in the amount of S/.1300 nuevos soles to purchase alpaca wool to make sweaters and acrylic yarn to make finger puppets, hats, gloves and blankets.

Her greatest wish is to be able to keep working and to sell her products wholesale.

She loves her work and enjoys being able to save money.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool in different colors.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 23 years old and married with one young child: age one and a half years old. Jackline got married at a young age, when most of her peers had joined tertiary colleges, because she lacked school fees. With the challenge of raising a child and taking care of three siblings, she started a catering business. She signed a three year renewable contract with the local authority to enable her to supply food to children in Buruburu primary school. She currently prepares food for 500 pupils and has 10 employees.
She is borrowing Ksh. 50,000 to enable her to buy an oven and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase an oven

loans.name: Motema Mpiko Plus Group

texts.fr:
Munongo N. 48 ans, est président du groupe dénommé «  MoteM. Mpiko Plus » qui signifie en anglais « Courageous Heart ». Ce groupe est composé de 26 membres engagés solidairement à recevoir et rembourser des prêts de Kiva à travers Hope Kinshasa RDC. Il a déjà obtenu 2 fois les crédits de Hope qu’il remboursé correctement. 
Munongo a comme activité commerciale, la vente des pagnes dans la partie montagneuse située à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Il a acquit depuis 2002 une solide expérience dans ce secteur d’activité. Son affaire prospère grâce à la bonne gestion et au réinvestissement des bénéfices accumulés. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $20 par jour. Munongo utilisera le prochain prêt pour acheter des pagnes à revendre afin de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et accroitre le revenu. Il est marié et père de 8 enfants âgés entre 4 et 21 ans dont 6 d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Munongo N. is 48 years old and the president of a group called "MoteM. Mpiko Plus", which in English means "Courageous Heart". The group is composed of 26 members who together have received and repaid loans from Kiva through the micro-finance organization, Hope Kinshasa RDC. He has already received 2 loans from Hope and has properly repaid both of them.

Munongo's business is selling "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) in the mountainous area located to the west of Kinshasa. Since 2002, he has had solid experience in the business sector. His business prospers that to his good management and reinvestment of the profits he accumulates. Right now his business generated a profit of $20 a day.

Munongo will use his next loan to purchase "pagnes" to re-sell, so that he can satisfy the needs of his clients and increase his revenues.

He is married and the father of 8 children, they are aged between 4 and 21 - 6 of the children are students.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase "pagnes" (colored wax cloths) for resale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma T. is 34 years old and married to Welmer, a fisherman by occupation. They raise four children in the village of Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo. They sustain their family through fishing activity wherein her husband operates their small fishing boat and she ( Emma) is the one responsible in selling the caught fish on the market.

She is planning to purchase new fishing net in their newly acquired boat. She is very optimistic that they can generate more income if they can have another net. 

She has been a good member in the cooperative since her affiliation. She is now utilizing her second loan cycle and proves to be of great help in their livelihood activities.

loans.use: Additional Capital on Fishing Equipment.

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a married man and the father of one child. He has been in the motorcycle business in Naivasha town for the last five years. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend, who is also a client of KADET. This will be his second loan with the organization. He is planning to buy another motorbike and will employ someone else to operate it for him. 

He believes that buying another motorbike will increase his income flow.

His future plan is to buy his own taxi, which he will operate in Naivasha town.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buying another motorbike

loans.name: Focus Group

texts.en:
Focus is a group of five borrowers led by Joseph F., 35 years old. He is an 11th grade drop-out due to lack of financial support.
He is a single father with three children aged 3-9 years old. They attend Kindergarten and first grade. Joseph and his children live in Vai town north of Monrovia, Liberia.

Buying used clothing wholesale, selling at retail is the business Joseph and his children depend on to pay for their daily expenses.
By introducing new goods to the market, Joseph attracts customers. Joseph has been running this business for four years and hopes to become an importer of used clothing to Liberia. Joseph needs this loan to increase his capital in order to accomplish his goal. He dreams of educating his children and preparing them for the future to come.

loans.use: To increase capital in order to expand business

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mrs. N. Mom is the group leader of six people who all live in Phnum Lonteah village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder. Now she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her  income and improve the family living with this loan. Mrs. N. Mom is a 37-year-old widow with two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
N. Rebecca is into the business of stone quarrying. She is a 30-year-old lady and divorced with four children between the ages of 6 and 13. All her children are in school. She has been operating her business for seven years and she is able to make 50,000/= in weekly profits.

Rebecca is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She works very hard to ensure that she pays her children’s school fees on time and provides the basic necessities. She has a dream of building her own house as well as educating her children to university level so that they can find better jobs. She needs a loan to help buy space for stone quarrying so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: To buy space for stone quarrying

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina B. is from the village of Potol. She is 55 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Marcelina owns and operates a business running a food stall selling snacks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Marcelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support the daily needs of her family. The persons included in the picture with Marcelina are her helpers in the business and the owner of the next stall. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en: Nimfa is already 60 years and still has the courage to manage a rice farming business. She has a 17-year old child in her family. Her rice field is two hectares in size and is located in Surallah, South Cotabato. She heard that Community Economic Ventures, Inc. provides financial assistance to farmers like her, and that's why she joined. Now she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Php to buy farm supplies and hopes she will have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Edith Namosusoke‘S Group

texts.en:
Edith is a 60-year-old married woman with four children. Her children are between the ages of 28 and 50 years, and some of them go to school. She resides in and owns a four-room house, where she lives with six people. Edith takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water, and generally eats three meals per day.

To earn a living, Edith has a stall in Nsooba, where she sells crafts. She incurs significant transportation costs because she has to travel to purchase bananas and crafts in villages throughout Uganda. She works, seven days per week, in a semi-urban area, which is located in the outskirts of Kampala. On average, she has 50 customers per day, and sells to all kinds of people (i.e., both retail and wholesale customres). Her largest monthly expenses include: costs of feeding her family; school tuition fees for her children; and rental dues for her market stall. Among her major business challenges are the seasonal nature of the business and the rainy season, which makes it difficult for her customers to reach her stall (because she works in an area that can be muddy). She has been in this business for ten years, and she has been with MCDT for six years.

She is currently servicing her nineteenth loan. Edith joined MCDT because it was near her home and because it helped poor women. She is seeking this loan in the amount of $725 to buy more crafts. She wants to see her business grow and to sell solely to wholesale customers.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional crafts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy seasonal fruit

loans.name: Absa

texts.fr: Absa B. est âgée de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Son crédit lui permet de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de prendre en charge sa famille. Ses activités sont diverses : elle vend des tissus, fait de l'embouche ovine et vend de l'arachide, du mil de l'oseille, du sucre, de thé, beurre etc.
texts.en:
Absa B. is 60 years old, married and has nine children. Her loan will allow her to boost her savings and to take care of her family. Her activities are diverse: she sells fabric, fattens beef and sells ground nut, millet, sorrel, sugar, tea, butter etc..

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina K. is a single parent and has five dependents. She has received senior high education.

Philomina sells agricultural products  like herbicides and pesticides to the farmers in Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. She uses her income in payment of school fees and utility bills.

Philomina will use the loan to purchase more agricultural supplies to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: To purchase more agricultural supplies to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria owns a fashion store where she sells sarongs, clothing, tailoring materials and more. She designs clothes for sale, especially for weddings, engagements, burial ceremonies, and other social activities where special clothing is needed. With these, she makes her living. 

Victoria wants to stock her store with differed types of materials, so she is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more materials to sell and increase her income.

She is 35 years old. She is married to Mr. O., a businessman, and they are blessed with three children. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Araujo 4 Group

texts.es:
el grupo Araujo 4 esta ubicado en la colonia Araujo de la ciudad de Choluteca, sus integrantes son 3 mujeres las cuales son muy amigas y tienen varios años de conocerse, decidieron unirse en grupo y solicitar un credito para salir adelante con sus negocios y con sus familias. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

doña Derys M.  es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su trabajo y a su familia, se levanta 
a las 5 de la mañana para empezar su produccion de tortillas, luego a las 7 de la mañana manda a sus 2 hijos de 8 y 10 años para la escuela. con este tipo de actividad a logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos,   el prestamo lo nesecita para comprar mas materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas.

la sra. Edelmina H. se dedica a la fabricacion de tortillas, Edelmina se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para fabricar sus ricas tortillas y venderlas en la comunidad en donde vive,  el prestamo lo nesecita  para incrementar su produccion y por ende sus ventas y asi tener mejores utilidades.

la sra. Candida M. es  madre soltera,  tiene 3 hijos  y tambien se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Candida lucha para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos para darles un futuro mejor. Sus hijos estan en la escuela de la comunidad en donde viven, en los tiempos libres sus hijos le ayudan a doña candida. quiere incrementar su negocio por eso es que esta solicitando el credito.
texts.en:
The Araujo 4 group is located in the Araujo neighborhood of the city of Choluteca. The members are three women who are good friends and have known one another for several years. They decided to come together as a group and apply for a loan in order to advance their businesses and families. Here are the details of their different businesses:

Doña Derys M. is an enterprising woman who dedicates herself to her work and her family. She wakes up at 5:00 in the morning to begin making tortillas. Later, at 7:00 a.m., she takes her two children, ages 8 and 10, to school. With this work she has succeeded in getting ahead for her children. She needs the loan in order to purchase more materials for making tortillas.

Sra. Edelmina H. is involved in making tortillas. Edelmina wakes up at 5:00 in the morning to make her delicious tortillas and sell them in the community in which she lives. She needs the loan in order to increase her production and her sales and, thus, have better earnings.

Sra. Candida M. is a single mother with three children. She also is engaged in the sale of tortillas. Candida fights to make progress in order to give her children a better future. Her children are in school in the community in which they live. In their free time they help Doña Candida. She wants her business to grow, and that’s why she is applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, corn flour and lime

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Mrs. Saron T. is a villager in Roteang village in the Kandal province. She was born in 1952. She and her husband, Mr. Chhieng Orieng, are farmers who own a small piece of land and grow and sell vegetables to support their family. 

This family has some problems with the vegetable field, including infertile soil and a lot of insects. Thus, Mrs. Saron T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and vegetable seeds for growing. 

She is a mother of four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, while the other is a farmer. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun K. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sophal Veng, live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children: three daughters and one son. Two of the children have full-time employment, one attends school and another one is still young. 

Sokhoeun is a silk weaver, while her husband is a farmer. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting and to buy piglets to raise. 

She will be able to earn extra income selling the pigs when they grow big enough.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben N., 37, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of about USD 1.50 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  N. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send children to a good school.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, trabaja en su casa elaborando pintado en tela, el mismo le ayuda a poder solventarse en los gastos de alimentación y estudios de sus hijos, ya que esta separada de su esposo.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Villa San Antonio alto de la ciudad de la Paz en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de tela, compra de pintura y otros).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  con este crédito le podrá comprar mercadería y mejorar sus costos por compras.
texts.en:
Maria works out of her home, painting canvasses, which helps her pay her and her children's food and study costs. She is separated from her husband. She lives in the Villa San Antonio area, above the city of La Paz, in a rented house. This is her first loan with Impro, and she plans to use it as capital towards her work: the purchase of canvasses, paints, etc. With this credit, she would also be able to purchase materials and improve her sale costs.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of canvasses and paints for her pieces of art.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine L., 34, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Samuel L., an air conditioner technician, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she augments her husband's earnings so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own direct selling business for quite some time now. She sells cosmetics, clothing and toiletries.

Geraldine has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 14,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities of products that have been ordered by her costumers.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: home products inventory

loans.name: Kashangura Tukore, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Hardworking K. Clare has been running her produce-selling business for over twenty years in Kashangura, Ibanda. Her grocery store business prospers on the basis of the fact that maize flour is liked by many Ugandans. In a month, she has been making 200,000 shillings.

This married mother of seven lively children has worked hard to get herself where she is today. Her long track record in this business also means she has a strong customer base that she has been banking on. She has faced challenges like the continual threat of pests that have incessantly played havoc with her crops. But being the strong-willed woman that she is, she has fought hard to overcome them.

With this loan, Clare wants to purchase more produce like beans, cassava and millet that she will later resell to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase more produce like beans, maize, and cassava

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 3 Group

texts.en:
Geimy is the coordinator of her group Amor y Paz 3 (Love and Peace), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and her four children.

Geimy is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothes for adults and children and other products like shoes and cosmetics. She will use the profits to buy her children school supplies and to reinvest in her business, in this way she can make it bigger and bring more profit to her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy adult and children's clothes and others products

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is from the town of Banga. She is 49 years old. Teresita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years.

Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Teresita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok V. has spent her entire life cultivating crops on her own land. She specializes in growing rice, a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She harvests the crops for the purposes of eating and selling. Sok V. is now married and has two school-aged children. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. Growing rice is an annual operation with which she has had great success for several years. The farming season is approaching, and Sok V. wants to plant the next rice crop. She does not have capital to use for her farm, so she decided to request a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other items for rice crop

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca M. S. tiene una comidería desde hace 2 años en el local donde antes era cocinera, ella con la ayuda de su conyugue le venden a los trabajadores de la zona y su mayor sueño es hacer dicha comidería más grande y que pueda abastecer toda la demanda de la zona, así mismo sueña con que sus hijos sean unos grandes profesionales y hombres de bien y provecho en esta sociedad.
texts.en:
Francisca M. S. has an eatery she started two years ago in the same place where she used to work as a cook. With the help of her husband, she sells to workers in the area. Her greatest wish is to make her business larger so that she can meet all of the local demand. She dreams of seeing her children become successful professionals and good people who will benefit society.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to her business

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter W. I. is a young married man with two children who are 10 years old and three years old. His business is located at Chavakali in Kakamega. He provides motorcycle transport to the people of Chavakali. He has been doing this business for three years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenges he has are financial constraints and the fact that some spare parts are not readily available. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 30,000 to buy motorcycle spare parts to repair his motorcycle so that he can be able to provide good service to his customers. He hopes to own a fleet of motorcycles. He describes himself as honest, cheerful and focused.

loans.use: To motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Melquiadesa

texts.es:
Melquiadesa es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio, Melquiadesa tiene un salón de belleza en una galería del centro de la ciudad, su horario de atención es desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, además vende cosméticos por catalogo que también exhibe en su salón.
Melquiadesa es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo y solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de cosméticos y perfumes.
Los sueños de Melquíades son construir mas pisos en su casa para alquilar y generar un ingreso.
texts.en:
Melquiadesa is married and has two children who are high school students. Melquiadesa owns a beauty salon in a shopping mall in the city center. Her hours of operation are from 10am to 8pm. She also sells cosmetics by catalogue that she displays in her salon. Melquiadesa is a member of the Cielo Communal Bank and is requesting a loan of $1,100 for the purchase of cosmetics and perfumes. Melquiades dreams of building more floors in her home to rent and of generating revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Neli Piedad

texts.es: Neli Piedad P. R. es una señora de 60 años de edad y reside en el Barrio Calvario en la comunidad de Manto, San Francisco de  la Paz. Inició hace 8 años vendiendo piedra, grava y arena, y ahora tiene un negocio de fabricación de bloques de cemento. Adquirió su conocimiento en una bloquera ya que ella trabajaba allí como despachadora, luego de un tiempo decidió construir su casa y se dio cuenta de que comprar los bloques era muy costoso, así que adquirió una maquina compactadora para la elaboración de los mismos y la instaló en el patio de su casa. Actualmente cuatro personas trabajan para ella con un horario de 5:00 am a  12:00 pm y también en la tarde cuando es necesario. Solicita el préstamo para comprar cemento, arena y otros materiales para poder construir una champa en su patio y así proteger un poco a sus trabajadores del intenso sol y a veces lluvias. Con el apoyo del préstamo ella podrá seguir cubriendo sus gastos de manutención porque vive sola y no tiene la ayuda de nadie más. Su meta es comprar una vibradora para hacer los bloques más rápido y en mayor cantidad. Es su segundo ciclo en  FAMA y espera seguir pagando puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Neli Piedad P. R. is a 60 year old woman who resides in the neighborhood of Calvario in the community of Manto, San Francisco de la Paz. Eight years ago she began selling stone, gravel, and sand. Now she has a business making cement blocks. She acquired the knowledge of how to make cement blocks while working as a dispatcher. After a period of time, she decided to build a house and realized that buying blocks was very expensive. Neli acquired a compacting machine for making the blocks she needed to install a patio in her yard. She currently has four employees who work for her between the hours of 5am and 12pm. They also work in the afternoons when necessary.

Neli is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, and other materials to build a shed in her yard to protect her employees from the intense sun and the occasional rains. With the help of this loan, she will able to continue covering her living expenses because she lives alone and does not receive assistance from anyone else. Her goal is to buy a vibrating machine to help her produce blocks faster and in large quantities. This is the second loan she has received from FAMA OPDF and she hopes to continue making her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a shed to protect her employees

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Otgonjargal L. is 32 years old and lives with her husband in Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The couple lives in an apartment. Otgonjargal's husband works as a guard in a health resort. Otgonjargal has been operating a clothes trading business from a stall in her area. She provides a variety of women's clothes and consumer goods to satisfy her customer's needs. Otgonjargal is focused on expanding her retail business and purchasing a house for her family in the future. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Karla Martinez tiene su propio negocio de venta de bebidas como gaseosas, jugos y agua en su localidad. También ofrece alimentos a sus clientes que a diario le visitan para el desayuno o almuerzo.

Ella ha logrado salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades económicas que siempre se atraviesan. Hoy en día está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de la materia prima como arroz, pollo, carne de res y las bebidas. Espera que dicho crédito le sea otorgado y así mejorar su condición económica ya que venderá los alimentos y bebidas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Karla Martinez has her own business selling drinks such as sodas, juices, and water in her area.  She also provides food to customers who visit her daily for breakfast or lunch.

She has managed to succeed despite the economic difficulties that she always goes through.  Today she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as rice, chicken, beef, and beverages.  She hopes that this loan will be granted, and she will sell food and beverages to her customers, thereby improving her economic condition.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for food preparation.

loans.name: Ndack

texts.fr: Madame Ndack S. est une commerçante qui vie a quartier de Grand Mbour et qui a une grande expérience dans ce domaine. Elle importe ses tissus et drap au niveau de la Mauritanie et quelques fois en Gambie. Elle vend à crédit et souvent sous commande de sa clientèle résident également à Mbour.Ndack a sillicié ce prêt pour renforcer son activité en cette période de fête où certains tissus sont prisés
texts.en: Mrs. Ndack S. is a merchant who lives in the Grand Mbour district and has a lot of experience in her business. She imports her fabrics and linens from Mauritanie and sometimes from Gambie. She sells on credit and often on order to customers also residing in Mbour. She is seeking a loan to strengthen her business during this holiday season, when certain types of fabrics are especially prized.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Susana Eufemia

texts.es:
Susana Eufemia M. T. tiene 29 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Susana  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 4 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y grande.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Susana Eufemia M. T. is 29 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and her children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 2 children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Susana has been growing corn, rice and beans for 4 years. Susana is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to own her own big home.  She likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra, aged 30 years, is a married man living in a semi permanent house in Kyenjojo Uganda. He is a farmer and deals in Irish potatoes and maize. He dreams of educating his children, building and expanding his plantations. He wants a loan to buy Irish potatoes for planting.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes for planting

loans.name: Nyakahanga Twetungure Group

texts.en: T. Ruth, with hand raised, is the leader of Nyakahanga Twetungure group in Kihihi. She is 40 years old and married with six children of whom five are in school. Ruth has had a retail shop in Nyakahanga that sells sugar, salt, drinks, and edibles to the customers in her locality for four years and makes 200,000/= as monthly profit. She got encouragement to start up this business from her husband due to the ready market available and now they are both happy. She is determined and trust-worthy and needs to expand her business and have a healthy family. She needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for the shop.

loans.use: Buying more stock for the shop.

loans.name: Gulbarchyn's Group

texts.en:
Gulbarchyn A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 34 years old and divorced. She brings up a son, 14, who studies at school. Three years ago with the initial investment of 2,000 soms, Gulbarchyn started to sell Kyrgyz national cloth and dressmaking supplies. She earns 10,000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save 200,000 soms to purchase a flat. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase fabrics and materials for sewing. Gulbarchyn also wants to try selling coal to make additional money. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Sonia Nohemi

texts.es:
Sonia de 26 años de edad, reside en Nueva Guadalupe, departamento de San Miguel, es soltera y vive con sus padres y hermanos, tiene un negocio de Ropa, el cual está ubicado frente al parque central de Chinameca un lugar muy cercado donde trabaja de lunes a sábado de hace ya 4 años.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: trajes, camisas, punteras, camisetas, short, pantalones, ella considera que con esta mercadería que logre comprar podrá abastecer los gustos de muchas personas que transitan el lugar y otros que son clientes frecuentes, espera aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y mantener en buenos niveles los inventarios.
Sueña con un negocio amplio, rentable y con muchos clientes, en su vida personal quiere a futuro formar su propio hogar con una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Sonia is 26 years old and lives in Nueva Guadalupe, in San Miguel department.  She is single and lives with her parents and siblings.  She has a clothes business which is located opposite Chinameca central park, a very popular area.  She has been working there, from Monday to Saturday, for four years.

Sonia is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as dresses, shirts, toe caps, t-shirts, shorts and pants.  She believes that with this merchandise she will be able to appeal to the tastes of many people who pass by her stall and also her frequent customers.  She hopes to increase her sales volume and maintain a good stock level.  Sonia dreams of having a bigger, more profitable business, with a lot of customers.  Her dream for her personal life is to be able, in the future, to set up her own home with better financial security.

loans.use: To buy dresses, shirts, toe caps, t-shirts, shorts and pants

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a firewood selling business from home; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Fatuma's major challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To prepare land for farming

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy, de 27 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su familia conformada por su esposa Natividad de 24 años y su pequeña hija Yanira de 6 años;  juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan  en un populoso distrito ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Desde hace 12 años este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la reparación y refacción de todo tipo de  refrigeradoras. Al principio ayudaba a su tío en su taller, luego aprendió todo lo necesario, y en la actualidad  es el socio de su tío, trabajan juntos  y se reparten las ganancias de este negocio, pues ambos han logrado  sacar adelante el negocio con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Él empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano y también atiende trabajos a domicilio, manifiesta que le gusta mucho su labor pues le gusta sobretodo ir a las casas a reparar los artefactos pues la ganancia es mayor, y las ganancias le permiten ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado instalar su propio taller e implementarlo con modernas herramientas, y sus propias máquinas pero sabe que solo lo logrará con su trabajo constante. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Roy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de algunas herramientas que le hacen falta en su taller, pues quiere ofrecer un mejor servicio, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Roy is 27 years old and lives in his own home with his family, which includes his wife Natividad, who is 24, and his young daughter Yanira, who is 6.  They live in a populous area located to the north of the city.  

For the last 12 years, this enterprising man has worked repairing and refurbishing all types of refrigerators.  At first, he helped his uncle in his workshop, but he has learned everything necessary, and currently he and his uncle work together and share the earnings from the business.
