They have both succeeded in improving the business with a lot of strength and dedication. 

He starts work very early and also does work at home.  He says that he likes his work very much, but he mostly likes going to houses to repair appliances because it earns more money, and more income allows his family to have a better quality of life.  Because he is a very enterprising man, he is planning to have his own workshop in the future, which will have modern tools and his own machines.  He knows he will only achieve this with constant work.  

This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments on time because he does not want to make a bad impression on the people who are making the loan possible, which is allowing him to continue working towards his goal.  

Roy plans to invest this loan in the purchase of some tools that he lacks in his workshop, which will allow him to offer better service.  In this way, he hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren, 61, is married and lives with his wife and daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. 

He began operating a bakery and woodcraft trading business in 2000. Then he started to sell clothes in 2006. His daughters help him to purchase goods from China and he takes care of the sales. He rents a stall at a local market. He started his retail trading business with a working capital of 200,000 MNT and his current working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. He has been one of the reliable customers of our bank since 2000. 

Byambasuren is a hardworking and honest person who says, " I want to expand my business and help my children start their own life". He is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase clothes for his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia  is 27 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She lives with her boyfriend who has a selling booth. Felecia has a 9-year-old son who is attending school. 

For the past four years, Felecia has been cooking and selling pig feet, chicken and soft bone. She started this business after she graduated from high school. Her current challenge is to keep the business up and running while taking care of her son and attending classes. What she likes about the business is making her own money to support her son and pay her own expenses. 

Felecia has requested a loan to purchase pig feet and chicken to cook and sell. She is continuing her education and in the future she wants to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase pig feet and chicken to cook and sell

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana J. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, vive por la comunidad Corazón de Jesús que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, en esta parroquia hay hermosos lugares para visitar, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura, son muy amables y gentiles.

Doña Ana tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 25, 23, 20 y 11 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan economícamente y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un bus, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora Ana se dedica a varias actividades como: lavar ropa ajena, cría chanchos, pollos y cuyes los que vende en su comunidad y en su casa tiene una tiendita de comestibles la misma que abre solo cuando se encuentra en casa y por las noches.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, huevos, fideos, aceites, detergentes, etc.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana J. is a member of the communal bank "Corazón de Jesús".  She lives in the community "Corazón de Jesús" in the Valle parish which has beautiful places to visit.  Its people are merchants, farmers or raise livestock and they are very kind and gentle.

Doña Ana, age 41, is married and has four children, ages 25, 23, 20 and 11.  The eldest three work and help her out financially and her youngest is in school.  Her husband is a bus driver and together they have been able to build their own home.

Ana has several business activities.  She launders clothes and raises pigs, chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her community.  She also has a small grocery store in her home that she opens only when she is at home in the evenings.

She has been a member of the communal bank for six years and plans to use this loan to buy groceries for her store such as rice, sugar, eggs, pasta, oil, detergent, etc.

Her goal is to continue expanding her store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, eggs, pasta, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo G. se siente orgulloso de su negocio de producción y comercialización de arepas. Durante algunos años este emprendedor se dedicó a una tienda en la que vendía productos de la canasta familiar, pero las pocas ganancias lo obligaron a cerrar quedando desempleado y con algunas deudas propagar. 

Fue entonces cuando decidiò hacer de la tradicional arepa su propio negocio que inició en el comedor de su casa vendiendo 45 paquetes diarios. Hoy Eduardo continúa con el mismo empuje y ganas de progresar, lo que le ha permitido crecer su negocio, pues vende diariamente paquetes de arepas lo que lo ha obligado a trabajar en la terraza de su casa. 

En el futuro Eduardo se visualiza como un gran empresario, para ello trabaja fuertemente y sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia conformada por 2 hijos. 

Actualmente Eduardo necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas para cumplir con las normas de higiene y manipulación propias de las empresas de alimentos en Colombia y además comprar un molino para agilizar sus procesos y realizarle mantenimiento a su maquinaria.
texts.en:
Eduardo G. feels proud of his business making and selling arepas. For some years this entrepreneur has had a store where he sells basic necessities, but the low earnings forced him to close it, leaving him unemployed and with some debts to pay.

That was when he decided to use the traditional arepa to make his own business that he started in the kitchen of his house, selling 45 packets a day. Today Eduardo continues with the some drive and desire to progress, which has allowed him to expand his business. He sells packets of arepas daily, working from the patio of his house.

In the future Eduardo sees himself as a great businessman. He works hard to reach that end and dreams of improving quality of life for himself and his family, made up of 2 children.

Currently Eduardo needs a loan to make some improvements to the locale to meet hygiene and food handling standards for food businesses in Colombia, and also to buy a mill to make his processes easier and to maintain his machinery.

loans.use: to make some improvements to meet hygiene and food handling standards, to buy a grinder and maintain the machinery.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven emprendedora de 23 años de edad. Ella vive con su novio y su pequeño hijo en una zona rural del distrito de Piura.

El novio de Rosa se dedica a la agricultura y junto con ella se dividen los gastos del hogar y del niño.

La actividad que desarrolla Rosa es la crianza y  venta de aves de corral (pavos) así como la elaboración de harina de Jora. Ambas actividades las realiza desde hace 7 años desde su domicilio. Rosa cuenta con clientela ya establecida quienes son, principalmente, pobladores de su zona.  

Rosa solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para mejorar los corrales de sus aves y para comprar maíz y poder tener la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración de su harina. Rosa tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida pues su hogar no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe y esto es lo que la motiva a seguir luchando y esforzándose en sus actividades.
texts.en:
Rosa is a young, 23-year old entrepreneur. She lives with her boyfriend and their young son in a rural region of the district of Piura.

Rosa's boyfriend is an agriculturist and they share their household expenses and their son's expenses.

Rosa's business activity is to raise and sell poultry (turkeys) and she also makes flour for jora (a traditional drink). She has been doing both activities for the past 7 years from her home. Rosa has an already established clientele, primarily composed of the people in her region.

Rosa requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. She will use it to improve the corral where she keeps her poultry and to purchase corn, to have in stock the ingredients she needs to make her flour. Rosa has many dreams to improve the quality of her life. Her home is not equipped with basic services, such as electricity, water, and sewage services. And this motivates her to keep working and investing her efforts into her businesses.

loans.use: to improve her corrals and to purchase corn to make flour.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun, 59, is a rice farmer who also raise pigs at home. Married since 1979 to a teacher, she and her husband have three married children - two sons and one daughter. Both sons live in separate homes, while their daughter still lives in the family home and works as a garment factory worker.

Saroeun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her daughter to drive to work as well as additional pigs and pig feed.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs to raise, pig feed, and a new motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years.  She is 46 years old, married to Moses, and they have five school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She paid off her previous loan of 40,000 KES well and in good time.  She plans to use this loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Ann hopes to practice mixed farming, hence diversifying her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with 7 children. She is 66 years old and lives in Plaridel.

To earn a living, Rosita sells a variety of products from her general store. She has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is a hard-working and responsible woman with two business endeavors. Four years ago, she decided to start her own business so as to better provide for her family. Ever since then, she has run two businesses: she sells women's clothes and shoes, and she breeds cattle. She eventually noticed that cattle breeding brought in more income for herself and her family, so she decided to dedicate most of her time to breeding cattle. However, she still sells women's clothes and shoes out of her home and is always available to local customers.  

Tarana is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN. With the loan, she will buy cattle. She will also purchase clothing merchandise that is on sale, which she will then re-sell at a special price to her customers. This will allow her to grow her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase two cattles and some new clothes for summer season to offer for sale

loans.name: Guadalupe Esmeralda

texts.es: Guadalupe es una mujer que radica en el municipio de Monterrey. La señora Lupita es una empresaria que cuenta con 31 años de edad. Es casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos ellos estudiantes dos están en la primaria y dos en la secundaria. Guadalupe vende ropa usada y calzado por catálogo. Tiene varios años ya con este negocio y con el crédito busca aumentar su mercancía, tener un buen rendimiento para invertir en un mejor negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Guadalupe is a woman who lives in the town of Monterrey. Lupita is a business woman who is 31 years old. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Two of them are in elementary school and two are in secondary school. Guadalupe sells used clothes and shoes via catalogue. She has had this business for several years and seeks to increase her merchandise with the loan. She wants to have good sales in order to improve her business and get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Edik

texts.ru:
Эдику 35 лет, он живет в селе Ужанис, Сюникского региона, вместе со своей женой, тремя сыновьями и родителями-пенсионерами. Старшие сыновья Эдика учатся в сельской средней школе, младшему сыну 4 годика. Жена Эдика занимается домашним хозяйством и помагает мужу на ферме. 
С 1990 года Эдик занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Ужанис: разводит крупный рогатый скот, кур, овец и пчел. А также выращивает овощи и фрукты, пшеницу, ячмень на собственной земле, а арендованный участок земли служит пастбищем для коров и овец. Эдик реализует выращенные овощи, фрукты, пшеницу, а также говядину, баранину, молоко, яйца и мед своим постоянным покупателям в городе Капан. 
Кредит на сумму 500.000 драм необходим Эдику для проведения посевных работ:  покупки нового сорта зерна, дизельного топлива, удобрений и т.д.
texts.en: Edik is 35 years old, he lives in the village of Uzhanis, Syunik province together with his wife, three sons and his retired parents. Edik's older sons are studying at the village's school and his youngest is 4 years old. Edik's wife is a homemaker and helps her husband on the farm as well. Edik had his farm since 1990 and raises cattle, chickens, sheep and bees. He also grows fruits, vegetables, wheat and oats on his own land and rents a pasture where he grazes his sheep and cattle. Edik sells produce as well as beef, lamb, milk eggs and honey to longtime customers in the city of Kapan. He requires a loan of 500,000 dram for the winter growing season in order to purchase new seed varieties, diesel fuel, fertilizer etc.

loans.use: To buy new sort of seeds, diesel fuel, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалик житель города Худжанд. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Абдумалик занимается животноводством. Этот вид деятельности у них является семейный. Он разводит мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Abdumalik lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 43 years old, married and has three children.  He has a secondary education.  Abdumalik is involved in animal husbandry, which is his family business.  He breeds small livestock at home for future sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Blanca Edita

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Blanca, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella y estudia en Universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse la vida y  la de su familia junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual juntos  trabajan día a día para que esta mejore aun mas, allí  venden  todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y veces hasta más tarde, además de estos productos también venden carne, pollo, pescado, y útiles escolares. Los productos los compra en Portoviejo ya que allá le salen más baratos y algunos los  recibe en su local. Lleva más de 15 años con su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de  5 años  y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the spa town of San Clemente, the Communal Bank "1 de Diciembre" meets every two weeks.  This area is well-known for its beautiful beaches with are visited by many national and international tourists.  It has a variety of beautiful places and a delicious variety of dishes that are typical of the region.

In this place, we meet Señora Blanca.  She is 53 years old and married with three grown children from the relationship.  One of them still lives with her and studies at University.  Her husband works in retail.

To earn money for herself and her family, our friend works in retail with her husband .  They have a food store in their home where they work together on a daily basis so as to do even better.  They sell all types of products, such as rice, sugar, oils, and detergents among other things.  She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. and sometimes later.  In addition to these products, they also sell meat, chicken, fish and school supplies.  They buy the products in Portoviejo, as they are sold there more cheaply and some aren't found in their area.  She has been working in this business for more than 15 years.

This loan will be used to stock up her store.  She will purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, and other everyday products.

She has been in the Communal Bank for more than five years, and likes it because of the benefits the institution provides.

Her goals are to continue moving forward with her business, and for her shop to grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, and other everyday products.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 33 years old. He is married and has two children. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foods as well as detergents, like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, shaving cream and washing powder, and many other foodstuffs in his store. Ramil is not alone in this business. His wife actively helps him with sales. His monthly profit is $160 USD and he is on the way to increasing it. His business is very successful because of a good location in the central Sabirabad bazaar. 

Today, Ramil is requesting a loan of 1500 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Ramil has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more food merchandise to increase income.

loans.name: 4 De Mayo Sector 4 Group

texts.es:
La señora Cristina Isabela es casada, tiene 49 años D. edad, estudio los estudios D. educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales estudian 3, se dedica a la tejeduría D. telas típicas, servilletas, cortes, sabanas; también se dedica a la crianza D. gallinas, inició criando solo algunas gallinas y ahora quiere incrementar el numero D. animales, hasta ahora lleva 20 años D. experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra D. otras gallinas y D. esta forma incrementar su pequeña granja, espera en el futuro tener una granja mas granD. y vender huevos. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la tejeduría, crianza D. animales, atención D. tienda en general y a la sastrería.
texts.en:
Cristina Isabela is 49 years old, married, and completed her primary education.  She has five children, three of whom are in school.  She weaves traditional fabrics, napkins, outfits and sheets. She also works raising chickens.  She started out with fewer hens and now she would like to increase the number.  She has 20 years experience.

Cristina Isabela is requesting a loan to buy more hens and thereby increase her production and profits.  She hopes, in the future, to have a larger farm and sell eggs.  The other members of this group weave, raise animals, run stores and make clothes.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 45 years old. He lives in the village of Sartichala, East Georgia with his family: his wife Irma, two sons (22 and 21 years old), a daughter (16 years old) and his 71-year-old father. Gocha's daughter goes to school. His younger son is a student and the elder son works in a hospital, as a doctor's assistant. 

Gocha and Irma lead the agricultural business of the family. Gocha's father helps them. The family has three milk cows and six calves. They produce cheese and sell it locally to dairy product retailers. Along with the dairy the family has small pig farm with two pigs. They sell piglets on local market. Also Gocha grows maize on a family-owned plot of land. Part of the harvested corn is sold to the wholesalers and the rest is used for feeding their livestock. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris (approximately $600). 

With this loan Gocha plans to purchase 10 calves. He will raise them and sell the grown calves in the spring for a much higher price. This will bring additional income to the family. Gocha plans to reinvest part of the increased income in the family farm and the other part will be used for financing the children's education.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en: Tadeo is a 39-year-old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the tailoring business for 18 years and he acquired capital from farming. His hardships are price fluctuation, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to move his business to a more permanent location. Tadeo needs the loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo las socias y los socios del Banco Comunal La Nueva Esperanza se reúnen cada quince días, lugar donde la mayoria de su gente se dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les va a servir de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos van a mejorar los pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, agricultura y cría de animales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Flor, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro  hijos de 13, 10, 8 y 6 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es chofer.
 
Ella es  una muy buena ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y de productos Oriflame (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, a ella le encanta vender sus productos ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, a place where a majority of the people work in agriculture and raise animals, the partners of the Banco Comunal La Nueva Esperanza ("Communal Bank The New Hope") meet every fifteen days.  

This is a group of people that decided to unite and form this communal bank that will help them a lot, as the loans will allow the group members to improve the small businesses that they have. They work in diverse businesses, such as commerce, agriculture, and raising animals.  

Here, we meet Flor, who is 29 years old and lives in a common law marriage through which she has four children, aged 13, 10, 8, and 6, who are in school.  Her husband is a driver.  

She is a very good housewife who sells underwear and Oriflame products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women) to acquire her own income. She works three days a week, selling her products on credit and collecting money each week.  She has worked in this business for a year, and it is going very well.  She loves to sell her products as they are very good.  

This loan is to purchase perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and underwear.  This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank, and she likes it because the repayments are easy to make.  

Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and underwear.

loans.name: Juviline

texts.en:
Juviline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. Juviline requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish and other sea products to sell.
She has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and buy a new boat.

loans.use: To purchase fish and other sea products to sell

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and one sibling. His father is the main income provider in the family and their only support. For this reason, he decided to have his own business hoping to take some responsibilities off of him. After being involved in barber services for nine years, Elias opened his own salon in 2011 and is looking to gain new loyal customers. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to change his salon’s interior design. He notes that this may attract more clients and therefore increase his revenues. In the future, he plans to enlarge his salon and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to change his salon’s interior design.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 22 years old, married and has one child.  She lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City.  Elisa has a clothing business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. 

Elisa is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more clothes to sell. Elisa has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Elisa hopes to have an increase income and see her child complete his education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is a rice farmer, while her husband is an electrician. They have been married for almost twenty years and have three children: one is a garment worker and the other two attend school. They live in a suburb about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophal is applying for another loan in the amount of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for her son who is a garment worker to get to work.  

Photo: Sophal is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to get to work.

loans.name: Gold Group

texts.fr: GOLD est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la sixième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Odile (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 50 ans. Odile n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Odile est mariée à un certain Emile. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Odile vit ensemble avec son mari. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Odile et son mari. Pour cette raison, Odile des vivres et des condiments à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Odile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Odile sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe GOLD, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres et des condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy would like to buy candle wax, petroleum jelly, antiseptics, and a big metal basin for mixing

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia sells secondhand clothing and jewelry, both local and foreign-made. She would like to buy jewelry from manufacturers, but it is very costly and she is unable to buy it these days. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to enable her to expand her product line in this way.

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Baldomero

texts.en:
Baldomero is a farmer from the Santa Lucia area. He has a small piece of land that was given to him and his brothers by his father. He primarily produces rice on his part of the land. He lives with his wife and children on his land, with his brothers nearby. They are a very close knit family who help each other out by working cohesively on their lands. He hopes that with the loan he can make his land more productive for rice, as now it is not level and he needs to rent machinery to level it out. With the extra profits he wants to improve his home which is in poor condition.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Baldomero is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Primero de Agosto Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. They will use the microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that it is imperative for the communities it works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui, who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area, as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize, or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water from the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds, and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Farm Rice

loans.name: Miriam Deyanira

texts.es:
Deyanira is a very hard-working and cheerful woman. She is married and has two school-aged children. Her family is fortunate to own its own home, but they still have mortgage payments to meet so in order to help her husband with the family expenses Deyanira started her own business selling cosmetics. She began selling to friends and neighbors about a year ago. Since then her client base has expanded. At this time she would like a loan of $475 to buy merchandise. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months. Deyanira appreciates your support in the success of her business and the well-being of her family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Deyanira es una mujer muy trabajadora y optimista, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando. Afortunadamente les ha sido posible adquirir su propia vivienda, pero aun están pagando las hipotecas lo que reduce el ingreso familiar, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar Deyanira emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos desde hace más de un año, inició vendiendo entre sus vecinas y familiares, gracias a las recomendaciones de sus clientes ahora se han incrementado mucho sus pedidos.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ahora Deyanira está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia y en el crecimiento de este negocio, Deyanira agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: "I am encouraged about my business," says Mrs. Joy E.. She is 26 years old, married, and the mother of three (3) children. She is from Benin City. She sells electrical appliances & electronics to the public. She hopes to buy more electrical appliances and electronics for sale if this loan is given to her. She has been in business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy appliances and electronics for sale

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Mrs. Anthonia O. is 54 years old, is married, and has seven children. She lives in Asaba town in Delta State, where she owns a restaurant selling all kinds of African dishes and drinks to people in her community. She learned the business from her sister and started her own restaurant in 1995. She is requesting a loan of $1,175 to buy a generator that would enable her to cool drinks and foodstuffs. She has been with LAPO for two years.

loans.use: To buy generator for cooling drinks	and foodstuffs

loans.name: Hadjaga

texts.en:
Hadjaga is a young man who has his own business. He has sold clothes for three years. He is 25 years old, single and lives in Khaladj village, in the Salyan region.

Hadjaga plans to expand his shop and buy a lot of clothes to attract more clients. He requests a loan of $1,200 to realize his plans.

loans.use: To expand his shop

loans.name: Asenciona's Group

texts.es:
Yanet, Elizabeth and Asenciona have belonged to the Communal Bank Los Laureles for 8, 1 and 10 years respectively. In their communal bank they learned to be puctual, responsible, how to manage their business, and how to tend to their customers.

Yanet is 37 years old and has 6 children. She sells food at the association Los Mecanicos (the mechanics) during the day, and sells anticuchos (Peruvian meat grilled skewers) at night. She has been doing both activities as a street vendor for 6 years. On her part, Elizabeth is 23 years old and has a small son. Elizabeth has been selling firewood for a year. Meanwhile, Asenciona is 54 years old, has 4 children, and has had a general store for 24 years.

Yanet, Elizabeth and Asenciona need loans for 400 soles each, which they will invest in buying rice, noodles, potato, condiments, firewood, oil, milk, cookies, candy, chocolate, gum.

They will use their savings for their children's education or in case of an emergency. The dreams of Yanet, Elizabeth, and Asencions are to have a larger business, that their children go to college, setting up a car repair shop together with her husband, and set up a tailor's shop.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Yanet, Elizabeth y Asenciona pertenecen al Banco Comunal Los Laureles desde hace 8, 1, 10 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables, como manejar su negocio y atender a los clientes.

Yanet tiene 37 años y 6 hijos, y vende comida durante el día en la asociación Los Mecánicos y por las noches vende anticuchos. Ambas actividades las realiza ambulantemente desde hace 6 años. Por otro lado Elizabeth tiene 23 años y 1 hijo pequeño. Elizabeth vende leña en su casa desde hace 1 año. Mientras que Asenciona tiene 54 años y 4 hijos, y tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 24 años.

Yanet, Elizabeth y Asenciona necesitan préstamos de 400 soles cada una, que serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, fideo, papa, condimentos, leña, aceite, leche, galletas, caramelos, chocolates, chicles.

Sus ahorros los utilizarán para la educación de sus hijos y para alguna emergencia. Los sueños de Yanet, Elizabeth y Asenciona son tener un negocio más grande, que sus hijos realicen estudios superiores, poner un taller mecánico junto a su esposo e implementar una sastrería.

loans.use: Yanet, Elizabeth and Asenciona need loans for 400 soles each, which they will invest in buying rice, noodles, potato, condiments, firewood, oil, milk, cookies, candy, chocolate, gum.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mrs. Men K. S., 51, is the mother of three children who lives in Batambong province, Cambodia. She is employed by a local hospital and makes about $6 a day. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and typically earns about $5 per day. Mrs. Men K. S. has applied for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle so that one of her children can operate a motor-taxi service like her husband does. She believes this will increase the family's income and help improve its standard of living

loans.use: To earn more income by operating a motor-taxi like her husband's.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Group leader Mariam B. resides with her family in Lahore, Pakistan. She and her husband have three children; one girl and two boys. Mrs. B. is not educated but wants all of her children to complete their education at the local school. She works in a local school as a sweeper and her husband is a tailor. He would like to buy a few sewing machines for his shop with the loan.

The other group members are; Husna B. who makes and sells flowers; Walayat B. wants to buy her husband a cycle; Nusrat I. sells cloth.These women are neighbors and support each other in their endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines

loans.name: Migdonio

texts.es:
Migdonio V. is 49 years old and is a very active person. He is married to Adolfina Arias, who is also the housekeeper. The marriage has produced two sons, one aged 25 and the other aged 22 years, who from an early age learnt to be responsible as Migdonio always instilled this in them: they always helped their father in the workshop he owns and today the elder of his sons still works as a technician in the mechanic's area of a national petrol company.

Migdonio is very proud of his sons because they study and work, he remembers that when he was a teenager he came from a small village in the interior of the country looking for better opportunities. He worked for several years as an employee in a company and then after saving for several years he was able to open his own mechanic's workshop for vehicles in his house.

For a few years, Mogdonio closed his workshop and travelled to Argentina to work there as he had been offered an excellent job. For five years he lived and worked in Argentina and he returned to Paraguay with a good amount of money saved which today is being used to pay for his sons' university studies.

Today Migdonio continues to work in his mechanic's workshop and he is asking for a credit to invest in improving the infrastructure in the workshop.

The credits which the Foundation had previously authorised were used to acquire work tools, for which Migdonio is very grateful for the support given to the business.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Migdonio V. tiene 49 años, es una persona muy activa, él esta casado con la señora Adolfina Arias, la misma es ama de casa. El matrimonio tiene dos hijos, uno de 25 años y el otro de 22 años, los dos desde pequeños aprendieron a ser responsables pues Migdonio siempre les inculco ; ambos ayudaron siempre a su padre en el taller que él posee y hoy día el hijo mayor ya trabaja como técnico en el área automotriz en una empresa petrolera del país.

Migdonio esta muy orgulloso de sus hijos porque estudian y trabajan, recuerda que cuando él era adolescente vino de un pueblo pequeño del interior del país a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades. Trabajo como empleado varios años en una empresa y luego de ahorrar por varios años logró montar su propio taller mecánico para vehículos en su casa.

Durante unos años, Migdonio cerró su taller pues viajo a la Argentina a trabajar luego de que se le presentara una excelente propuesta de trabajo. Durante cinco años vivió y trabajo en Argentina y volvió a Paraguay con un buen dinero ahorrado que hoy día sirve para costear los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.

Hoy día Migdonio sigue trabajando en su taller y solicita un crédito para invertirlo en el mismo especialmente en la mejora de la infraestructura de su taller.

Los credito que le fueron otorgando la Fundacion fueron para adquirir herramientas de trabajo, el cual menciona su agradecimiento por la ayuda obtenida a la Empresa.

loans.use: Improve the workshop's infrastructure

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Catherine M.. She is married and has 4 children aged 3, 7, 10 and 13. She has 5 dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 1999, Catherine established her cereal crop selling business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock of the crop in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilitation as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of the crop in bulk.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial, 35, has been happily married to Liz Chavez, 28, for 10 years. The couple has two daughters, one in the third grade and the other in the first grade.

Marcial used to be a soccer player. He lived with his mother who operated a small grocery store and, when she died, he took over her business. Operating the store was more of a struggle before Marcial added on a fish market. Now he has an established base of customers thanks to the attention he pays to service and to the quality of the products he offers.

Marcial wants to expand his fish market so that he can offer a wider range of fish to his customers. He's applying for a loan so that he can buy a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Mrcial J. de 35 años de edad está felizmente casado hace 10 años con la señora Liz Chávez de 28 años. El matrimonio tiene dos hijas, actualmente están estudiando en la primaria, una de sus hijas esta en el 3º Grado y otra en el 1º grado.

Don Marcial fue futbolista y vivía con su madre, quien tenía una pequeña despensa. Luego falleció su madre y él quedo al frente del negocio. De apoco fue cargando más su despensa hasta llegar a anexarle una pescadería. Actualmente ya tiene una clientela bien formada, gracias a la buena atención y calidad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Como sueño personal desea ampliar más su pescadería para así poder ofrecer más variedad de pescados a su clientela. El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de otra congeladora.

loans.use: Buy a freezer.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyneang C. is a 26-year-old widow in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a taxi driver who transports customers from Kampong Chhnang to Phnom Penh and back. Despite owning a car, she finds it difficult to travel around the village to shop or take her children to school since the roads are not suitable for automobiles. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike. Previously, Mrs. Sreyneang C.  obtained a loan that, added to her savings, allowed her to purchase a car to start her current business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Nancy Dina

texts.es:
Nancy has always sought the best opportunities for her development. Along these lines, her greatest concern is to create a profitable business. More than eight years ago, she worked selling all types of products on foot in markets: everything from thermos to clippers. Her knack for sales, acquired from experience, has helped her since she was young. She used to go out and sell all sorts of products like, for example, at a championship sporting event, ice cream and refreshments. Now, in the month of August, she says that she will do better. She has a lot of hope for this and, with your help, she hopes to have more merchandise bought with the loan of 300 soles she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy siempre ha buscado las mejores oportunidades para su desarrollo, muestra de ello, es su gran esmero para conseguir un negocio rentable, hace más de 8 años se desempeña vendiendo en las ferias todo tipo de mercería de manera ambulante, vende desde termos hasta cortaúñas. Esta habilidad para las ventas, adquirida en la vida, la ha ayudado desde que era muy joven, ya que siempre salía a vender cualquier producto de ocasión, como por ejemplo en un campeonato deportivo, vendía chupetes (helados de hielo) y refrescos. Ahora para la época de agosto ella dice que le irá mucho mejor, está con mucha esperanza para ello ya que con su ayuda espera tener mayor cantidad de mercadería por lo que solicita un préstamo de 300 soles.

loans.use: More merchandise (various products) for her business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana E. lives in Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 41 years old and married with six children. Juliana started farming in 2003. She owns a farm where she cultivates pumpkin leaves and bitter leaves. Pumpkin leaves are used in the preparation of Nigerian soups, while bitter leaves are useful herbs.

Juliana is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy pumpkin seeds for planting, as the demand for pumpkin leaves is high. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more pumpkin seeds to plant for cultivation of pumpkin leaves.

loans.name: Danilo José

texts.es:
El señor Danilo P. se dedica al negocio de venta de repuestos de todo tipo para motocicletas atendiéndolo en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino donde es originario.

El negocio comenzó desde hace 3 años ofertando pocos repuestos pero muy sabiamente se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel y gracias a estos ha logrado mejorar y aumentar la cantidad de repuestos para ofertar.

La principal razón por la que hoy en día ha solicitado el crédito es para la compra de dichos repuesto con el propósito de ofrecerlos en su comunidad. ES de importancia destacar que él ha sido un buen cliente de la institución y son sus anhelos continuar hasta mejorar todo su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Danilo P. sells parts for all makes of motorcycles in the city where he was born, Ciudad Sandino. He began his business 3 years ago offering a few parts but very wisely he has supported himself through loans provided by Ceprodel and thanks to these loans he has been able to improve and expand the quantity of parts that he offers. The reason for his loan today is to buy parts with the intention of selling them in the community. It is important to note that he has been a good client of this institution and his goals are to continue improving his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle parts

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Zakia, who is 32 years old and married, has been selling food in her shop in Zanzibar for six years, working daily from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can stock more inventory and increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more foods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Women's Group A

texts.en: K. David is the chairperson of Kamu Kamu Women’s Group A in Kayunga. The group meets at his home where he has a wife and a number of children. David is a traditional healer, very smart at his job, using the spirit of his late father. People with all sorts of problems and sicknesses come to his place for the cure and people are not complaining. His drugs are well packaged so that they do no harm to his customers. David employs people to look for the herbs from the villages in Jinja, Kayunga, Iganga and as far as Kenya, as well as paying for the herbs. He is seeking a loan to be able to buy the herbs as well as pay for labor both for his business and on his farm.

loans.use: David needs to buy herbs and pay farm labor with the loan.

loans.name: Adoudé

texts.fr:
Agée de 38 ans, Madame Adoudé A. est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Couturière de profession, elle achète des tissus, confectionne des habits et vêtements et les met en vente. Cette idée qu’elle a entreprise l’aide beaucoup à s’occuper de sa famille car génératrice de revenus.
Pour avoir un fonds de commerce important et aller acheter en gros dans les grandes boutiques, elle sollicite un crédit. Cet objectif, une fois atteint, lui permettra de coudre les habits en grande quantité qu'elle peut mettre à la disposition de la clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter et aussi aller vendre dans les autres grands marchés environnants. 
Le revenu réalisé lui permettra de mieux aider son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
38 years old, Adoudé A. is married and the mother of 3 children. A seamstress by profession, she buys fabrics to make outfits and clothing and sell them. This helps her greatly in supporting her family as the business generates an income. She is asking for this loan to have working capital and be able to buy wholesale from the big stores. Once she has done this, she will sew a large number of outfits which she will display to her clientele, which continues to grow in number, as well as sell the finished clothing in large neighbouring markets. The revenue she will make will enable her to help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sew and sell clothing

loans.name: Hadija C.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Hadija M. from Tukuyu. She is married with two children aged four and seven. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents cannot take care of them. Hadija has been running a timber business since 2006. Hadija's business is purchasing timber from villages and selling in town for a higher price.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her mother and young brother. Hadija currently earns about 200 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375 USD in order to purchase more timber in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Hadija thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more timber in bulk

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana Leticia G. P., tiene 26 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene cuatro hijos menores de edad. Reside en Cojutepeque departamento de Cuscatlan en El Salvador. Ella tiene como actividad en su trabajo engordar pollos para venderlos en sus 4 galeras  las cuales poseen toda la infraestructura necesaria para este tipo de trabajo. Ana Leticia esta realizando su segundo préstamo a integral y es miembro de la categoría “A” por pagar sus crédito a tiempo. La razón por la cuál solícita este segundo préstamo, es para poder comprar mas concentrado para alimentar a los pollos y de esta misma forma poder comprar otros insumos para dicha actividad. Puesto que ella y su pareja son los únicos que trabajan para poder mantener las necesidades básicas como alimentación y estudios de su familia, necesitan nuevos ingresos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Leticia G. P. is 26 years old. She has a partner and she has four underage children. She lives in Cojutepeque, department of Cuscatlan, in El Salvador. She has a good activity in her work, fattening chickens in order to sell them in the four wagons that she has that have all the infrastructure needed for this sort of work. Ana Leticia is asking for her second, integral loan, and is a member of the category “A” for repaying her credit on time. The reason for asking for this second loan is to be able to buy more concentrate to feed her chickens and in this manner be able to buy other ingredients for her activity. She and her partner are the only people who work to be able to supply the basic necessity like food and education for her family; they need new income for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy concentrate and other ingredients for chicken feed

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Hudoydod

texts.ru: Ашуров Худойдод проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 26 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже два года полностью занимается животноводством. Разводит КРС и реализует на рынке. Бизнес приносит доход. Но сейчас у клиента возникла проблема с кормом , поэтому он решил получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить комбикорм. Это даст возможность до весны обеспечивать своих животных.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hudoydod A. lives in the Gissar district. He is 26 years old, married, and has four children. For the past two years he has worked solely in animal husbandry. He raises cattle and sells them at the market. The business brings him an income. A problem has arisen, however, with feed, so he decided to request a loan in order to buy a pre-mixed complete feed. This will enable him to feed his animals until spring. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a complete feed

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 22-year-old engaged man who lives in the Bekaa. Mohamad has been working in agriculture. He plants potatoes, tomatoes, wheat and other vegetables. He also sells milk.

Mohamad requested a loan of $1500 US Dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase livestock. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mohamad first started his business, he had difficulty building networks. Mohamad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
el Sr. Francisco G. se dedica al comercio el vende leña y tambien se dedica a la caficultura pero su fuerte es la venta de leña, el tiene 5 años de vender leña, es casado y tiene 2 hijos que depende de el, con los ingresos que tiene el logra sacar adelante a su familia dandoles estudio, alimentacion y medicamentos.
en la zona en donde vive el Sr. G. es una zona boscosa de un clima fresco, la venta de leña en estos lugares es muy comun ya que se necesita para el uso domestico para la cocion de alimentos y de uso industrial para hornos de panaderias y secadoras de cafe, el necesita comprar mas leña para tener mejores ganancias y asi poder darles todos a sus hijos que es lo mas hermoso que el tiene en la vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco G. sells firewood. He also grows coffee beans, but his main business is the sale of firewood. He has been doing that for 5 years. He is married with 2 children who depend on him. With his income, he has been able to help his family by paying for their food, school expenses and medical expenses. The area in which Mr. G. lives is a place with a cool climate and many forests. The sale of firewood in this place is very common because it is needed for both domestic and industrial use. He needs to buy more wood so he can increase his profits and thus provide better for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing firewood

loans.name: Bahavodinqul

texts.ru: Бахаводинкул Юсупов  житель города Яван. Возраст 50 лет.Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Занимается животноводством. Имеет дойную корову. Планирует получить кредит и закупить несколько голов овец и коз. При хорошем уходе эти животные смогут дать хорошую прибыль. А так же он сможет обеспечить рынок полноценным мясом.
texts.en:
Bahavodinqul U. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 50 years old, is married and has six children. He raises livestock. He has a dairy cow. Bahavodinqul plans to get credit and to purchase several sheep and goats. If well taken care of, these animals will be able to give him a good profit. He will also be able to provide the market with quality meat.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increaese livestock count

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: La Sra Ana Lidia C. se dedica desde hace 5 años al negocio de venta de variedades, este negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales dependen al 100% de ella, teniendo su negocio en su casa de habitacion no descuida a sus hijos, su esposo en estos momentos le esta ayudando con la atencion de los clientes en su negocio ya que anteriormente laboraba para una fabrica de puros pero lo despidieron y no ha podido conseguir trabajo, el sale de manera ambulante a vender el producto de la tienda a varios lugares cercanos de la ciudad de Danli, con las ganancias que obtienen de las ventas del negocio logran cubrir con una gran parte todos los gastos del hogar, ella necesita mas capital para poder comprar en la frontera con nicaragua mas producto ya que ahi es mas barato y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Lidia C. has worked for 5 years in the sales of various items. She runs this business from her home. She is married and has four children that depend 100% on her. By having her business in her home, she does not neglect her children. At times, her husband helps attend to customers since his previous job at a cigar factory laid him off and he has since not been able to find work. He goes out to work for the store as a traveling salesman in various locations near the city of Danli. With the earnings from the business’s sales, they are able to cover a large part of the household costs. She needs more capital to be able to buy more products for cheaper prices on the Nicaraguan border and, in this way, have better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shirts, shoes, women's wallets, gift bouquets, pants, earrings, and hangers

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo a travéz de la Sra. Valentina C., quien se entero del programa Comité de Mujeres de Fundacion Paraguaya y le gusto mucho, invitando a sus vecinas y amigas del Asentamiento Org. Nuevo Horizonte para trabajar juntas y poder progresar. Ellas se llevan muy bien, son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, venta de frutas, modista, realizan bordados, elaboran panificados, tienen despensa, etc. y reciben de crédito en un promedio de Gs. 515.384.

Las integrantes y sus actividades son: 

1	Valentina C..	Venta de comidas.
2	Blanca E..  Venta de comidas.
3	Rumilda V..	Venta de Zapatos.
4	Zully R..	Bordados.
5	Claudelina R..	Venta de comidas.
6	Cerena O..	Despensa.
7	Eva F..	Venta de Verduras.
8	Jorgelina C..	Venta de comidas.

10	Ana S..	Almacen.
11	Hildalicia M..	Venta de ropas.
12	Zara V..	Manicurista.
13	Zulma M..	Venta de ropa.
14	Nadia F.. 	Venta de lenceria.
15	Nelida E..	Despensa
16	Emilce F..	Venta de mandioca
17	Maria L..	Venta Verduras.
18	Zulma E..	Venta de comidas.
19	Teodora B..	Almacen.
20	Brigida B..	Venta de comidas.
21	Lidia López.	Venta de panificado.
22	Rosana G..	Modista.
23	Liza F..	Venta de Frutas.
24	Maria A..	Kiosko.
25	Leonora B..	Modista.
26	Maria S..	Venta de comidas.
texts.en:
This group was formed by Valentina C., who entered the women's committee program with Kiva partner Fundacion Paraguaya and liked it a lot, and invited her friends and neighbors to form the New Horizons group to work together and make progress. The women have been doing very well. They all do different jobs such as selling clothing, selling food, selling fruit, dressmaking, embroidering, baking, running a general store, etc. Each will receive an average loan of Gs. 515.38.

The members and their occupations are:

1. Valentina C.: Food sales

2. Blanca E.: Food sales

3. Rumilda V.: Shoe sales

4. Zully R.: Embroidery

5. Claudelina R.: Food sales

6. Cerena O.: Convenience store

7. Eva F.: Vegetables sales

8. Jorgelina C.: Food sales

9. Leopoldina O.: Vegetables sales

10. Ana S.: Wholesaler

11. Hildalicia M.: Clothing sales

12. Zara V.: Manicurist

13. Zulma M.: Clothing sales

14. Nadia F.: Lingerie sales

15. Nelida E.: Convenience store

16. Emilce F.: Cassava sales

17. Maria L.: Vegetable sales

18. Zulma E.: Food sales

19. Teodora B.: Wholesaler

20. Brigida B.: Food sales

21. Lidia López: Bakery

22. Rosana G.: Dressmaking

23. Liza F.: Fruit sales

24. Maria A.: Kiosk

25. Leonora B.: Dressmaking

26. Maria S.: Food sales

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, eggs, noodles, snacks; meat; cassava; baking powder; jeans, T-shirts, skirts, shirts; fabrics; lingerie; jewelry; soft drinks; and vegetables.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: seynabou N. habite camberene,elle est parent beneficiaire ,elle est couturiere depuis plus de dix ans.son objectif consiste aacheter des tissus en vue de les confectionner pour apres les exposer a la vente.cette femme veut augmenter ses revenus pour mieux assister  sa famille.
texts.en:
Seynabou N. lives in Camberene. She is a parent and a member of the credit union and has been a seamstress for more than 10 years. Her goal is to buy cloth to sew into garments to display and sell. This woman wishes to increase her income to better help her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Arelis Yesenia

texts.es: Arelis Yessenia C. López tiene la edad de 26 años, es madre soltera. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de especies, por lo que su familia sobrevivía de este negocio, para proporcionar el alimento diario, pero Arelis tenía problemas para cuidar a su Mama,  ya que tenía problemas de salud y esto le ocasionaba mucho cansancio ya que algunas veces no dormía por estar al pendiente con su Mama cuidándola, y la Mañana siguiente tenía que levantarse más temprano para atender el negocio. Por lo que más tarde decide comenzar con la venta de banano, y al ver los ingresos decide seguir adelante con su trabajo. Es por eso que el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de más bananos. El sueño de Arelis es construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Arelis Yessenia C. López is 26 years old and is a single mother. She sells general merchandise and has been doing so for more than 11 years. Previously, she sold spices to provide daily food to her family, who survived on this business. However, Arelis had trouble caring for her mother because of her mother’s health problems. This caused Arelis to be very tired because sometimes she didn’t sleep because she was keeping an eye on her mother. Then, the next morning, she would have to get up early to attend to the business. As a result, Arelis decided to begin selling bananas and decided to continue with this job after seeing the income. It is because of this that Arelis is asking for a loan for working capital to buy more bananas. Arelis’s dream is to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Natalka

texts.en:
Natalka runs a small business selling sweets and bakery items in the central marketplace of Korolyovo, Western Ukraine. Natalka is married and has two kids. She has been in this business for seven years. Presently, she has about 45,000 hryven' in inventory. Her gross income is about 15,000 hryven'.

Natalka is requesting a loan of 13,000 hryven' to increase her turnover capital. Her business has always been characterized by consistent growth and stability. We believe the current loan will help Natalka keep her standing in these challenging economic times. Moreover, additional funding will assist her in her endeavors to open a second vending facility, which has been one of her long-term plans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C. is from the village of Tungawa, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a 51-year-old widow and mother of three adult children. To make a living, Remedios operates a general store selling soft drinks and daily use products.   She has been in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Remedios recently joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios is requesting her first GDMPC loan, for 5000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Edwine

texts.en:
Edwine O. is 24 years old and married to Mwajuma. They have one school-going child. He has been in the auto-repair business for the last five years in Naivasha town.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be his first loan with the organization. He is planning to buy a buffing machine for use in the garage as he has noticed that this is a service that can give him a competitive edge.

In the future, Edwin wants to open up his own garage since he is currently employed.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buying a buffing machine

loans.name: Isis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Isis esta integrado por Martha Elizabeth Rodriguez Solis, Jenny Gertrudis M. R., Brenda del Socorro A. B. y Karen Esperanza G.. La coordinadora del grupo es Martha Elizabeth  R. S. de 29 años ella vende ropa, hace repostería y queques y desea invertir en la compra nueva mercadería y zapatos. 

Las otras tres integrantes son Jenny Gertrudis M. R. quien vende de manera ambulante ropa, zapatos y perfumes, Brenda del Socorro A. también comercializa con estos productos y Karen Esperanza G. vende cristalería, zapatos y ropa.

loans.use: para abquirir nueva mercacia en ropa y productos para la reposteria como harina, leche, huevo...etc

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is 43 years old. She is a widow and takes care of six children aged 10 through 20. She lives in Nyarugenge district, in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Rose has owned a small shop selling clothing and sewing items since 2006. She works alone in the store during the hours it is open: from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. each day.

Rose is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing additional materials and clothes for sale and, hopefully, to make a greater monthly profit.

loans.use: To buy additional materials and clothes

loans.name: Valentin Cesar

texts.es: Valentín tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, tiene casa propia radica en ella desde hace 38 años, cuenta con 2 hijos. La actividad económica de Valentín se encuentra, en una feria que se ubica en el centro de la ciudad, Valentín cuenta con 19 años de experiencia en la comercialización de papa chuño y tunta. Su competencia es media, ya que el negocio se encuentra en un lugar estratégico que cuenta con demanda de clientes. El crédito fue para la compra de mercadería al por mayor papa, chuño y tunta. No tiene antecedentes negativos en ninguna de las centrales de riesgos.
texts.en:
Valentín is 38 years-old, married with two children, and has his own house which he has lived in for 38 years. Valentín's business is located in the central market of the city. Valentín has 19 years of experience selling potatoes, potato flour and dried potatoes. He has an average amount of competition as his business is located in a strategic location and has a strong demand from customers. The funds from this loan are for the purchase of potatoes, potato flour, and dried potatoes wholesale. He has no negative marks on his credit in any of the banking risk offices.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of merchandise (potatoes, potato flour, dried potatoes)

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina M. is from the village of Zone 4, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old. Elina is married and has one child in school.

To make a living, Elina runs a variety (sari-sari) store. Her main source of income comes from selling different products to the local community. Elina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elina joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elina successfully repaid her first loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. Elina is requesting her second loan of 8000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Camila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 58 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.

Camila, anteriormente trabajaba en Essalud, dejo de ejércelo por motivos familiares. Posteriormente, con la seguridad y optimismo que siempre le ha caracterizado, por iniciativa propia implemento su propio negocio de venta de refrigeR., ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Lleva 08 años, en el negocio y esta muy contenta con lo logrado, ya que le va muy bien.

En la actualidad, cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, siendo sus principales clientes moradores y amigos conocidos, que ya conocen el tipo de actividad que realiza,  que a diario acuden a su puesto, donde ella los atiende con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará: paquetes de galletas en diferentes sabores, kekes, chifles en docenas, chocolates como: cañonazos, sublimes,  para aumentar sus productos y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.  Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de frutas, para la preparación de sus jugos.

Camila, esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Camila belongs to the El Tiempo es Oro Communal Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 58, married, and has three children. One child is still dependent upon her. Camila previously worked for Essalud. She left for family reasons. Later, with the confidence and optimism that has always characterized her, and on her own initiative, she started her own business selling refreshments. Her business is located in the Mercado Central of her district. Her place is very well equipped to take care of her customers. She has been in this business for eight years, and she is very happy with what she has achieved. It is going very well for her. She currently has loyal customers. Her primary customers are local inhabitants and friends. They know the type of job she does, and they go to her place daily. She waits on them with her characteristic charm and friendliness. She will use this loan for 2,500 PEN to buy packets of different flavored crackers, “kekes” (typical Peruvian pastry), dozens of “chifles” (fried plantain chips), and various chocolates to increase her products and give her customers better service. She will use part of the money to buy fruit to prepare juice. Camila is prepared for everything, and she still feels that she has lots of strength to keep working and get ahead. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make her refreshments

loans.name: Kolamban Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Kolamban sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Bablena, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. 
Ces femmes ont intégré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire et le prêt précédent a  été bien remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, une grande quantité d’habillements, des ustensiles de cuisine, des condiments alimentaires et des articles divers tels que les produits manufacturés etc. 
La plupart des produits sont achetés à Dioïla ou à Bamako et sont revendus dans le village et au marché de Dioïla  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 18.500FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Kolamban group are married women who, in average, are 38 years old and have 4 children. They live with their husbands and children in traditional large families, in the village of Bablena located in the Dioïla Prefecture in the Koulikoro region of Mali. They met because they were neighbors or relatives. These women have signed up with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of prolonging their retail business. They are ready for their second joint loan and the previous one has been fully repaid. With this loan they plan to buy large quantity of clothing, cooking utensils, condiments, food and miscellaneous items such as manufactured goods etc. Most of these products are purchased in Dioïla or in Bamako and are sold back in their home village as well as the market in Dioïla to a clientele of both women and men. They anticipate a monthly profit of 18.500FCFA per person. Profits are partly reinvested in the business and partly used to cover the family daily expenses.

Translated from French by caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail of a variety of products (including clothing)

loans.name: Omolara
