texts.en: Omolara is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She has a business centre where she types and photocopies documents for customers. She would like to have a bigger business centre in the future and wants to sell stationary as well. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. Her husband is a printer and they both contribute to support the family. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000. With this, she will invest the loan in the business by buying material and stationery in bulk to get a better price. She say 'thank you' to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more material and stationary.

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Salvador E. V., labora como supervisor de los higienista en commema mercado Iván Montenegro, ha trabajado con créditos con Ceprodel durante siete  años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los nueve créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.
Esta casado tiene tres hijos a su cargo y estos se encuentran en el colegio.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ladrillos para su vivienda con el fin de darles un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos.
Manuel dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho en el mejoramiento de su  vivienda.
texts.en:
Manuel Salvador E. V. works as supervisor of the custodial staff at the Iván Montenegro commercial market. He has negotiated loans with Ceprodel for seven years and over this time was able to improve the conditions of his home with the nine loans he received.

He is married and responsible for three children, who are all in school.

The loan requested is to purchase bricks for his house, to improve his children's quality of life.

Manuel says that that the loans offered by Ceprodel have greatly helped him in improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansion

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena A. is married and has one child. Helena has received no formal education. Her husband is a cleaner. Helena uses her income to support her husband in the payment of utility bills.

Helena sells gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), powdered cassava (locally called kokonte) and powdered corn at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. In the photo Helena is showing what the powdered cassava looks like.

Helena will use the loan to purchase more gari and maize to process into powder for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more gari and maize to process into powder

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: K. Jeanne est née le 26 Décembre 1962 et est mariée à HONFO Basile, un carreleur. Le couple a cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis 21 ans environs au quartier Finagnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Jeanne assure avec son mari, les différentes charges de la famille. Jeanne  n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs 12 ans, Jeanne vend divers produits (lait, beurre, mayonnaise, moutarde, huile végétale, petits pois, conserves, etc.) au marché Tokplégbé à Cotonou. Parrallèlement à cette activité, Jeanne  vend également des produits de beauté (lait corporels, pommades pour cheveux, huile, etc.). Jeanne s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Jeanne a déjà obtenu un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Jeanne sollicite un deuxième prêts de ALIDé, pour rehausser le niveau de son activité et augmenter le stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Jeanne K. was born December 26, 1962 and is married to Basile HONFO, a tile layer. The couple has five children, who have all had schooling. Jeanne has not been to school herself. The family has been living for the past 21 years in the Finagnon neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Jeanne shares with her husband the various household expenses. For the past 12 years, Jeanne has been selling various food products (milk, butter, mayonnaise, mustard, vegetable oil, peas, canned food, etc.) at the Tokplégbé market in Cotonou. As a side business, Jeanne also sells beauty products (body milk, hair gels, beauty oils, etc.). She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and also from Lomé in Togo. Jeanne has already been granted a loan from ALIDé, which she has fully reimbursed. She is now requesting a second loan to expand her activities, increase her stock supply, and consequently improve customer satisfaction.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various food products (milk, butter, mayonnaise, mustard, vegetable oil, peas), and body milk.

loans.name: Francis Lisibeth

texts.es:
La señora Campo inicia a descremar la leche desde las 4:00 am. Para luego realizar las cuajadas, se traslada desde su comarca donde vive hasta el  mercado de la terminal con el objetivo de ofertar a su clientela la variedad de productos lácteos, finalizando su venta a las 2:00pm que es la hora que ingresa el ultimo vehículo en su comarca donde vive.
Este crédito que solicito es  para  incrementar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera ofertar producto de mejor calidad.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Francis es madre soltera de dos hijas la cual ella trabaja arduamente para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Francis begins separating milk cream at 4:00 am in order to make milk curd. She travels from her home to the terminal market in order to sell a variety of milk products to her customers. She finishes at 2:00 pm, when she boards the last vehicle to her neighborhood. She is asking for this loan in order to increase her working capital and be able to provide better quality products. Francis is a single mother of two girls and works hard to give the best to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Afusat

texts.en:
Afusat is 43 years old, married with 5 children and live in Lagos, Nigeria. She is hard working, believes that women should help their mates and need to support the men in keeping the home. Afusat operates restaurant; she sells drinks and food to make a profit. She has been in the business since 2000. With the profit from the business she could save a little money and assist her husband in running the home. Her husband is a business man and also works hard to meet his financial responsibilities. 

Afusat hopes to expand her business by buying more drinks, food items to sell, she is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Thom

texts.en: Thom T. C., born in 1968, lives in An Ninh, a village in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh with her husband and three children. Thom is a farmer who raises livestock, and she also makes and sells noodles. In 2008, she joined  SEDA to gain access to financial resources, and has always repaid punctually. Thom would now like to borrow 8.288.000 VND (450 USD) to buy more rice to make noodles and invest in her livestock.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make noodles and invest in her livestock.

loans.name: Ham

texts.en:
Ham N., 30, is single and resides with her mother. She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells groceries at home for an income of about USD $2 per day. Her mother is a farmer, earning an income of USD $0.50 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

Ham has requested a loan of USD $700 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva Field Partner in Cambodia. Ham N. is pictured with her mother here.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Segundo Héctor

texts.es:
Segundo Héctor A. H.  tiene 64 años, es casado,  tiene 5 hijos, Bolivia de 31 años, Marithza de 26, Edwin de 24, Joffre de 23 y Mayra de 18 años Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Segundo trabaja en la agricultura  y es su  principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, trigo, cebada,  maíz.   Vende los productos en la comunidad a los comerciantes que van a la zona. 
Segundo solicita el crédito para comprar insumos químicos para sus sembrios.  Su meta es de mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.   Los desafíos que enfrenta es vender todos los productos que se siembra. Segundo en sus tiempos libres les la  consejos de buena conducta a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Segundo is 64 years old, married, and has 5 children - 31 year-old Bolivia, 26 year-old Marithza, 24 year-old Edwin, 23 year-old Joffre, and 18 year-old Mayra. They live in the neighborhood of San Francisco de Rumí Pamba, an hour and a half from Cantón San Miguel in Bolivar province. Segundo is a member of the rural loan group "San Francisco de Rumi Pamba", which is composed of 25 members in total, of whom the majority are farmers. Segundo works in agriculture, and this is the primary source of income for his family. Among the most outstanding crops of his area are potatoes, wheat, barley, and corn. He sells his produce in the community to the traders who are in the area. Segundo is requesting a loan to buy chemical inputs for his crops. His goal is to improve his family's standard of living and to see his children become professionals. One of the challenges that he faces is to sell all the produce that he grows. In his free time he teaches his children to live good lives.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chemical inputs for his crops

loans.name: Women Of Peace Group

texts.en:
Alberteen K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Women Of Peace." She is 50 years old and married, with eight children who range from 16 to 32 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade.

For five years, she has been selling drinks and soap in New Georgia Estate Market, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She started her business with 75 United States dollars her aunt gave her.

She plans to use her 5,000-Liberian-dollar portion of this 25,000-Liberian-dollar group loan to buy more drinks and soap.

Her dream is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and soap

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 41-year-old borrower from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and their four children. Hussein has been working in the sanitary field. He says that he is trustworthy and punctual about his appointments. His clients are people from his region. 

Hussein says that one of his challenges is to purchase new and more sophisticated tools, and that his old tools have been a drawback for him especially with new constructions and architecture. That is why, today, for the first time, Hussein has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools that will be more adapted to his work conditions and will help him improve the quality of work he provides. He hopes for the future, to have the best new tools and become  more competitive with them.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Xesaclac 2 Group

texts.es:
Doña Arcadia A. B., es quien dirige este grupo de señoras,  del paraje Xesaclac, Caserío Jutacaj, de la aldea Xequemeya, Momostenango, doña arcadia se dedica a la venta de leña,  cuenta con 2 hijas y 3 hijos,  cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, ella lo compra con los comerciantes que lo venden a ellas, tiene su punto de venta en el centro del Municipio de Momostenango, departamento de Totonicapán.

Tiene una segunda actividad económica, que es la crianza animales domésticos tales como:  cerdos, ovejas, pollos y vacas,  cuenta con la ayuda de sus esposo que se dedica  a la venta de ropa en el mercado Del municipio de San Pedro Sacatepequez, del departamento de San Marcos, y las  personas  necesitan ampliar sus producción de animales y también de venta de leña  , por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de pologuá, para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias,  ya que es un segundo crédito que ellas solicitan.
texts.en:
Arcadia A. B. manages this group of women from the Xesaclac parrish in the Jutacaj rural community, Xequemeya village, Momostenango. Arcadia sells firewood. She has two daughters and three sons, and they help her. She buys from merchants. She sells at a spot in the center of the Momostenango municipality in the Totonicapán department. She has a second economic activity, which is raising domestic animals like pigs, sheep, chickens, and cows. Her husband helps her. He sells clothes in the market in the San Pedro Sacatepequez municipality in the San Marcos department. The people in the group need to expand their animal production and their firewood sales. That is why they came to the ASDIR Asociación’s offices in Pologuá to be able to finance their economic activities. That way they will be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families. This is the second loan they have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Keomseng's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of nine people, which located in Ampil Teouk village in Kandal province. Mrs. Keomseng C. 35 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by its members. While each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purpose.
Mrs. Keomseng C. is a grocery seller in the local village, which is able to earn a small income to support her family living. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she will use the loan that ask from AMK to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities. Mrs. Keomseng C. is widow with four children, one is a vegetable seller and two are attending in the local school while another one is 3 years old. The persons who are standing behind of the group members are not group loan members.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Shown in the photo are Mrs. S. and her husband, who have spent their life cultivating crops. This is a skill they learned from their grandparents, who died years ago. They have two school-aged children. 

Growing crops is an annual business with which they have had great success over the years. The family is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both the rainy and dry seasons. 

The coming rainfall is good for growing: however, the family doesn’t have enough capital to ensure successful crop growth. Mrs. S. discussed this with her husband and decided to seek assistance through this loan.

loans.use: To ensure successful crop growth

loans.name: Rio Dulce Group

texts.es:
“RIO DULCE” es el nombre de una Asociación Comunal que ya iniciará su tercer ciclo en el Centro Focal de VILLA EXALTACIÓN, como todas las asociaciones,  la asociaicón “RIO DULCE” está guiada por una mesa directiva, compuesta por una presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. 

La señora Lucía Justa, casada, presidenta de la asociación, se dedica a la confección de polleras desde hace tres años.  Realiza esta tarea en su  domicilio, lo que le permite estar al pendiente de su hogar y cuidar a su familia.  Este es su primer ciclo como presidenta y la asociación tiene la confianza de que sea una buena gestión.  El dinero que solicitó de Bs.2000.- será invertido en la compra de tela pues cada pollera requiere de 6 a 7 metros de tela y lo mismo de forro, por lo que su producción requiere de un capital importante, en particular cuando se presentan muchos pedidos.

La asociación comunal esta integrado por ocho mujeres. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: producción de faldas, tejido de chompas, venta de ropa usada, venta de polleras, venta de medicina natural, producción de camas, venta de colchas y edredones.
texts.en:
Rio Dulce” (Sweet River) is the name of community association that is beginning its third cycle with the “Centro Focal de Villa Exaltacion”. Like all organizations, the “Rio Dulce” is guided by a board of directors, which includes a president, a treasurer and a secretary. Mrs. Lucia is married and the president of this organization. She has been making large skirts for the past three years. She does this work at her home. This allows her to be at home and take care of her family. This is her first term as president. The association is confident that it will be a good term for her. The money that she is asking for, Bx2000, will be invested in the purchase of fabric as each skirt requires six to seven meters of fabric and the same amount of lining. The skirt construction requires a lot of capital, especially when she has a lot of orders. The credit association is made up of eight women. They have different businesses such as sewing skirts, knitting sweaters, selling used clothes, selling large skirts, selling natural medicine, constructing beds or selling bedspreads and comforters.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fabric

loans.name: Miriam Nineth

texts.es: La señora Mirian Nineth C., quien ha trabajo su primer credito kiva, esta muy entusiasmada y motivada por la oportunidad que se le dio, ahora que su negocio a crecido, ha cambiado de ubicación de su negocio,  todo la ayudado bastante, porque con el credito anterior surtio mas su mercaderias, en productos novedosos o la amoda, como los clientes necesitan, ella solicita el presente credito para la compra de ropa para  dama, caballero y niño, ademas de eso estos dias incorporo la venta de bolsos de dama, cosmeticos, ropa de bebe, y accesoriros para el hogar, ve que mientras tenga la oportunidad de invertir es mejor porque sus ventas han aumentado, considera que es un nuevo reto para ella, en brindarles mejor servicio a sus clientes, que a ellos se debe la superacion, crecimiento de su  negocio  y tambien a la ayuda que recibe de Kiva. Con lo que ella esta muy agradecida por el apoyo como mujer micro empresaria.
texts.en:
Mirian Nineth C. has requested a loan from Kiva. She is very happy and motivated by the opportunity that has been granted to her. She will expand her business and she will relocate it. With her past loan she improved the variety of her merchandise, including new and trendy items as requested by her clients. She requests this loan to purchase clothing for men, ladies and children and ladies' hand bags, cosmetics, clothing for babis and household accessories. She will continue to invest because her sales have increased. Her new goal is to provide better service to her clients, especially because it was their support and the support Kiva has provided that has helped her business develop. She is very grateful for the support she receives as a small business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of clothing.

loans.name: Angela Celinda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

La señora Celinda es la presidenta del Banco Comunal desde que se inicio,  esta muy contenta ya que dice que le han ayudado mucho.
 
Es viuda y tiene tres hijos, dos ya son mayores de edad y solo la menor vive con ella en la casa de sus suegros. Es maestra en el colegio Albertina Rivas de la localidad.

Tiene una pequeña granja  de pollos los cuales los compra a un criadero de aves y en algunos laboratorios, los cría y después de tres meses los entrega para la venta en algunas tiendas de la localidad, también vende en su casa en pie o por libras, nos cuenta que también vende pollos de dos a tres semanas al por mayor a comerciantes que le llegan a comprar. Trabaja en su granja tres a cuatro horas en la tarde con la ayuda de una persona a la cual le paga un sueldo.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear en comprar mas pollos para el comercio y la cría ya que se viene la Navidad y esa temporada es muy buena.
 
Sus sueños son tener una granja con tecnología
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful scenery and its lovely sweet water baths, which attract many tourists, the members of the Nueva Luz ("New Light") community bank meet every 15 days. Celinda has been the president of the community bank since its inception; she is happy that it has helped her so much. She is a widow with three children, two of whom are adults. The third lives with her in her in-laws' house. She is a teacher at the local Albertina Rivas school. She has a small chicken yard; she buys her birds from a poultry farmer and some laboratories. She raises them and after three months, she takes them to various stores in the area for sale. She also sells them live or by weight from her home. She tells us that she also sells chickens from three to four weeks old and up to traders who come to buy them from her. She works in her yard for three to four hours each afternoon with a person she has hired to help her. She will use this loan to buy more chickens to raise--Christmas is coming, and it's a good time for her business. Her dream is to have a technologically-equipped poultry yard.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Melonie

texts.en:
Melonie T. is from the city of Carmen Anex, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Melonie owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products such as coffee, shampoo, cooking oil, eggs and others in the local community. Melonie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Melonie joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Melonie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chhung

texts.en: Chhung M. is 42 years old and mother to five children. Four are single and the other is married and has already started a new family. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who has spent almost his whole life in motor taxi service. In the beginning of 2005, Chhung M. built a small store in Phnom Penh City. In her shop, she sells a few snack products, fast foods, sweets and grocery items to people near her store and those who pass by. Unfortunately, her husband’s motor has often broken down. Because of this problem, Chhung M. would like a loan to buy a used motor to replace the broken one and to buy a cart for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a used motor to replace the broken one and a cart for her husband.

loans.name: Ernesto José

texts.es:
EL Sr. Ernesto José P. es una persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio en el mercado Israel Lewite de Managua de venta de accesorios para celulares, reloj, el trabaja de lunes a sábado de las 7 de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, el es padre de familia de cuarto hijos y solo dos dependen de el y estos se encuentran en el colegio.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como: fajas, baterías para reloj, cargadores y chip claro y movistar.
Ernesto dice que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel su negocio ha crecido y ahora puede competir con la competencia.
texts.en: Ernesto José P. is an entrepreneurial person who has his business located at the Israel Lewite market in Managua.  He sells cell phone accessories and watch parts.  He works Monday through Saturday from 7 am to 5 pm.  He is the father of four children; only two are of school age and dependent on him.  The loan requested is to purchase merchandise for his business such as:  watch bands and batteries, cell phone chargers and memory chips.  Ernesto says that, thanks to the loans he has received through CEPRODEL, his business has grown and he can better compete.

loans.use: To purchase watch bands and batteries, cell phone chargers and memory chips.

loans.name: Absa Abass

texts.fr: Madame Absa Abass T. est une couturière qui confectionne des boubous, des habillements pour homme et femme destinés àn la revente. Elle est dans ce metier depuis quelques temps et sollicite ce crédit pour l'acquisition d'une nouvelle machine à coudre qui va lui permettre d'avoir une capacité à produire un maximum de commande et de générer des bénéfices
texts.en: Madame Absa Abass T. is a seamstress who makes boubous, wholesale clothes for men and women.  She has been involved in this field for a while and is seeking a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine which will boost her output and enable her to generate higher profits.

loans.use: Purchasing sewing machines

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees. 

For over 40 years, she has operated a tailoring business from home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Charlotte faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials for her tailoring shop. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth materials for her tailoring shop

loans.name: St.noah Development Group

texts.en:
Boneface is a 22-year-old married man with one child. He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo Uganda. He wishes to have all the required gadgets for his barber shop and run a successful shop and educate his children so that they can have a better future.
 
Boneface wants a loan to buy shaving machines. 

Boneface is a member of St. Noah Development group, in which each member guarantees the other for access to credit.

loans.use: Buying shaving machines

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es: Aura Lila B. Delgado es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de bisuteria negocio que inicio ayudando le a su madre y luego empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. Ella tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos están a su cargo y le ayudan en el negocio después de clases.
texts.en:
Aura Lila B. Delgado is a hard-working woman.  She is dedicated and enterprising.  She has a costume jewelry business.  She started out helping her mother.  Later, she started working for herself.  

She has four children under her care.  They help her with the business after classes.

loans.use: Costume jewelry

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch P., age 58, sells new clothes next to a garment factory. In addition to selling clothes, she also plants rice crop on her own farmland. She has a life partner in her husband, who works as a teacher in the village. They are blessed with six children, two are single, and the other four are married and employed in different careers.  

Touch P. has recently sold nearly all her inventory.  She wants to replenish her stock but lacks capital. She is therefore asking for a loan in order to buy more clothes to resell. She hopes to use the remainder of the loan to buy a motor vehicle (Tuk Tuk) for one of her children, who still has no job. 

Touch P. is pictured with her husband in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Jose Rodolfo

texts.es:
El Senor Jose V., es habitante de la comarca El Coyolito, del Municipio La Concordia, de Esteli; casado, no tiene hijos. A pesar de que las condiciones economicas no eran buenas, el hizo un sacrificio muy especial y logro llegar a 2 ano de secundaria.
Inicion desde muy pequeno, ayudando a su Papa, Don Rodolfo V., quien sembraba Repollo, Cebolla, el era ayudante de su papa en estas actividades y aprendio mucho, a pesar de que tambien debia estudiar.
Empezo a independizarse a los 18 anos, sembrando en sociedad 1 manzana de Repollo, y en esa epoca hubo perdida en las cosechas, pero el al menos logro sacar lo que habia invertido; pero esto no lo hizo darse por vencido, entonces volvio a sembrar repollo, y esta vez si logro obtener ganancias de U$ 1,000.00; claro que lo tenia que dividir entre su socio y el.
Luego decidio trabajar con un hermano y alquilaban un terreno a su abuelita, para trabajar con la familia; tambien se dedica al engorde Ganado, que ha ido comprando con las ganancias que le ha generado la siembra de Repollo y de Tomate.
Actualmente realizo el credito para el mantenimiento de 1 manzana de Tomates; espera obtener buenas ganancias de esta cosecha.
Entre sus planes esta comprar su propio terreno y comprar mas ganado.
texts.en:
Jose V. lives in El Coyolito region, in La Concordia, in Esteli.  He is married but does not have any children.  In spite of the fact that his economic means were not good, he made a very special effort and managed to reach his second year of high school.  José started out in farming by helping his dad, Rodolfo Valvidia, when he was very young.  His dad used to grow cabbages and onions.  José learned a lot in spite of the fact that he also had to study.

José started working independently at the age of 18, sowing just over 3 acres of cabbages together with a partner.  Back then he made some losses in his harvests but he at least managed to recoup what he had invested.  He didn't give up, however, but planted cabbages again.  This time he managed to make $1,000 US profit though, of course, he had to split the money between himself and his business partner.

José then decided to work with one of his brothers and they rented a plot of land from their grandmother so that they could work with the family.  José also raises livestock which he has been buying with the profits that he has made from his cabbage and tomato crops.

José has requested this loan to maintain nearly 3 acres of tomato crops.  He hopes to make good profits from this harvest.  In the future, he plans to buy his own plot of land and to buy more livestock.

loans.use: To sow tomatoes

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a married man with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

Henry has been operating a french fries selling business for the past two years, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. Henry faces a major challenge in the price fluctuation of potatoes in the market. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

With the loan for 40,000 Kshs, Henry wants to purchase sacks of potatoes to make french fries for sale. He decided to join Yehu because of its good variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes to make french fries for sale

loans.name: Ikhtiyor

texts.en:
Ikhtiyor is married and has 4 children. His passion has always been woodwork. He learned the skill when he was a young. Since then, he's been experimenting and learning new things. With the experience he has gained in the process, he was been able to start his own small business manufacturing doors and windows about 11 years ago. Ikhtiyor has an individual approach to each client. He always tries to please his customers, even when they have very sophisticated taste. Ikhtiyor doesn't have to face high competition. However, he always aims at high quality and wants to have all his clients pleased with the result of his work. 

Ikhtiyor is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase additional raw materials to be able to provide his customers with even better quality and trendy furniture pieces. Ikhtiyor always has had much demand for his products as there are constantly new offices and stores being built. 
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of necessary materials for his manufacturing needs.

loans.name: Elvia Natalia

texts.es:
Elvia tiene 25 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Viven en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande , una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos como agua o luz.

Desde hace más de tres años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado porcino y aves de corral. Realiza esta actividad en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos para criar a sus animales. Cuando estos han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende al público general en el mercado local o los usa para alimentar a su familia. Con sus ingresos, puede ayudar a su esposo, quien se dedica a la producción de mangos, solventar los gastos familiares.

Desea usar su crédito para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales, con la finalidad de obtener más tamaño y peso en menos tiempo y poder venderlos por mejor precio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles. Elvia es muy trabajadora y aprecia el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Elvia is 25 years old, married and has two children.  She lives in her own home in the rural area of the Tambogrande District.  This is an agricultural area in the province of Piura which is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  For now there are no basic utilities such as running water or electricity in this area.

For over three years she has been raising and selling pig livestock and chickens.  Her activity is set up in her backyard where she has spacious stables to raise her animals.  When they are fully grown and ready for market she sells them to the general public.  She also uses them to feed her family.  With her income she helps her husband, a mango producer, cover the household expenses.

She plans to use the loan to purchase balanced feed for her livestock so they can grow to full development in less time.  She will also be able to sell them at a better price.  This is what convinced her to request a loan in the amount of 600 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.  Elvia is a hard worker and appreciates the loan she is receiving from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase balanced livestock feed

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 54 years old and widowed with six children. One of the children is in school. Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock for her sari-sari store.

Mercedita has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, shampoo, toothpaste, soap, bread, sugar, juice, candies, etc. Mercedita also earns income from a ready to wear business.

In the future, Mercedita would like to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Kainh

texts.en:
Kainh is 40 years old and married with six children between the ages of 11 and 23. She lives in Jacob’s Town Community. Her husband is currently out of a job and she has only one means of getting income, selling clothing in the local market. She has a lot of customers and she plans to increase her business.

Kainh is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing to sell, and she hopes to purchase a piece of land and build her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Yinne Amarilis

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yinne, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 21, 18 y 8 años de edad, los mayores son independientes y la menor que vive con ella estudia en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana aprovechando las mañanas cuando su hija está en la escuela para realizar sus ventas ya que en las tardes se dedica a ayudarla en sus tareas escolares, lo que más vende son los perfumes. Nos cuenta que lleva 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son muy útiles para financiarse.
 
Su sueño es tener su local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The members of the Light of America Cooperative Bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarinds.

Here is where we find Yinne, 39 years of age, who is married and has three children ages 21, 18, and 8.  The older ones are now grown and independent; the youngest lives with her and is in school.  Her husband is in construction.

She dedicates herself to selling Avon, Esika and Yanbal catalog products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories).  She sells door-to-door, working three days per week, taking advantage of the mornings when her daughter is in school to sell.  In the afternoons, she dedicates herself to helping her with her homework.  What she sells the most of is perfumes.  She tells us she’s been in this business for 8 years.

She is going to use this loan to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and creams.  She has been a member of the cooperative bank for three years, and enjoys it because the loans have been very useful for her business.

Her dream is to have her own locale from which to sell her products.

loans.use: buy perfumes, creams, jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Florecitas De Villa Hermosa Group

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia  es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos y tiene 51 años D. edad, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Florecitas D. Villa Hermosa” grupo  conformado por 7  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Virginia   trabaja desD. hace 10  años en la venta D. productos D. belleza, Virginia nos cuenta que empezó este trabajo vendiendo a domicilio poco a poco,  con el tiempo adquirió un capital D. dinero  y puso en su casa un bazar donD. venD. productos D.  belleza D. todas las marcas, gracias a su esfuerzo  y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos van a una buena escuela y sobre todo tienen una mejor calidad D. vida. El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería.  Sabemos que Virginia  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Virginia, age 51, lives with her partner and has three children. She is currently a member of the communal bank “Florecitas D. Villa Hermosa” -- a group that consists of seven individuals who are engaged in different commercial activities. 

For ten years, Virginia has been making a living by selling beauty care products. She started this business by first selling door-to-door in small quantities and with time was able to save up some capital that allowed her to set up a storefront in her home where she now sells a variety of beauty care products of different brands. Thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has been able to improve her income, and now her children go to a good school, and, most importantly, have a better quality of life. Virginia will use the loan to buy merchandise for her business. She will work hard to achieve her goals and this loan from Edaprospo will help her in this effort.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Confiando En Dios Group

texts.en:
Ermancia is the coordinator of her group Confiando en cristo (Trusting in Christ) 1 and 2. Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their six children.

Ermancia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She runs a stall, where she sells charcoal, fruit, and vegetables. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business.

She said that her most difficult challenge has been to live in a foreign country with her family, and to give a good education to her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is 32 years old and married with five school-aged children. She is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. To make a living, Rovelyn owns and operates a service-based business. Her main source of income comes from providing barbershop services in the local community. Rovelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Rovelyn joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rovelyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase hairdo accessories and materials she needs to provide better service. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Rovelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and materials for her barbershop

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
 
Gemalyn sells local delicacies such as suman and biko, which are both types of rice cakes.  She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gemalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Chekmach

texts.en:
Chekmach is a farmer and lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with three daughters. Two have full-time employment and another one stays at home. 

Chekmach is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her daughters to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughters to drive to work.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a bakery business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, butter, baking powder, potatoes and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, butter, baking powder, potatoes and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Kelly Gisella

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Junio.

En este lugar vive la Señora Kelly, tiene 24 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de los padres. Estudia Auditoria en la Universidad aunque ya tiene un titulo de Lic. En Idiomas.

Nuestra amiga es maestra en una Unidad educativa pero también se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en ambas actividades ya que ella aprovecha para vender sus productos en la escuela en la que trabaja y en la universidad donde estudia, lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido bastante bien.  Lo que más vende son los maquillajes.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Lleva dos ciclos en el  Banco comunal, antes estaba en otro pero como este quedaba más cerca de su casa se cambio y le gusta cómo trabajan en la institución. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y conseguir un nombramiento de maestra.
texts.en: The communal lender "5 de Junio" meets twice a month in the colonial city of Portoviejo.  Kelly is 24, single and lives with her parents in this city.  She is studying auditing in the university, and holds a degree in languages.  Kelly teaches in a school and also sells Avon products  (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works every day and sells products both on the school and university campuses, and has done so for the past two years, with great success in selling cosmetics.  Kelly seeks this credit to buy an inventory of perfumes, skin creams, cosmetics and accessories and hopes to grow her business as well as attain success as a teacher.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, skin cremes, cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 25 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Stella has a small retail shop that sells soap and sugar, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Stella hopes to expand her business. Stella is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina helps support her family financially by operating a small clinic at her home. She treats women specifically. She is also a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring area clients to earn extra profits.

Her husband operates a business selling wheat. He purchases wheat from different farmers and sells to customers for a profit. 

Robina is the mother of three sons: the eldest one works in a factory while the other two are studying. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband because he wants to buy wheat in bulk. That will allow him to fill the orders of his customers and improve his profits. 

Robina hopes that an investment will be a profitable one for him and it will improve the living standard of her family as a result.

loans.use: To buy wheat for selling.

loans.name: Briceida Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Briseida, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen un bebé de seis  meses de nacido. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Ella en sociedad con su mamá tienen un restaurante en el cual venden desayunos,  almuerzos y platos a la carta, nos cuenta que la mayoría de sus clientes prefieren los mariscos pero  ellas tienen de todo para satisfacer a sus clientes ya que esto es su mejor carta de presentación, trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 16h00 y llevan 8 años con su negocio y  les ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado, mariscos y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal cinco años, es la fiscal de pagos del banco  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y responsable.

Su sueño es tener otro restaurante pero para ella sola.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the '1 de Diciembre' community bank meet in the seaside resort of San Clemente.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited by lots of domestic and international tourists.  The area offers a variety of beautiful places to visit and a rich variety of dishes which are typical of the region.

Here we meet Briselda who is 26 years old, married, and has a 6-month-old baby from her relationship.  Her husband is a security guard.

Briselda, in partnership with her mom, has a restaurant in which she sells breakfasts, lunches and à la carte dishes.  She tells us that most of her customers order seafood but they offer a bit of everything in order to keep their customers happy as this is their best letter of introduction.  They work every day from 5.00am to 4.00pm.  They have been in this business for eight years and it has done very well.

Briselda will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, seafood and other food products for preparing her meals.  She has been a member of her community bank for five years.  She is in charge of overseeing payments and she enjoys this role because her group is very united and responsible.

Briselda's dream is to own another restaurant of which she is the sole owner.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, seafood and other food products

loans.name: Ichinnorov

texts.en:
Ichinnorov is 57 years old and lives with her husband in a 'ger', a Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband is on disability pension. She used to work as a tailor at the local fashion center from 1978 to 1998. She retired from the work after 20 years and then established her own business. 

Currently she is working at her home and making clothes. She has many regular customers. She is planning to have a workplace to expand her business operation. She is an open-minded and diligent woman who says "It is getting difficult to sew clothes at home. If I had my own workplace, it would be easy to attract more customers and make more clothes." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to expand her business operation and to rent a workplace.

loans.use: To rent a workplace.

loans.name: Denis Antonio

texts.es:
Denis Antonio tiene su propio hogar en el municipio de El Sauce conformado por sus tres hijos y su esposa. Él  se desempeña como maestro de educación primaria en una escuela del casco rural donde a diario con mucho ahínco se dirige al colegio para enseñar cada día a los niños las diferentes materias para su desarrollo intelectual.

El crédito por el cual acude a Ceprodel será utilizado para pagar algunos gastos propios universitarios y compra de una computadora portátil para su hijo con el fin de llegar a formarlo profesionalmente y contar con esta poderosa herramienta para el estudio. Espera que el crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para cumplir el propósito por el cual lo solicita.
texts.en:
Denis Antonio’s home in the town of El Sauce is composed of his three children and his wife.  He works as an elementary school teacher in a rural school where he heads out to daily with much dedication to teach various subjects to children for their intellectual development.

The loan he’s asking Ceprodel for will be used to pay some personal university expenses and to buy a laptop computer for his son so that he will have this powerful study aid to help him with his professional preparation.  He hopes that the loan will be granted satisfactorily to reach the goal for which it’s been requested.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Lourdes Narcisa

texts.es:
Lourdes de 51 años, es una mujer independiente, responsable en su trabajo y más que todo respetuosa.
Es una empleada domestica, su actividad la realiza sola.

La dificultad de ella es cuando le da gripe, los dueños de casa no le permiten trabajar a ella cuando tiene gripe. Tiene una relación de unión libre, su conjugue es taxista.

Ella solicita el préstamo para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. Su sueño es terminar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lourdes, age 51, is an independent woman who is responsible in her work. Above all, she is respectful. She works as a housekeeper, a job that she performs alone.

One difficulty that she must deal with is whenever she comes down with the flu. Her employer will not allow her to work when she is sick. Lourdes is in a common-law relationship and her partner is a taxi driver.

She is requesting a home improvement loan. Her dream is to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy paint, cement, and sand for completing the construction of her house.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is 21 years old with two small children. She is managing a shop that sells ceramic products such as bowls, plates, spoons etc.  Her business started in 2009, one year after accessing a loan. Her business creates a very stable income for her. Regarding her repayment situation, she is always  a good re-payer. Currently, she wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy more kinds of new products to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more ceramic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy security equipment to install on his windows.

loans.name: Tansagbayandalai

texts.en: Mr. Tansagbayandalai, age 34, is a security serviceman and runs a grocery store beyond his job. He has been running his store just for a half year. He lives with his wife and his three children in Kherlen, a western boundary town in Mongolia. He has a sister who has played chess since childhood. Soon she will have the State Chess Match in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. This is a very important for herself. However, there are some financial challenges concerning expenses related to the match. Her brother Tansagbayandalai is planning to pay the expenses related her chess match from his business earning through the increasing next months income. Therefore the loan he is requesting will be dedicated to purchase the more food commodities from his suppliers for raise his store working capital. According his plan, sales of his store will be increased after the raised working capital.

loans.use: To purchase the more food commodities from his suppliers for raise his store working capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 43 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Luz prepares and sells cassava flakes with sugar melt. She has had this business for five years. 

Luz is requesting a loan for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Luz has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. 

Juvy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Juvy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juvy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.ru: Гулсуной замужем и мать троих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Её трудолюбие помогло ей, открыть свой собственный бизнес и стать успешным предпринимателем. Она  занимается купле- продажей женской, детской и мужской одежды. Более 10 лет она кредитуется в «ИМОН Интернешнл» и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. С помощью ранних займов она расширила бизнес, и на данный момент имеет три точки на рынке «Панчшанбе». Гулсуной хотела получить займ для покупки дополнительного товара с целью увлечения оборотного капитала. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Gulsunoy is married and is a mother of three children.  She is a very hardworking and goal-oriented woman.  Her love of hard work helped her to open her own business and become a successful entrepreneur.  Gulsunoy is involved in buying and selling women's, children's and men's clothing.  She has been obtaining financing from "Imon International" for over ten years and has a good credit history.  She expanded her business with the help of earlier loans and currently has three retail outlets at the "Panchshanbe" market.  Gulsunoy wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of additional merchandise in order to increase working capital.  She is grateful to you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She started in 2010 working from her house. She started selling perfumes and cosmetics. Caroline is a hardworking woman, and she insists on helping her husband earn their living.

To do so, Caroline worked hard to expand her selling and to increase her customers to the extent that she is now requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to open a shop to start her wider business in it. Most of her customers are relatives, friends and neighbors. The shop will help in attracting new customers and increasing her income.

She hopes to expand her business more and more in the future through starting wholesale trade.

loans.use: To open a perfume and cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. She is married and sells ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines.

Janet requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell. Janet has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Benkadi 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Sirakele, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec Safoula, 2 eme debout en mouchoir orange.  
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants, de petits matériels agricoles et  de semence

loans.name: Aboeminachi Edith

texts.fr: Aboeminachi Edith âgée de 33 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis dix huit ans. Aboeminachi Edith est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Ignance. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Aboeminachi Edith vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Aboeminachi Edith vend de façon secondaire, des produis cosmétiques, des friperies et des mèches ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Aboeminachi Edith s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Aboeminachi Edith sollicite une deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des produis cosmétiques, des friperies et des mèches.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema lives in Tandika ,Temeke District of Dar es Salaam.She is married with five children.Rehema sells charcoal in a store located in her family house.She has been in this business for eight years now.She is planning to open another store in the next street.The new store demands additional funding.She will need to add more stock of charcoal,pay for rental fees and employ an assistant.The expansion plan will help Rehema generate extra income as she has to pay school fees for her two sons who are in secondary school.Rehema is in need of USD 550 tofacilitate her plan.

loans.use: BUSINESS EXPANSION

loans.name: Acih

texts.en:
Acih is 35 years old. She makes and sells deep-fried-snacks and juices. She has just restarted her business after securing additional working capital of $50 from MBK. She previously halted her business to deliver her child. She also places her food-merchandise at small mini-marts in her neighborhood. She can book IDR 200.000 revenue with IDR 20.000 profit daily.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Acih berusia 35 tahun. Dia membuat dan menjual gorengan dan es jus. Dia baru memulai usahanya lagi setelah mendapat tambahan modal kerja dari MBK sebesar $50. Sebelumnya dia pernah berhenti berjualan karena anaknya melahirkan. Dia juga menitipkan dagangannya ke warung-warung di sekitar rumahnya. Setiap hari dia bisa mendapatkan penghasilan sebesar Rp. 200.000 dengan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 20.000.

loans.use: To make and sell deep-fried-snacks and juices

loans.name: Nagiba

texts.en: Nageba lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow whose husband died during the war. She is supporting her family and she has good experience as a tailor. She took her 3rd loan cycle to buy new sewing machines. She can support her family well and now she wants to take another loan to open a new shop and buy some equipment that she needs. She is very happy now that she can support her family.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a very responsible woman. She has four children ages 12, 15, 20, and 22 years old. She has thirteen years of sales experience. Eight years ago and due to her husband's separation, she works full-time selling clothes and electric appliances at the markets. She is the main breadwinner of the family. She does it to obtain the income that her family needs and to be able to support her children's education. All that responsibility hasn't been easy on Martha but her family's welfare is her reward.

To make her business grow and increase the selection of products, Martha asks for a $375 dollars loan. She will use it for buying seasonal clothes and electric appliances. She promises to return the loan in 4 months. Help improve this family's life. Martha needs your help a lot so she can help her family move forward. Martha thanks you for the trust and support that you give her.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha es una mujer muy responsable. Tiene cuatro hijos, de 12, 15, 20 y 22 años de edad. Tiene trece años de dedicarse a las ventas. Desde que se dio la separación de su esposo, hace ocho años, se dedica de tiempo completo a la venta de ropa y aparatos eléctricos en los mercados ante la necesidad de obtener los ingresos que su familia requiere y para que sus hijos pudieran continuar estudiando. No ha sido fácil para ella tener tanta responsabilidad pero el bienestar de su familia es su mejor recompensa.

Para hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar la variedad de sus productos Martha solicita un crédito por $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de ropa de temporada y aparatos electrónicos. Ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, Martha necesita mucho de tu ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos y agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her clothing shop.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola lives in an "anticretico" apartment at #52 Tocopilla lane in Bajo Tacagua, La Paz. [An antichretic, or land-pawn, contract is a special rental arrangement common in Bolivia. You can read more about it here: http://www.escapeartist.com/OREQ3/Rent_Free_Bolivia.html--translator] She is married and has a one-year-old son. Her husband works at the botanical gardens. Paola has a shop in her own home where she and two employees make jackets. These are sold in La Paz and other cities. This loan will serve to increase her working capital. Paola is a first-time borrower from IMPRO. We are happy to report that she is a hard worker and her income and that of her husband generate enough cash flow to service this loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Paola vive en anticretico en el pasaje Tocopilla Nº 52 de la zona de Bajo Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene un hijo de un año de edad, el esposo trabaja en el Jardín Botánico. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar capital ya que trabaja en la elaboración de chamarras las cuales reparte en varias ciudades de Bolivia y en La Paz. Tiene su taller en el mismo domicilio y trabaja con dos operarios. Paola es cliente nuevo de IMPRO y vemos con mucha complacencia que es una mujer trabajadora y que sus ingresos y los de su esposo alcanzan para flujo de caja que necesita para acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Working capital for a garment shop.

loans.name: Rogina

texts.en: Mrs. Rogina T. is a housewife who lives in Kulashwor, Kathmandu, in a family of four. She and her husband, Mr. Rabi T., and opened their grocery shop nine years ago. Her daughter and son are studying in primary school. During the month of October, the Nepalese observe two big festivals, Dashain and Tihar. During these festivals people buy many grocery items. This month is a great month for businesses, whether they are big or small. Mrs. Rogina T. is asking for her first loan so that she can invest in more varieties of grocery items in this season to meet the customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for the Dashain and Tihar festivals

loans.name: Mumikatu

texts.en: Munikatu I. is 35 years, married with 4 children. She lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells ice fish. Mumikatu has been in this business since 1999. She needs the loan to buy more fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth is 25 years old and has a little daughter, Margiori, who has become her main reason to improve and succeed. Janeth owns a motorcycle that can be used as a taxi. As it is her main source of income, she would like to improve the motorbike’s standing so she can raise the standard of living of her household.

Let’s grant her petition so that in a short time this young mother can build the transportation company she longs to have.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Janeth de 25 años de edad, tiene una hijita de nombre Margiori, quien se ha convertido en su mejor motivo de progreso, es propietaria de un mototaxi.Su continuo deseo de procurarle bienestar a su pequeña la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para mejorar las condiciones de su herramienta de trabajo a fin de elevar el nivel de vida de su hogar.

Posibilitemos su petición para que dentro de poco esta joven madre pueda constituir su ansiada empresa de transportes.

loans.use: Buy spareparts to improve the standing of her taxi-motorcycle

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbozi, Tanzania! This is 39 year old Lucy N.. She is married with three children, aged 17, 12 and 2. In 2005, Lucy established a bar, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of beer, liquor, and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it is true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool indeed. This explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you are the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of beer, liquor, and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Rukia Nianjema Group

texts.en:
Rukia M., age 46, is married and has 4 children (ages 18, 15, 13 and 11). She has a small stand at the market, a business which she began 8 years ago. She works from 6am to 8pm daily and has managed to make a monthly profit of about US$ 44.

In the past, Rukia has taken out three loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand her business, and she started a fish business as well. She hopes for a new loan to further expand both businesses. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in selling fish, running a beauty salon, a shop and selling food.

In the picture Rukia is 1st on the right

loans.use: to expand available business capital

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
As a good father that has to care for the well-being and security of his family, Edilberto has found himself with the need to postpone his university studies and start working so that his dear, young wife and daughter not have economic difficulties. With the savings that he has and the money that his parents have given him, he decided to buy his work tool in order to provide transportation services to the population of Juliaca. Since his dear wife Celia, who cares for their baby, also wishes to help with the expenses of their new household she is planning on buying a weaving machine in order to make beautiful garments of clothing and generate extra income to cover the basic necessities of the household. Your contribution will help to make real the project of this young couple.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Como buen padre que tiene que velar por el bienestar y seguridad de su familia Edilberto se ha visto en la necesidad de postergar sus estudios superiores y ponerse a trabajar para que su querida y joven esposa e hija no pasen limitaciones económicas.Con los ahorros que tenía y el apoyo económico que sus padres le brindaron decidió comprar su herramienta de trabajo para brindar servicios de movilidad urbana a la población Juliaqueña.En tanto su querida esposa, Celia, que se encarga del cuidado de su bebé, desea también colaborar con los gastos de su nuevo hogar, es por ello que tiene pensado comprar una máquina de tejer, para confeccionar hermosas prendas de vestir y generar ingresos extras para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hoga; debido a que ambos poseen mucha habilidad para confeccionar prendas han decidio adquirir las herrameintas necesarias para poner en marcha su gran proyecto. “Vuestro aporte permitirá concretar el proyecto de esta joven pareja”

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to start a textile business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business Loan

loans.name: Ernesto Ariari

texts.es:
Ernesto is requesting financing to invest in improving his home so he can replace the roof on his house. He has worked for the Rafaela Herrera school in the colony of La Fonseca in the municipality of Nueva Guinea for five years.

Ernesto is a young man who is currently working on his bachelor's degree. He carries out his work with much responsibility, honesty, and many dreams of improving himself. Although he doesn't have children, he assumes the responsibility of caring for his parents. Since he is the youngest child, it is he who lives with them and assumes the expenses of the home.

It is fitting to point out that Ernesto is known for being a fighter and being enterprising. He is an example for all young Nicaraguans who love our country.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Ernesto esta solicitando su financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es cambiarle el zinc a la casa que habita; labora para la Escuela Rafaela Herrera en la colonia La Fonseca del municipio de Nueva Guinea desde hace 5 años

Ernesto es un joven que actualmente está estudiando una licenciatura, desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, honestidad y mucho deseo de superacion personal. A pesar que no tiene hijos, asume la responsabilidad del cuido de sus padres, ya que como hijo menor es el que vive con ellos y asume los gastos del hogar.

Cabe resaltar que se caracteriza por ser luchador y emprendedor, es un ejemplo para todos los jovenes Nicaragüenses que amamos nuestro pais.

loans.use: To replace the roof on his house

loans.name: Thi Hang's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Hang (ID number: 060005) is 32 years old. She used the first loan to purchase more beans and soy beans to make tofu and bean sprouts. She realised that as her inventory expanded, she was able to save more and her daily income increased because she had more stocks to sell. Thus, she would like to request for a second loan. Her group had already repaid the first loan fully. This time, she wants to borrow 2,714,000VND to purchase more beans and soy beans. Her husband also helps out with the business to earn more profits. They have three school-going children. Their average daily income is 120,000VND (about 8USD). Her group also consists of:

Mrs. N. Thi Nhi (ID number: 060007), borrows 2,714,000VND to purchase more stocks for her general store. She joined in the first time and repaid fully.

Mrs. N. Thi Hong (ID number: 060019), borrows 2,714,000VND to purchase more eggs to sell. She joined in the first time and repaid fully.

Mrs. M. Thi Dat (ID number: 060020), borrows 2,714,000VND to breed pigs. She joined in the first time and repaid fully.

Mrs. N. Thi Loan (ID number: 060021), borrows 2,714,000VND to purchase more eggs to sell. She joined in the first time and repaid fully.

Mrs. N. Thi Tham (ID number: 060026), borrows 2,006,000VND to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Mrs. N. Thi Nhi (ID number: 060027), borrows 2,006,000VND to purchase pig feeds.

The total amount requested is 1,050USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Hằng (MS: 060005), năm nay 32 tuổi. Lần một chị vay về mua thêm đỗ làm giá đỗ, đậu phục vụ chăn nuôi. Chị thấy mình có thêm vốn và tiết kiệm được hơn, mức thu nhập trên ngày cũng cao hơn vì chị có nhiều hàng hơn để bán. Chị thấy thích và tiếp tục tham gia lần hai. Chị và cả nhóm đã hoàn trả xong rất tốt lần một. Lần hai chị vay 2.714.000 để đầu tư vào việc mua giá đỗ làm đậu giá. Chồng chị cũng giúp chị trong việc đi chợ để có thêm thu nhập. Gia đình chị có ba con hiện còn đang đi học. Múc thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là 120.000 VND/ ngày. Trong nhóm còn có:

  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhị (MS: 060007), vay 2.714.000 VND để mua bán hàng tiêu dùng. Chị đã tham gia ở kỳ trước và đã trả hết.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng (MS: 060019), vay 2.714.000 VND để bổ xung vốn buôn bán trứng. Chị đã tham gia ở kỳ trước và đã hoàn trả hết.
  • Chị Mẫn Thị Đạt (MS: 060020), vay 2.714.000 VND để lấy vốn chăn nuôi lợn. Chị đã tham gia vay ở kỳ trước và đã trả hết.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Loan (MS: 060021), vay 2.714.000 VND để đi mua bán trứng. Chị đã tham gia ở kỳ trước và đã trả hết.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Thẩm (MS: 060026), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán hàng tiêu dùng.
  • Chị Mẫn Thị Linh (MS: 060027), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn mua cám chăn nuôi lợn.

loans.use: Retail and agriculture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to produce sweet cream beans.

loans.name: Nihifadhi

texts.en:
Nihifadhi is 42 years old. She is divorced with 3 children aged 19, 7 and 6 years old. She has run her own phone accessories shop since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.
