In 2010, Quy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business, and has successfully repaid 2 loans. Quy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Quy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Quy hopes to maintain a successful business, to be healthy and happy, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and to sell in the future.

loans.name: Siman

texts.en:
Siman, pictured with her loom, is a weaver and her husband, Soeurn, is a house constructor. They live on an island in the Mekong River, which is about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh and have four sons who are in school.

Siman is asking for a loan of $200 to buy weaving materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Rosemarie has a shop that sells used clothing such as t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy a stock of used clothing.

Rosemarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Musa Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school located in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. The school serves about 416 pupils and employs twenty-four teachers. In operation for thirteen years, the school receives support from the government to help cover its operating costs.

However, for many of the teachers here, life can be a struggle. Many teachers therefore engage in side projects and small businesses in order to supplement (or in some cases replace) their salaries, and these teachers are collectively seeking a loan of 6 million Sierra Leonean Leones from SMT and Kiva lenders.

Musa is the leader of this group of teachers. He is forty years old and has been in the teaching profession for forty years. He is married, and together they have five children - two in primary school, two in secondary school and one in college. Musa plans to use his portion of the funds to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
This is Felimon, 54, a resident of Silang, a neighborhood of Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Veronica, a housewife and mother to their four children. Together with his wife, Felimon manages their household while operating a business. He works hard to sustain himself and continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Felimon sells rice cake snacks in his neighborhood. He buys rice flour in the market in the morning along with with other ingredients he needs like margarine, sugar and coconut. He cooks and prepares the snacks, then sells them in the afternoon. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Felimon is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan from CCT. He will be using the loan to buy the ingredients he needs in his business. He expects a boost in income as he expands his business.

Felimon hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients he needs in his business.

loans.name: Viviana Victoria

texts.es:
Viviana es una mujer de 39 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus cuatro hijos, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Viviana no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Viviana trabaja como vendedora en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Viviana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar el techado y ponerle piso de concreto a su hogar, de esta manera ella y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Viviana seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada y segura para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Viviana is a 39 year-old woman, she lives in the city of Pucallpa with her four children. She is a single mother, hardworking, who dedicates all of her energy to getting her family ahead. Unfortunately, for lack of economic resources and for the need to work, Viviana could not study a professional career.

By her own initiative, Viviana works as a salesperson in a commercial business in her city. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that it's going well because of her dedication and good effort.

Viviana is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they give she will carry out improvements on her home. She wishes to reinforce the roof and put a concrete floor in her home. In this manner, she and her family will have better security and wellbeing. Thus Viviana will continue working and pushing herself to achieve her great dream of having an adequate home and security for her children.

loans.use: for improving her home

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a small market and bakery. She started the bakery with the help of her husband who provided the oven and moral support. Later she expanded the business into a market where she sells all types of foods. She starts working at 5:30 a.m. and continues into the late evening. From the money she has made with her bakery she has added cement walls to her home which once were only made of flimsy wood.

She is seeking this loan in order to make her market and bakery larger. She receives a good amount of business and sees the need to expand her operation. She is a mother of three children who uses the majority of her income on her children’s well being.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in complementary products to sell from her bakery/store

loans.name: Anih

texts.en:
Anih age 25, is a farmer. The recent flood has caused her to lose all her capital. After being a member of MBK she has requested a loan of $50, to help her get back on her feet, to be able to buy fertilizers, and employ a grass cutter. She expects to be able to harvest up to 5 sacks of rice.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard , Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To increase the rice production

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.en:
Abdumajid is a teacher of physics. Due to his small salary he had to leave his favorite job and engage in trading. He opened a food shop. The goods he delivers are from Khujand central market. But the idea to teach children never left him, and with his last loan he decided to purchase computers. Now he has a room for computer games and his two sons help him there. He has also purchased a copy machine and scanner.

Now he requests a loan for tables and chairs, which he will rent for his business.

loans.use: activity extension

loans.name: Sing

texts.en:
A 62-year-old woman, Sing N. is a widow and lives with her 2 children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a diligent mother who struggles to cover the family's expenses by making and selling several kinds of Khmer traditional cakes such as Num Korng and Num Krouch to the people in her community.

With this business activity, Sing N. can typically make about $2/day in profit. Her two children help the family generate more income by working as tailors. Currently, Sing N. needs more cloth and thread for her children's inventory due to increased demand from their clients. This family believes they will be able to save enough to expand their business still further in the next couple of years.

loans.use: Needs cloth and thread for her children's tailoring business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha runs her own workshop where she makes quilts and bedspreads, which she sells in the city of La Paz. She has a stall in the Fair in July in the city of El Alto. She has eight children, and two of them depend on her. She has been a widow for 10 years and lives in her mother's home in th 16th Zone within El Alto since July.

The loan will be used to buy raw material (cloth and fiber), so she can increase her family income and thus, will be able provide better living conditions for her two last children.

This is the third loan with IMPRO; her good previous credit history approves and validates her current loan search.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha tiene su taller de costura y confecciona edredones y cubrecamas los cuales comercializa en la Ciudad de La Paz y tiene un puesto en la Feria 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto. Tiene 8 hijos, dos de ellos depende de ella. Es viuda hace 10 años, vive en la casa de su madre en la Zona 16 de julio de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para comprar materia prima (tela y fibra), de esa forma incrementar sus ingresos familiares y ofrecerá mejores condiciones de vida para su dos últimos hijos.

Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO; el buen comportamiento de pago en los dos créditos anteriores permite aprobarle la solicitud de préstamo actual.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne Wamaitha K. is a 26-year-old single lady. She is in the business of selling new shoes at Mlolongo town where she resides.  She started her business in the year 2000 with capital of Ksh 15,000 (USD 220), which she saved while under employment at a small retail shop in Rongai town from 1999 –2000.

Anne started selling her goods at an open air space because she didn’t have a stall where she could sell. However, luck was on her side, and in the year 2005, Anne teamed up with her cousin Fridah Wanjiku and together, they rented a stall and they agreed to share the rent.  Anne deals in the sale of shoes and an assortment of other items, while her cousin deals in the sale of clothes, hence their businesses are complementary.  During the holiday seasons like the upcoming month of December, the demand of clothes and shoes are always high because this is when many people buy things as gifts for their families, both in urban and rural places.

Anne’s business has been growing due to the high population in her area, and she finds that she always runs out of stock due to the high demand of the items in her stall.  She now needs to purchase stock of men’s shoes, ladies’ shoes, children’s shoes, plastic items, cutlery, and also bedcovers. Wamaitha is therefore requesting a loan of USD 775, with which to increase her inventory.  With an increase in her stock, she will be able to increase her profit, hence resulting in more income.  She also intends to employ an additional person to help her around the boutique. The repayment period for her loan will be 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase stock of assorted shoes, assorted plastic items, cutlery and bedcovers.

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
(Left to Right) Sulemani C., Hassani B. Issa, Athumani M., 
Zuberi M., are four had working Men forming the Mshikamano group. They jointly own a carpentry workshop at Buguruni in Dar Es Salaam City. They have been running this workshop for the past 4 years and ever since they joined resources, their workshop is expanding.  Each is in need of USD 312.5 which will jointly  help them buy more wood cutting and screwing machines  for the workshop.

loans.use: BUY EQUIPMENTS FOR THE WORKSHOP

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is very responsible in her role as a mother, and she wants to continue improving her business in order to benefit her family. She became separated from her husband many years ago and now she maintains her family through hard work. She wants her children to finish their studies successfully so that they will be able to manage in society without problems. After much searching, Elizabeth has established a small stall in the busiest city market in order to sell fresh chickens to the housewives of her city. She hopes to invest more money in the adaptation and implementation of her small space in order to increase her sales with the aim of providing a better quality of life for her dear children. Let’s make it possible for this mother to continue developing her business with success.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth, es muy responsable con sus roles de madre y quiere seguir progresando con su actividad para beneficio de su familia, se separó hace muchos años de su esposo y ahora los mantiene con su desempeño.Desea que sus hijos culminen con satisfacción sus estudios a fin de que estos se desenvuelvan sin dificultad dentro de su sociedad. Después de mucho buscar se ha establecido en un pequeño puesto de ventas del mercado más concurrido de su ciudad para ofertar desde este lugar pollos frescos a las bellas amas de casa de su ciudad.Anhela invertir mayor dinero en la adecuación e implementación de su pequeño espacio para incrementar sus ventas a fin de otorgarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus queridos hijos.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta madre siga desempeñándose en esta actividad con éxito.

loans.use: To improve and supply a small stall for selling poultry

loans.name: Juwairiah B. In

texts.id:
Juwairiah operates a food stall, she sells cooked dishes , snacks, drinks and cigarette . With the financial assistances from Dinari, she hopes to increase the variety of dishes in her menu and also increase her number of customers. She operates her stall from 7 in the morning till 10 in the evening. Around 5am she has to shop in the market for the food ingredients. Her profit is just enough to pay the rents for the room and the stall, and also the daily expenses of her and her husband.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan menyewa sebuah warung Juwairiah membuka usaha dengan menjual makanan lewat warung tersebut, yang dijualnya adalah nasi, sayur, lauk pauk dan kebutuhan lain seperti rokok, snack, dan minuman botol. Dengan mendapatkan modal dari DINARI Juwairiah berharap bisa mengembangkan usahanya dengan menambah beberapa menu makanan sehingga dapat meningkatkan jumlah pelanggan yang makan di warungnya. Juwairiah membuka warungnya dari jam 07.00 pagi sampai jam 10.00 malam, sekitar jam 05.00 pagi dia harus berbelanja kepasar tradisional untuk membeli bahan makanan yang nantinya akan di masak untuk makanan. Keuntungan yang didapatkan mampu memenuhi kehidupan dia bersama suaminya disamping harus membayar uang kontrak kamar dan warungnya.

loans.use: Buying food ingredients - Untuk membeli bahan-bahan makanan

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina S. owns a small store in Berdyansk, a small port city in southern Ukraine, where she sells mainly groceries and children's clothing. Known for her honesty and business savvy, Valentina has applied for a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars and is confident that she'll be able to pay back every cent.

With the loan, Valentina intends to purchase more clothing inventory and d some repairs and remodeling in her store. She hopes that she'll be able to grow her business to establish a secure future for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for a small store

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
Avelina’s biggest wish is to see her four children become successful professionals. That’s why she and her husband Meliton are focusing their efforts on buying and selling sheep skins and alpaca fibers. They have been selling these products for 20 years and through their hard work they have managed to build a small house for raising their family. Now that their children are entering college, they are facing higher costs and financial limits. Therefore they would like to increase their investment capital and expand their market. With this goal in mind, Avelina is turning to you to ask for a loan.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

El deseo más grande de Avelina es observar convertidos en profesionales de éxito a sus queridos 4 hijos, es por ello que junto a su esposo Meliton trata de poner su mayor empeño y prestancia en su noble labor de compra y venta de cuero de oveja y fibra de alpaca.Juntos vienen dedicándose a esta labor hace 20 años, gracias a su excelente desempeño han logrado construir su pequeño domicilio y brindarle tranquilidad a su familia, ahora que todos sus hijos se encuentran cursando estudios superiores tienen mayores gastos y limitaciones económicas, es por ello que tienen pensado aumentar su capital de inversión y expandir su mercado, con ese proyecto en mente recurre a ti para hacerte la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Injection of capital to offer more leather and alpaca fibers to support their family

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 33 year old married woman with 3 children, ages 14, 12 and 5. Asha owns a small pharmacy, which she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 A.M. to 9 P.M. at her business, where she earns a monthly profit of about $225.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for her pharmacy

loans.name: Mahchehra

texts.en: A. Mahchehra is 19-years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Mahchehra is a market vendor who sells kids' clothing in the local market. After finishing school and entering university , Mahchehra started her own business because she needed money to be able to support her parents and pay for household and personal expenses. Mahchehra has been in this business for 2 years. For these years she managed to make her business stable and profitable so she can generate the income she needs for her family. Now Mahchehra is planning to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $1000 for the term of 12 months. This will enable her to upgrade her stock for the summer season. She promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting her.

loans.use: To upgrade stock and expand business

loans.name: Honesty Group

texts.en:
This group is called Honesty and its leader is Dauda S.. He sells dishes. The other members of the group are Abubakarr Seasy, who sells different sorts of articles, Fatmata S., who sells local produce, and Jatu S., who sells dishes.

The group is requesting the sum of Le 4,000,000.00. This can go a long way in helping them expand their businesses, increasing sales and profit. This group has been with SMT for over two years now and loans have been very helpful keeping them in business.

Their leader, Dauda, is now 38, born in Makeni, and is married with three children.

loans.use: To buy more dishes, articles, and local produce to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Thi Hoa's Group

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn thị Hoa is 39 years old. She likes SEDA program very much because the loan condition is easy and it suits her condition. She is requesting a loan of 3.186000 VND to have capital to start a retail business. Her family combined income is 150.000 VND a day. Her group is composed of:

  • Ms C. thị Thuần, requesting 3.186000 VND. She sells rice
  • Ms C. thị Ba MS, requesting 2.006000 VND. She makes rice gallettes.
  • MsNguyễn thị Hợi, requesting 2.006000 VND. She sells basic goods.
  • Ms Dương thị Hồng, requesting 3.186000 VND. She sells clothes
  • Ms Đặng thị Hường, requesting 3.186000 VND. She sells clothes

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

    cchị Nguyễn thị Hoa năm nay 39 tuổi,MS13040007.Chị rất thích tham gia vay vốn của chương trình vì thấy rất thuận tiện ,mức trả lại phù hợp với gia đình Chị.Lần này Chị đăng ký vay ở mức 3.186000 VND để buôn bán và lấy vốn để kinh doanh .Mỗi ngày gia đình Chị thu nhập được khoảng 150.000 VND.Nhóm Chị gồm có các thành viên :

  • chị C. thị Thuần MS 13040008 vay mức vốn là 3.186000 VND để buôn gạo
  • chị C. thị Ba MS 13040009 vay ở mức vốn 2.006000 VND để lấy vốn tráng bánh đa nem
  • chị Nguyễn thị Hợi MS 13040010 vay mức 2.006000 VND để đi chợ
  • chị Dương thị Hồng MS 13040011 vay ở mức 3.186000 VND để kinh doanh quần áo
  • chị Đặng thị Hường MS 13040012 vay mức 3.186000 VND để buôn bán quần áo

loans.use: retails

loans.name: Benkadi(L'entente Est Bonne Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe benkadi résident au village de Djodjandjè de la sous préfecture de Ouelessebougou. Elles sont mariées et vivent dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne 27 ans et 2 enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens de famille, de voisinage. 

Elles exercent toutes le petit commerce d’articles divers (tubercules, charbon de bois, friandises . . .). Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter des sacs de tubercules, des sacs de charbon et des matières premières. Elles s’approvisionnent mensuellement sur place et dans les villages environnants.
 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt et compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 18.500 FCFA.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi group live in the village of Djodjandjè in the subprefecture of Ouelessebougou. They are married and live in polygamous households with an average age of 27 years old and have an average of 2 children each. They met through neighborhood and family ties. They all work in the small-scale business of selling various items (tubers, charcoal, candy, etc.). With this loan, they plan to buy bags of tubers, charcoal and raw materials. They get their supplies every month in surrounding villages. This is their second loan and they plan to earn an average monthly profit of 18,500F CFA.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items for their small business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria Elva es una persona, joven que esta trabajando en el mercado general de abastos junto con su madre.

Para poder solventar sus estudios y las de sus hermanos, ella viene de madrugada, desde la cuidad de Capiata como 18 km. de la capital, para poder terminar como a las 8 de la tarde y tener tiempo, para ir a estudiar y luego irse hasta el colegio.

Además comenta que le gusta su trabajo y tener independencia económica

.
texts.en:
Maria Elva is a young person who is working in the general basic products market with her mother.

To be able to cover her studies and those of her brothers, she arrives at daybreak from the city of Capiata, some 18 km. from the capital, to be able to finish at around 8 in the afternoon and have time to go to study and then get to school.

Additionally, she mentions that she likes her work and having economic independence.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, vegetables in bulk, tomatoes, carrots, onions, eggplant, etc.

loans.name: Mzuri

texts.en:
Mzuri has been selling cooking pots, charcoal, vegetables, and palm leaves (used for weaving) at her shop in Zanzibar for ten years. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $45 each month. She is now requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she may buy more inventory for her shop and increase her profit.

Mzuri is 50 years old, and has one child and cares for two additional dependants.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Group B

texts.en:
Fred M. is a hard working and ambitious young man of 31 years of age He is the leader of the Kamu kamu women’s group B in Kayunga. Fred has had a wholesale food shop in the Bukeeka township of Kayunga for 10 years. He is married and has three children (ages 10, 5, and 3) who are all in school. He has been in this lending group for five years now. As a result of his work with and involvement in this lending group, Fred has bought four boda bodas (bicycle taxis) and with this loan, he plans to buy another boda boda and other goods for his shop. Fred’s wife is a farmer who manages their farms with hired helpers. Fred and his wife have a dream of one day buying a commercial car. 

He will share this loan with his group members.

loans.use: To buy more goods for shop and a boda boda

loans.name: La Era Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo LA ERA, somos cuatro mujeres, y todas residimos en la Col. Nueva Era de la Ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Johanna B. soy la Cordinadora del grupo y tengo 23 años de edad, Glenda Xiomara tiene 34 años de edad. Zonia C. tiene 29 años de edad y Nancy M. tiene 27 años de edad, todas somos muy jovenes y nos dedicamos a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas, Glenda Velasques se dedica a la venta de ropa. en las mañanas tmuy temprano fabricamos la primera ronda de tortillas las empacamos y las vendemos, despues del medio dia hacemos otra produccion para la venta de las 4 de la tarde en adelante, actualmente la demanda ha incrementado mucho y no nos damos abasto para cumplir con todos los pedidos, necesitamos el credito para poder tener una mayor produccion y asi mismo tener mayores ventas y ganancias, nuestra otra compañera vende ropa y ella necesita el credito para comprar para la epoca de navidad que las ventas de ropa son muy buenas.
estamos seguras de que vamos a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hello, we are with the group La Era. We are four women who all live in the city of Tegucigalpa. I'm Johanna B., I'm 23 years old and I'm the coordinator of the group. Glenda Xiomara is 34 years old, Zonia C. is 29 and Nancy M. is 27 years old. We are all young and work making and selling tortillas. Glenda sells clothing as well. Very early in the morning, we make the first batch of tortillas which we pack and sell. In the middle of the day, we make another batch to sell from 4 in the afternoon onwards. The demand for the tortillas has grown a lot and we can hardly cope with all of the requests. We need the loan so that we can make greater quantities and increase our sales and our income. Our other colleague needs the loan to purchase clothing for the Christmas season, as clothing sales are going well. We are confident that we will continue to grow our business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in their business making and selling tortillas

loans.name: Elinaike

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Elinaike K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with five children between the ages of 12 and 24 years. Elinaike has been running a beauty salon business since 1998. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at the business for 10 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Elinaike currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 225 USD in order to purchase additional hair products. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Elinaike thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional hair products for her salon.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cecilia del Carmen M. tiene 39 años de edad, es acompañada y junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad reside en el municipio de Apopa, departamento de San salvador. Cecilia posee un puesto de verduras y frutas frescas, el cuál contribuye con los gastos del hogar, sobre todo le ayuda a poder pagar el alquiler de su casa, ya que no posee casa propia. Uno de sus mayores sueños es poder obtener más capital y aumentar la variedad de frutas y verduras, de manera que en un futuro pueda comprar una casa propia para ella y su familia. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo, el cuál contribuya a mejorar su negocio y de esta manera también mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Cecilia del Carmen M. is 39 years old, she has a partner, and she and her three young children live in the town of Apoga, in San Salvador. Cecilia has a fresh fruit and vegetable stand, with which she helps with the household expenses. Above all it helps her to pay the rent for her house, since she doesn’t have her own house. One of her biggest dreams is to be able to obtain more capital and increase the variety of fruits and vegetables she offers, so that in the future she can buy her own house for her and her family. Because of this, she is requesting a loan, which will be used to improve her business and, in this way, will also improve her family’s finances.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number of fruits and vegetables in her business

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI de l’association Djekafo est composé de sept femmes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  4 enfants. Toutes ces femmes vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants frères, sœurs et époux. Elles résident toutes dans le village de ZANFINA, sous préfecture de KONOBOUGOU relevant de la préfecture de BAROUELI région de SEGOU république du Mali.
 Elles se sont connues  à travers des activités à caractères agricoles et dans l’intention de valoriser leurs activités (agricoles, commerciales etc.), elles ont décidé de collaborer avec  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe dont deux prêts agricoles. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 180 kg d’oignon, 200 kg de sel de cuisine, 10 boites de 2 kg de concentrée de tomate et une grande quantité de condiments divers. Elles s’approvisionnent sur le marché de Fana pour  revendre sur le marché local de ZAFINA en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Ces femmes espèrent avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 25 000 FCFA qu’elles utiliseront pour acheter des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group of the association Djekafo and is composed of seven married women. They average 32 years of age and 4 children. These women all live in traditional extended conjugal families with their children, brothers, sisters, and spouses. They all reside in the village of ZANFINA (in KONOBOUGOU sub-prefecture, part of BAROUELI prefecture) in the SEGOU region, Republic of Mali. They know one another through work of an agricultural nature.

With the intention of developing their businesses (agricultural, commercial, etc.), they decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their sixth group loan, which included two agricultural loans. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

These women intend to use this loan to buy 180 kg of onions, 200 kg of salt, 10 boxes (2 kg each) of tomato paste, and a large quantity of various condiments. Supplies are gotten at the Fana marketplace in order to be sold retail at the local ZAFINA marketplace, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed essentially of women.

With this loan, the group members hope to make a profit of 25,000 francs CFA that they will use to buy some small ruminants.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiment

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Las PodeR." esta representado por la señora Carmen Cecilia y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a actividades de venta de productos como dulces, tarjetas, cosméticos, electrodomésticos y al servicio de mensajeria, secretaria y soldadura de arco y oxigeno. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es una lucha de cada día pero, los socios del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de progresas. El crédito esta destinado al incremento de insumos, materiales y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar sus ingresaos para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calida de vida.  Una mayoría de los miembros del grupo no tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios pero saben como trabajar para cumplir con sus obligaciones con responsabilidad y honestidad.
texts.en:
Las PodeR. ('The Powerful Ones') community bank is represented by Carmen Cecilia and is made up of twelve members. Some members sell products such as sweets, phone cards, cosmetics, and home appliances, and others provide services such as those of a courier, secretary, and welder (specializing in gas metal arc welding). Competition in the commercial sector is a struggle every day but the group members know how to get through it thanks to their experience and progress. The loan will be used to buy supplies, materials, and tools that will help improve the members' incomes, providing their families with a better quality of life. The majority of the group members don't have experience working in solidarity groups but know how to work in order to fulfill their obligations with responsibility and honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yamileth Argentina

texts.es:
la Sra. Yamileth R. se dedica al comercio , ella cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta de juguetes y ropa denominado ALFA Y OMEGA desde hace mas de 6 años tiene su negocio, lo que le ha permitido adquirir una buena experiencia y buena clientela permitiendole de esta manera permanencia y exito en su negocio, ella es casada y tiene un hijo el cual esta en la preparatorio de un kinder de la ciudad de danli.
con los ingresos que tiene suple todos los gastos de su hijo, tambien le ayuda a su esposo para salir adelante con su hogar, a la vez ella es pasante de la carrera de pedagogia en el sistema de educacion a distancia,una de sus metas es poder graduarse de la universidad y asi tener una buena preparacion academica para poder aplicar a un trabajo fijo, y siempre tener su negocio, ella solicita el credito para poder comprar mercaderia y asi poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yamileth R. is a businesswoman. She has a small shop called ALFA Y OMEGA, whers she has been selling toys and clothing for more than 6 years. She has acquired experience and good clients which has allowed her to continue and be successful in her business. She is married and has a son who attends a kindergarten in the town of Danli.

With the income she makes up for the expenses of her son, and she also helps her husband with the family expenses. She studied pedagogy of distance learning and is a candidate for graduation and one of her goals is to get the university degree and with a solid academic prepartion be able to apply for a stable job as well as to keep her business. She requests the loan in order to buy merchandise and thus be able to stock up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toys, summer garments, sandals, and cuddle toys.

loans.name: Chahongir

texts.ru: Чахонгир занимается перевозкой людей на своей собственной машине – он таксист. Ему 32 года, женат и имеет троих детей. Жена нигде не работает и находится дома и смотрит за детьми. Чахонгир кроме такси по выходным дня занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов. Для расширения бизнеса собирается получить займ на КИВА.
texts.en:
Chahongir transports people in his personal vehicle – he is a taxi driver. He is 32 years old, he is married and has three children. His wife does not have a job and stays at home and watches the children. Chahongir in addition to the taxi purchases and sells dried fruit on the weekends. In order to grow his business he plans to take out a loan from KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Hanifan M. Hanif Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is a 58-year-old married lady and has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last 20 years. Her husband is M. H. and he is a fruit seller by profession. He has been selling fruit for the last six years. He sells his products in different communities by calling in a loud voice. Hanifan baji helps him by arranging the fruits on the cart. She is applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart because his old cart is rough.  

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Shaher bano baji, Seema baji and Zahooran baji each want a loan to buy bed sheets to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Erika Masiel

texts.es: La Señora Ericka M. tiene 25 años de edad, su casa de habitación esta situada en el barrio La Primavera en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo es bodeguero en una empresa del país, tiene dos hijos de seis y cuatro años de edad, terminar la construcción de su casa para tener un patrimonio seguro y protegido para el presente y futuro de sus hijos. Doña Ericka se desempeña en su pequeño negocio de venta de joyas, zapatos y ropas desde hace seis años. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic aumentado su inventario y con este préstamo que solicita es para comprar productos como: mayores cantidades de zapatos, prendas, ropas y artículos para damas. Consolidando su negocio y a la misma vez siendo más rentable para elevar sus ventas y ganancias.

loans.use: Comprar ropa,zapatos y prendas

loans.name: Monicah Achieng

texts.en:
Monicah is 38 years old, the mother of three, and is married to Kennedy Nyabuto who operates a taxi in Eldoret town. Monicah survived the terrible post-election violence of 2007 but she had to temporarily close her business and four of her group members were displaced.

She has had four loans from Kadet and hopes that with this fifth loan she will be able to expand her business operations at her general store and open a wholesale shop in future.

Monicah plans to buy additional stock such as sacks of sugar, cooking fat, soft drinks and household items. To further diversify what her business has to offer customers, she intends to buy more clothing materials for her tailoring work. 

This will give her additional income which will enable her to further her children’s education and, eventually, own a house.

loans.use: To buy additional stock such as sacks of sugar, cooking fat, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La señora María Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 69 años, 12 hijos que ya son independientes y tiene su familia.

María Victoria, es una mujer luchadora, se dedica a la venta de verduras y a su edad no tiene dificultad de seguir adelante con el trabajo que realiza, nos cuenta que se siente muy bien con lo que hace, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para ir al mercado central de la Ciudad de Moyobamba, para vender sus productos.

En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que a diario acude a su puesto a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará sacos de yucas, sacos de frejoles, y otros productos para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Vicki, como le dicen de cariño hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de las fuerzas. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Victoria A. is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” Microfinance Institute in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 69-year-old married mother with 12 children who are all independent and have their own families.

Maria Victoria is a hardworking woman who sells vegetables for a living. At her age, she does not have difficulty moving forward with her business. She states that she feels satisfied with what she does. She wakes up at 4:00 a.m. to go to the central market in the city of Moyobamba to sell her produce.

She is currently well-known by her customers, who go to her stand daily to purchase everything that a homemaker needs. She personally attends to her customers with the charm that she is noted for.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase sacks of cassava, sacks of beans, and other products so that she can continue giving the best customer service.

Vicki, as she is affectionately called, now feels very fulfilled and with the desire to keep moving forward, as far as God gives her the strength to go. She thanks Manuela Ramos for having helped her to start her own business, as well as for having helped other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham T. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through senior high school. Abraham has been selling fish in Bantoma since 1999. His wife is a trader. Abraham uses his income to pay school fees and other bills. Abraham will use the loan to purchase materials for fishing. Abraham plans to reinvest the new profits from his expanded business.

loans.use: Abraham will use the loan to purchase materials for fishing.

loans.name: Armando Rodrigo

texts.pt:
Armando Rodrigo C., de 33 anos de idade, natural de Chokwe, província de Gaza, vive maritalmente e é pai de 04 filhos, dois primeiros frequentam a escola e os dois últimos não, vive na casa dos pais e esta a frequentar 4º ano do curso de licenciatura em gestão desportiva na Universidade Pedagógica. Alem da esposa e filhos sustenta os pais.  

Nasceu em Chokwe e ainda bebe saiu com os pais para Maputo, actualmente continua vivendo em casa dos pais com a esposa e filhos.

 Concluiu a formação no IMAP (instituto de magistérios primários) em 2000 e é Professor afecto na MINED (ministério da educação e cultura) desde 2001 auferindo actualmente um salário mensal de 6.000,00MT com o qual e com as receitas de 02 mesas de bilhar que tem, sustenta a família e consegue poupar para construir a sua residência. 

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através da sua colega de serviço que também é nosso cliente, este é o segundo empréstimo dele na Hluvuku-Adsema, tendo se beneficiado por um empréstimo de 25.000,00MT destinados a compra de material de construção, de salientar que o mesmo foi pago sem nenhum problema e que também já teve empréstimo no Tchuma. 

Com o empréstimo de 20.000,00MT pretende comprar blocos, areia grossa, cimento, chapas de zinco, barrotes e outros. O seu maior desafio e concluir a sua casa e a sua formação.
Propõe-se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Armando Rodrigo C. is 33 years old and was born in Chokwe in the Gaza province. He is married and has 4 children—the two oldest are in school and the youngest two are not. They live with Armando’s parents. He is starting his fourth year in a Sports Management program in the University’s education department. Beyond caring for his children and wife he also takes care of his parents. He was born in Chokwe but moved to Maputo when he was still a baby. He still lives in the same house with his parents, wife and children. He graduated from IMAP (Institute for Primary Teachers ) in 2000 and he is currently a teacher at MINED (Ministry of Education and Culture) and has been since 2001. He earns a monthly salary of 6.000,00MT and also earns income from two pool tables that he owns. With that money, he supports his family and is saving to build a home. He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through a colleague who is also a Hluvuku client. This is his 2nd loan—his first loan was for 25.000,00MT which he used to buy construction materials and was repaid without problems. He also had a loan with Tchuma. With this loan of 20.000,00MT he would like to buy bricks, coarse sand, cement, roof tiles, and other materials. His main challenge is finishing his home and his degree. He pledges to pay this loan without any problems in order to qualify for more loans in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction material

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
General store is the business that manages by Alma P.. She plans to expand her store to be able to gain more income but she doesn’t have enough capital.  This is the reason why she is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP5, 000.00 to further expand her store. She would be glad if her request loan will be approved. 

Alma is 32 years old and she is married to Rodrigo. The couple is thankful because they are blessed with three children: Michael-13 years old; Mary Jane-10 years old, grade-VI and Melody Joy-8 years old. Expanding her store is the best thing that she can do in order to generate bigger income said by Alma.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamou S. est âgée de 34 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il vit en location avec plusieurs  co-locataires  dans le quartier Darsalam de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant fréquenté l’école coranique par la volonté de son père, très vite il l’abandonna pour l’exode en embrassant le métier de tailleur. Après 8 années apprentissage, et nanti de cette expérience, il évolue seul depuis 14 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation. Tailleur modéliste et styliste il est l’un des grands couturiers de la ville Ségou. Il a appris ce métier en république de Côte d’Ivoire dès  sa tendre enfance.
Pour équiper son atelier d’une nouvelle machine à coudre plus performante afin de s’adapter toujours à la mode,  il a  fait recours au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son 1er prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, une machine à coudre à Ségou. Monsieur   Mamou S. coud et vend ses habits à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Ses prestations et ventes se font généralement au comptant. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA, qui lui permettra de subvenir aux  charges familiales. 
Son ambition est d’agrandir son atelier et d’avoir une boutique de bazin.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamou S. is 34 years old, married, and the father of two children. He lives in a rented place with several co-tenants in the Darsalam district of the city of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having attended Koranic school per his father’s wishes, he soon quit and joined the exodus while embracing the trade of tailoring. After eight years of apprenticeship, and bestowed with this experience, he advanced on his own for fourteen years and now enjoys a strong reputation. A designer and a stylist, as well as a tailor, he is one of the great clothing makers in the city of Ségou. He learned this trade in the Republic of Cote d’Ivoire beginning in his early childhood. To equip his workshop with a new, more efficient sewing machine in order to adjust constantly to fashions, he turned to the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. He is on his first individual loan, which he intends to use to buy a sewing machine in Ségou. Mr. Mamou S. sews outfits and sells them to customers composed primarily of women. His services and sales are generally paid for in cash. He envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will enable him to provide for his family. His ambition is to expand his workshop and to have a store for damask fabrics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, en el  municipio de Somotillo, la señora Yadira S. ha iniciado a reconstruir su casa de habitación por la razón de que necesita brindarle a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo y así proporcionarles un techo digno donde vivir.  

Port tal razón, la señora Yadira acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar  el crédito oportuno para la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta manera continuar mejorando las condiciones de la vivienda ya que le es de importancia terminar con esta obra de construcción.
texts.en:
Yadira S., with much effort and dedication, has started rebuilding her house in the Somotillo municipality. The reason she is doing this is to give her children the conditions that are necessary for their development, and to give them a decent roof over their heads. For that reason, Yadira comes to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy construction materials. That way she will continue improving the condition of the house. It is important to her to finish this construction work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan J. sells green vegetables and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and pulses (edible seeds of legumes) to sell.  Susan is 40 years old and is married to a peasant. She has four children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beans and edible seeds for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cellphones and cellphone accessories

loans.name: Keep Project Of Central Group

texts.en: Suzan N. 26, is the leader of her lending group in Bunamwaya. She is a very self-motivated and hard working lady. She has a cosmetics business that she has been running for two years. She is married with 2 children aged 6 years and 2 and a half years, and she also takes care of 3 dependants. From her business, Suzan is able to make a profit each week and she attributes this to the good customer care she delivers. Her dream is to develop her cosmetics shop further, as well as continue being a good citizen in her community. Suzan is seeking her second loan from her lending group and she hopes to use it to increase the stock in her business for more profits.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for increased stock and sales.

loans.name: Celestina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Celestina del Carmen, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años y es madre de 06 hijos, todos ellos que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando. 

Lleva 15 años dedicándose a la Venta de Almidón, producto elaborado a base de yuca se inicio con S/. 100.00 y junto con su esposo, emprendieron su negocio, que se encuentra ubicada, en su misma; donde cuenta con una huerta grande, espacio que le permite rallar, cernir y secar el producto, antes de ser vendidos.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio de Venta de Almidón que sirve para la preparación de dulces regionales, cuenta con clientes fijos y también trabaja con panaderías y bodegas, que hacen sus pedidos mensualmente y diariamente.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará 01 tonelada de yuca.
Con parte del dinero también comprara planchas de calamina y plásticos, herramientas principales para secar al sol el almidón que produce, cuidando siempre la higiene y limpieza.

Ella y su esposo, son quienes toman las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, tranquila, capaz y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Celestina, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Celestina del Carmen belongs to the communal bank “La Marginal II,” La Banda de Shilcayo District, San Martin Province, San Martin Department. She is married, 40 years old, and has six children, all of whom are still dependents and are in school. For fifteen years, she has sold starch produced from cassava. She started with 100 nuevo soles and, along with her husband, began their business at home. There they have a large garden, with space to grate, sift, and dry the product before selling it. At present, Celestina continues to sell starch, which serves in the preparation of regional sweets. She has regular clients and also works with bakeries and grocery stores that make monthly and daily orders. With this loan of 3,000 nuevo soles, she will buy one ton of cassava. With part of the money she will also buy corrugated metal and plastic sheets, main tools for drying the starch in the sun, while always paying attention to hygiene and cleanliness. Celestina and her husband make the decisions about business profits. Personally, she feels more independent, calm, capable, and responsible toward paying their dues. Celestina thanks Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a business person and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing one ton of cassava

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 67 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran trabajando con ella. Sabina no estudió y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Ella nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar sus animales como: cuy y gallinas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar ovejas.
Su sueño para el futuro es vivir tranquila y feliz. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sabina is a partner in the Community Bank of “Gregoira Apaza” for the past four years. She lives in the district of Llave, provence of El Collao area of Puno. She is 67 years old, married with four children who work with her. Sabina has no schooling. She makes a living buying and selling livestock. She tells us about her first loan with the Manuela Ramos Movement which was for S/300 Peruvian nuevos soles which allowed her to increase the animals she has such as guinea pigs and hens. She has requested a loan of S/500 Peruvian nuevos soles with which she will be able to buy sheep. Her dream for the future is to live happy and peacefully. What she likes most about the Community Bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Isseu

texts.fr:
Madame Isseu G. est une jeune dame mariée, ayant trois enfants mais très passionnée par son métier de coiffeuse. Son caractère ambitieux l’a même  pousse a choisir l’activité secondaire de vente de produits pour cheveux, body et divers autres produits qu’elle expose dans son salon installe a quelques mètres de la caisse de Ouakam. En plus elle a appris l’activité de couture par le biais de sa mère. Ce qui l’a passionne beaucoup  c’est l’inspiration, la beauté, et la créativité  dont elle fait preuve pour suivre la mode. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destine a l’achat de thioubs et d’un casque pour cheveux en vue d’améliorer l’équipement de son salon de coiffure et la performance de son travail. Son prêt lui permettra d’accroitre ses profits et de maintenir son indépendance financière.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique  apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs Isseu G. is a young married woman who has three children but is also passionate about her job as a hairdresser. Her ambitious nature has even pushed her into taking on a secondary activity selling both hair and body products as well as other miscellaneous products. She exhibits these products in her salon, which lies a few meters from the savings bank in Ouakam. Furthermore she has also learnt how to sew through her mother. She is passionate about inspiration, beauty and creativity which she shows in keeping up with fashion. She is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs with which she intends to buy "thioubs" (pieces of special tinted fabric) and a hair drier with a view to improving both the equipment in her hairdressing salon and her work performance. Her loan will allow her to increase her profits and maintain her financial independence. In line with its ongoing vision of participating actively to the battle against poverty, U-IMCEC with the backing of its lenders, is succeeding in providing support to people to carry out lucrative income generating activities; this in turn contributes to a welcome socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia M. is from the village of Tubod. She is 64 years old. Leoncia is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Leoncia owns & operates a bread making business in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling home made bread  & other delicacies in the local community. Leoncia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Leoncia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leoncia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Leoncia is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Leoncia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell

loans.name: Adela Natividad

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Adela es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Adela junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, sus productos los vende en el mismo lugar y también los vende en Huanta, además Adela vende leña.
Adela necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra y leña.
Los sueños de Adela son comprar un carro grande para transportar sus productos y tener un almacén propio en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the Nueva Era Communal Bank. Adela is 42, married, and has four children. Adela and her husband make bricks by hand in the Compañía community. They sell their products in the same area. They also sell in Huanta. Adela also sells firewood. Adela needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy land and firewood. Adela’s dreams are to buy a large car to transport her products and to have her own store in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land and firewood

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia sells mouth watery Nigerian cooked foods and drinks to make a living in Lagos state. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Sadia hopes to expand her business in the future.She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. Sadia is 31 years old, married with two children. She is a friendly and hard working woman. She hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more  drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando T. is from the village of Eastern Poblacion in Lopez Jaena. He is a 35-year-old married father of 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Fernando runs a sari-sari store where he sells basic needs such as shampoo, noodles, and sugar. Fernando has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

Fernando has just joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fernando is requesting his first loan, in the amount of 3000 PHP, to use as additional capital for his sari-sari store.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: 07.05.04 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Vinh H. T. is 42, and married with two school-aged children. She lives in the town of H. Hoa Thanh Hoa. Vinh is the leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. To making a living, Vinh raises cattL. for saL.. She has been doing this for three years and earns approximately 1.300.000 VND a month. 

In 2003, Vinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.000.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell and is now requesting a new loan of 5.000.000 VND for the same purpose. The loan is the fourth loan she will have taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Vinh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  L. T. Bac is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her retail store.

2.  L. T. Phuong is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3.  H. T. Hang is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Vinh H. T. ( 003) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở H. Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Vinh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 07.05.04 H. Hoa - Thanh Hoa (07.05.04 H. Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Vinh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Vinh kiếm được khoảng 1.300.000 VND.  Vào 2003, Vinh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Vinh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.000.000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Bac (038) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  L. T. Phuong (006) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  H. T. Hang (042) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en: Tsetsgee is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband operates a taxi service in their town. Currently, Tsetsgee operates a Mongolian fast food restaurant and second-hand shoe-trading business. She has been operating her restaurant since 2007, and has built a stable operation. She also opened a used clothing business in 2008. Over the years, she has been expanding her businesses. Her shoe repair business is seasonal, and does not operate during the winter. Tsetsgee is a very hardworking person and has been working hard to stabilize both her businesses. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1475 USD) loan to purchase more inventory for her shoe-trading business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy C. is 51 years old and is the village bank president who was selected by all the members. She lives in Sdao Kanleng village in Kandal province.  Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purposes. Mrs. Chanthy C. is a congee (rice porridge) and Chinese noodle seller who owns a motorcycle to support her business activities. 

She is requesting a loan to repair her motorcycle, and the rest of the loan she wants to use to support her congee business. Mrs. Chanthy C. is a widow with two children who are all students.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle and to support her congee business.

loans.name: Berlen Gabriela

texts.es: Berlen Gabriela tiene 27 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Ella es una persona que disfruta de relacionarse con sus clientes. Además ha luchado para salir adelante hace mas de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que además tiene otro medio de ingreso como es ofrecer el servicio de molino, pues siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos. La mayoría de sus clientes asisten a su pulpería porque Berlen es muy atenta con ellos y además les brinda muy buenos consejos. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de golosinas, jugos, sopas, detergentes, bolsas y granos básicos. Su deseo es convertir su negocio en una gran distribuidora.
texts.en:
Berlen Gabriela is 27 years old and runs a small general store. She enjoys interacting with her customers and she has worked hard over the last 6 years in this business to progress and grow her business. She has another form of income through her milling services; she is always looking for ways to improve her income. Most of her customers go to her store because Berlen is very attentive to them and offers them good advice. This loan will be used to buy candy, juice, soap, detergent, bags, and basic grains. She dreams of turning her business into a larger distribution business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mugomeh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Mugomeh” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are petty businessmen who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,800,000 for the entire group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Ansumana Y.. Ansumana was born in a village called Shengeh, thirty-four years ago. He is married and has three children who are between the ages of one and seven. Ansumana sells used shoes and has been in this business for fifteen years now. With his share of the loan, he will buy a bale of used shoes to add to his business.

loans.use: Buy a bale of used shoes for resale

loans.name: Zapatitos Group

texts.es:
“Zapatitos”  es un grupo de 7 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Collpani”,  su presidenta es Carmen A. de 43 años, trabaja con Pro Mujer hace 10 años aproximadamente, ha estado en  diferentes grupos. Carmen se dedica a la costura de prendas de vestir, especializando en chamarras, con el pasar del tiempo pudo hacer crecer su negocio y generar empleo. Carmen adquiere su mercadería de la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto y vende sus productos en ésta misma ciudad ya que tiene un lugar de venta, además indica que le gusta compartir con sus amigas en las reuniones.
En esta oportunidad esta solicitando Bs.- 1500 para comprar tela. Las demás integrantes de ésta Asociación Comunal  tienen diversos negocios de producción, servicio y comercio.
texts.en:
“Zapatitos” (Little Shoes) is a group composed of seven women and one man who attend their meetings at the Collpani Community Center. The group president is Carmen A.. She is 43 years old and has worked with different groups within Pro Mujer for approximately 10 years.

Carmen is a seamstress who specializes in making jackets. Over time she has been able to grow her business and create jobs. Carmen acquires her supplies from the outskirts of the city of El Alto and then sells her products in the same city. She already has a place where she sells her merchandise. Carmen says she enjoys sharing with her friends during their meetings. At the moment, she is requesting 1500 BOB in order to buy fabric.

The other members of this Communal Association have different businesses in the manufacturing, service, and retail sectors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making jackets

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María C. Sánchez  es una  señora de 35  años de edad quien vive con su esposo en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías.
Desde hace muy poco tiempo doña María  ha querido desarrollarse como microempresaria, con un pequeño proyecto dedicado a la  producción de leche y algunos derivados, tales como natilla y queso. Ella vive  con su esposo, quien ha sido su mayor impulso y ayuda, asegura que entre los 2 van poder mejorar sus condiciones económicas para poder tener su primer hijo.
Dice estar muy agradecida con este proyecto, ya que le ha generado una mayor confianza, ha servido como una fuente de ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones a pesar de las dificultades económicas que hay en la región 
Actualmente María  requiere un préstamo de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) destinados a la  compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar la producción de leche y por ende la de sus productos los cuales aseguran ser muy demandados en la comunidad ya que son de muy buena calidad.
Doña María  es socia de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su Primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. Y
texts.en:
35-year old María C. Sánchez lives with her husband in a community called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the the province of Cartago. It is a small rural community with a population of approximately 2,000. The local people are dairy and coffee farmers. The area is hilly and much of the land is tropical rainforest. It’s very attractive with two lovely lakes, coffee plantations, and dairies mixed in with the rainforest. In the last little while María has wanted to develop her small dairy business with a project involving milk products such as cream and cheese. Her husband has been a big support and help, and María is certain that between them they can improve their financial situation and start a family. Currently María needs a loan of 500,000 colones with which to buy a cow. This will enable her to increase milk production and other dairy products which are sure to be in great demand in the community since they are of high quality. She is a member of the Producers’ Association of El Sauce, one of the hundred member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes that it will enable her to continue developing both on a personal and on an economic level.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Hum

texts.en: Hum C., 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorian Temples. She sells groceries at home for an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Essie

texts.fr: G. essie est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé. en 2008, elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de charbon de bois, le charbons de bois est très utilisé au togo pour faire la cuisine. la demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevé elle voudrait les satisfaire convenablement elle sollicite alors un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de tsévié.
texts.en:
G. Essie is a married woman and the mother of two children. She lives with her family in the Adidogomé district. In 2008, she started selling charcoal, which is commonly used for cooking in Togo. Her customers' demand is growing, and she would like to satisfy it properly. Therefore she is seeking a loan to purchase 20 bags of charcoal. She stocks up in the interior part of the country, in the town of Tsévie.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags of charcoal

loans.name: Vicente Adalberto

texts.en:
Vicente Adalberto S. N. is 22 years old. He is single and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador.

Vicente is a member of the rural loan group called San Jacinto. The group consists of fifteen members, the majority of whom work in the agricultural sector.

Vicente also works in the agriculture sector, earning on average $150 per month. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde.

Vicente plans to use the loan to grow cacao (used to make chocolate).  This year, pests have destroyed much of his cacao crops. 

Vicente’s dream is to have his own house and a car. In his free time he likes to watch television and play sports.

loans.use: To grow cacao

loans.name: Development Group

texts.en: Presented to you here are members of the “Development” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Makeni who are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member of the group in order to expand their businesses. Abdulai T. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. He is 42 years old and was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Abdulai is married and has one child who attends primary school. For 10 years now, Abdulai has been selling palm oil, groundnut/peanuts, charcoal, etc. With his share of this loan, he will invest in his business by buying gallons of palm oil, groundnuts and charcoal to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil, groundnuts and charcoal to add to his current stock

loans.name: Fely's Group

texts.en: Fely T. is from the village of Bogabongan. She is 46 years old. Fely is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are individually responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults. Fely is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Fely works in someone else's business venture, selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Fely has been engaged in this for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for it. In 2008, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
