Ella tiene mucha fe a su trabajo, ya que sabe que todo es cuestión de creatividad y esfuerzo para echar a andar un nuevo negocio y lograr los ingresos necesarios para el bienestar de su familia. Para el futuro, Macaria quiere tener una peluquería y no descansará hasta ver este sueño hecho realidad.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ella acostumbra a solicitar préstamos individuales, pero también es parte de un grupo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de cajas de cerveza y seguirá abasteciendo su tienda.
texts.en:
Macaria is 41 years old. She lives in the house she owns with her partner and children; Jhon who is 16, Ricardo who is 11, Gisel who is 7 and Emerson who is 4 years old. They are her reason to succeed. As of more than 10 years ago she has worked selling beer from her home. She also has a grocery store in order to reach a larger clientele. Macaria is in charge of properly stocking and supplying her business so that her neighbors can find everything they need there. In addition, she works decorating venues for various events and celebrations. She has a great deal of confidence in her work since she knows that in starting a business and attaining the necessary level of income for her family’s well being, it’s all a matter of creativity and effort. In the future Macaria wants to have a hair salon and she won’t rest until she has made this dream a reality.

This is her fourth loan with PRISMA Microfinance. She has experience in applying for individual loans and also group loans. With the money she is applying for she will buy greater quantities of cases of beer and will continue to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandice increase

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal N. is 28 years old,single.she lives in Nyarugenge district,kigali province ,capital of Rwanda.
she owns a small shop where she sells the spareparts since2008 and employs one person.
she opens his shop everyday from 6h00 AM to 5h00PM.

before doing this business he was not able to get all needs.
with this loan requested in vision finance company, he plans to expand his business in order to get more profits so that he will be able to change his life forever.

loans.use: purchasing more spare parts for sales

loans.name: Kasmiro

texts.en:
Kasmiro M. sells bread, toothpaste, sugar, small bags of salt, etc., at her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of sugar and salt to sell.  Kasmiro is 32 years old and is married to a peasant. She has six children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy spare parts for motor bikes to sell. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Elizabeth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns amd operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase new items for her retail store

location.town: Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
M. Munavvar is a bread maker. She has her own bakery in her house. With experience has come success in this business. She’s been able to succeed by diversifying her products. Munavvar makes white bread, sweet bread, buns and pastries. Munavvar’s immediate need is to acquire basic ingredients to continue baking bread. This is why she’s looking for support from IMON International, to obtain credit that will allow her to buy the ingredients she needs and continue her bakery business at home. With your support, you can improve the quality of life for Munavvar and her family and help her business grow and prosper. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase flour at wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Dolly Elena

texts.es:
La señora Dolly Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 40 años, 03 hijos y 02 de ellos aun dependen de ella.

Dolly Elena, mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, por iniciativa propia, decidió vender sus Juanes y anticuchos, se inicio desde muy joven por iniciativa propia y hoy lleva varios años, ejerciendo este tipo de actividad. Dolly Elena, todas las noches se dirige a su ambiente, donde atiende a sus clientes, ubicada a las afueras de su casa. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados. 

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas y tardes. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como: arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios para remplazar a sus utensilios antiguos, así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Dolly Elena, se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar más su restaurante al mismo tiempo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Dolly D. is a member of the Las Nazarenas Communal Bank in the Bellavista district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 40-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 3 children, 2 of whom are her dependents.

Dolly Elena, an enterprising and hard-working woman, took the initiative and decided to sell Juanes (rice, chicken, olives and an egg wrapped in a plantain leaf and parboiled) and anticuchos (grilled meat on skewers). She got her start in this business at a very young age and has now been in business for several years. Every night, Dolly Elena goes to her stand located outside her home where she attends to her patrons. She states that her daily sales are great because of the delicious flavor she adds to her dishes.

She currently runs this same business and is very satisfied with the works that she does day by day. She opens mornings and evenings. She personally attends to her customers with the charm that she is noted for.

With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase the ingredients that she needs to prepare her meals, such as: kilos of rice and sugar, cooking oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, crates of chickens, and vegetables. She will also invest some of the money in purchasing utensils in order to replace her old ones, thus providing better customer service.

Dolly Elena feels full of vitality and the desire to keep getting ahead. She has many goals and dreams in life, such as establishing her own restaurant. At the same time, she is also grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her launch her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for meal preparation

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La señorita Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Es estudiante y se dedica a la venta de sogas e instrumentos.
Celestina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar hilos, lana, nylon, guitarra, charango.
Su sueño para el futuro es seguir cantando y terminar de estudiar.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
. Celestina, 20, has been a member of the "Lupakas" communal bank in Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department for 3 years. She is single and has no children. She is a student and she sells ropes (cords) and musical instruments. Celestina tells us that her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement was used to increase her working capital. She now is requesting 1000 new soles to buy threads, wool, nylon, guitar and charango (small South American guitar, often made from armadillo shell). Her dream for the future is to continue singing and to finish her schooling. What she likes best about her communal bank is the get-togethers with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, nylon, guitar and charango (small South American guitar, often made from armadillo shell)

loans.name: Dios De Salvación Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dios de Salvación está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras las cuales varían según la temporada ellas son Katy María S. de 23 años, Fidelina del Carmen C.  de 37 años y Meyling del Carmen García de 27.

Ellas desde hace tiempo se dedican a está actividad y su mayor sueño es seguir progresando.
texts.en:
The Dios de Salvación ("God of Salvation") group is made up of three hard-working women who sell fruits and vegetables of various kinds according to the season. They are Katy María S., age 23; Fidelina del Carmen C., age 37; and Meyling del Carmen García, age 27. They have pursued this activity for some time now, and their greatest dream is to continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji H. is 45 years old and a widow. She has seven school-aged children. Keji is currently in the business of selling drugs in a pharmacy and is requesting a loan to stock more drugs to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a dispensary.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more drugs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy body lotions, perfume, beauty products

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial is 28 years old and married to Yohana. They have two children who live with them in Itá.
In the downtown area of Itá, Marcial rents a retail space where he buys, repairs and sells cell phones and cell phone accessories. He has been in this line of work for six years and has an established client base. Marcial opened his business with the help of his mother, a retired teacher. He has been working with Kiva partner, Fundación Paraguaya, since 2005. Marcial also teaches classes on cell phone repair in schools. Currently, he is seeking a loan to purchase cell phones and cell phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina D. is from the village of Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is widowed, and has three school-aged children. Celerina owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Celerina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Celerina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair her motorcycle in order to provide better service. This loan will be her seventh from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en:
Mrs. P. established a small family home four years ago in the middle of the best territory of the capital city of Phnom Penh, and she has given birth to seven children, two of whom are married. Three of her children are employed with different occupations: one is a vegetable vendor, one sells clams, and one is a building worker. 

Mrs. P. currently sells different kinds of vegetables in the market to earn a living, and her husband assists her in selling her produce. P. has a son who wants to get married and he needs to have a wedding party, but he doesn't have money. P. has requested a loan to allow her son to make a wedding party possible. (Mrs. P. was not available on this day, so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To make a wedding party possible

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks and items for baking snacks to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn B. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan Cotabato. She is 57 years old. Merlyn is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Pedro Vicente

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente C. C.   tiene 23 años, es soltero,   Vive en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Pedro Vicente trabaja en la agricultura como fuente principal  económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son: maíz, papas, trigo.   Vende los productos cada cosecha en diferentes lugares del país. 
Pedro Vicente  solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas,  abonos y fertilizantes  para sus sembrios.  Su meta es de mejorar la calidad del producto y su calidad de vida.  Los desafíos que enfrentan son que desearían que sus productos sean vendidos al productor no a los intermediarios. Pedro Vicente no ha realizado préstamos,  manifiesta que en sus tiempos sale a pasear a san Miguel.
texts.en:
Pedro Vicente C. C. is 23 and single. He lives in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar. He is a member of the San Francisco de Rumí Pamba Communal Bank. It is comprised of 25 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture. Pedro Vicente works in agriculture as his primary source of income for his family. The crops that excel in the area are corn, potatoes, and wheat. He sells those products from every harvest at different places in the country. Pedro Vicente is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and natural and chemical fertilizers for his plants. His goal is to improve the quality of the product and his quality of life. The challenge he faces is that he would like his products to be sold to the producer not to the intermediaries. Pedro Vicente has not had loans before. In his free time he goes walking to San Miguel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agricultural supplies like natural and chemical fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Mario Bolívar

texts.es:
Mario Bolívar B. V. tiene 59 años de edad y vive con su esposa y 6 hijos, Rodrigo (34), Narciza (30), Mirian (28), Blanca (26), Marlit (24) y Simon (22), en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Mario es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Se dedica a la agricultura como principal fuente de ingresos de su familia. Lo que produce es el maíz, fréjol, papas y legumbres, para consumo de su familia y venta. Ella vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Quito y realiza sus compras en San Miguel.
Mario solicita el préstamo para la agricultura, específicamente para la compra de insumos y pago de jornales. Piensa que el crédito la ayudará a mejorar su condición económica y a mejorar la calidad del producto. Su meta es comprar un terreno para aumentar sus cultivos y también mejorar su casa.  
Los desafíos que ella enfrente son condiciones climáticas que causan enfermedades en los cultivos.
A Mario le gusta pasear con su familia. La costumbre del cantón es el carnaval que se celebra con familiares  y amigos todos los años en el mes de febrero.
texts.en:
Mario Bolívar B. V. is 59 years old. He lives with his wife and their six children; Rodrigo (34), Narciza (30), Mirian (28), Blanca (26), Marlit (24), and Simon (22). They live in the town of San Miguel in the Bolívar province. Mario is a member of the Lotan Bajo Communal Bank. It is a half an hour from the town of San Miguel. There are 13 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture. Agriculture is the primary source of income for his family. He produces corn, kidney beans, and vegetables for family consumption and to sell. He sells his products at the wholesale market in Quito. He makes his purchases in San Miguel. Mario is requesting a loan for farming. Specifically, he will buy supplies and pay wages. He believes that the loan will help him improve his economic situation and improve the quality of his products. His goal is to buy a piece of land to increase his crops. He also wants to improve his house. The challenges he faces are the climate conditions that cause damage to his crops. Mario likes to take walks with his family. The Carnaval is a custom in the town. People celebrate with their families and friends every year in February.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and wages

loans.name: Lomeli

texts.es: Lomeli tiene 29 años, tiene un hijo y juntos viven en casa de sus padres. Hace mas de 2 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir como chalinas, guantes  y gorros, confeccionadas de lana y polar, prendas indispensables para soportar la temporada de invierno, vendiéndolos de manera ambulante en las ferias comerciales de su ciudad. Por otro lado trabaja de manera dependiente en una librería. Pero considera que el vender prendas de vestir le permite  tener más ingresos que benefician su economía. Su mayor anhelo es tener un local para su negocio. Esta es la quinta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP y sabe que éste aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería para confeccionar más prendas.
texts.en:
Lomeli is 29 years old and lives with her son at her parents’ house. For more than two years, she has been selling garments made of wool and fleece such as scarves, gloves, and caps that are needed to withstand the winter season. She sells these products as a traveling vendor at the trade fairs throughout the city. In addition to this business, Lomeli also works as a bookstore clerk. She started selling clothes so that she could have more income to help with her finances. Her greatest wish is to have a store from which to operate her business.

This is the fifth time she has received a loan from MFP. Lomeli knows the loan will be useful in advancing her business. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to increase her inventory of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Magda Ivania

texts.es:
La señora Magda Ivania S., es una adulta mayor de 65 años soltera con un hijo mayor de edad con capacidades especiales, ella se dedica a elaborar Manualidades, desde hace 8 años se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos.

Fue con el dinero de su jubilación que comenzó su pequeño negocio, ha tenido problemas de cancelación de las ordenes de trabajo que ha realizado, este ha sido un problema para ella debido a que no ha podido recuperar lo invertido en su negocio razón por la cual le a obstaculizado el crecimiento de su negocio, a futuro comprara una vitrina donde las elaboraciones se aprecien mas, con este préstamo adquirirá  una mayor variedad de materiales que le permitan aumentar sus elaboraciones y le aumente sus ventas para el mejor beneficio de su economía y la de su hijo que le demanda muchos gastos y atenciones debido a su condición especial.
texts.en:
Magda Ivania S., 65, is an older adult. She has an adult, special needs son. She makes handicrafts and this has been her source of income for the past 8 years. She used her retirement funds to start her small business but she has had problems with the cancelation of orders for work she has completed; this has been a problem for her because she has been unable to recuperate the investment she put into her business. This has been an obstacle to growth. In the future she’d like to buy a display case where her creations will show more favorably. She will use this loan to buy a greater assortment of materials to increase her production thereby increasing sales so that she and her son’s economy will improve because his special circumstances create many expenses and needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.
